description:
I've been coming here before I even knew about Yelp so I'm giving a 5-star from when I went here for 5 years but apparently it's gone downhill.
So here is my humble opinion the owner was always nice and had the food done the away I liked it the Cook's always cook the perfect hot and fresh and i loved their homemade fries from real potatoes. 
But the last time I was here in 2008 before I got on Yelp it was a different cook and cashier who was rude and I never went back there because the food did not taste right and I'm very picky about my food, so if you fuck up on my food then it's bye Felicia and I won't come back. 
Thanks for reading my big mouth review. ~Lizzie~
author: Lizzie G.

description:
Great burgers that come with thick cut fries (although a tad soggy when ordered delivered). The guys loved the classic that was juicy but the girls thought their greek and green salads with grilled chicken was a tad bland. 

Not bad for $11 a burger so definitely great for the pocket. Great selection of burgers too and cater for those that don't eat meat.
author: Carmen P.

description:
Their oil is old, old, old. Everything fried is very dark brown.

The hamburger was okay. But I'm tired of spending my money for places that are only so so in what they put out. 

Wouldn't order from here again.
author: N'olo J.

description: The hangover burger is my favorite. Make sure to order a milkshake, they're the best. Staff is always friendly and nice
author: AJ D.

description:
This is my fav burger spot in SF. They have everything from beef burgers to salmon burgers. I personally love the turkey burger. I dress mine up with the standard lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, onions, and add an onion ring for crunch. I also request BBQ sauce to create my own BBQ burger. 
It's a great burger stop, whether dining in or taking it to go.
author: Isis M.

description:
I didn't try a burger, but these guys have THE BEST french fries I've had in a long time. Granted, I like mine "well-done." Some of you pasty fry people may call them "burned." They're just brown though, and brown is beautiful.
Very reasonable prices too. A big bag of fries is $2.50. Kind of a hole in the wall, but they have some good beer on tap and a TV to watch a game. Not a bad place to hang out, and a nice break from the general pretentiousness in the area. No pretenses here.
author: Colin G.

description:
Yeh, you're gonna get a whole mouthful of flavah here.  Think In-N-Out Xtra large.  Seasoned patty, melty cheese, lettuce, pickles, red onion and juicy tomato - on a buttered, grilled bun.  Take a big, fat bite of that!

Plenty of toppings and protein or veg choices.  They've got fish and chips, too.  Sides of regular fries, sweet potatoes fries or coleslaw round out your meal.

If you want salads, they got em.  Greek salad topped with warm, freshly grilled chicken, had the right mix of acidic, sweet and salty, with plenty of crunchy cucumber, feta, red onion and Kalamata olives.
author: Sondra H.

description: Good burger,  fries are fresh made. Kinda pricy though, they have a good looling menu
author: Chef C.

description: This place is so gross. Everything but the burgers is terrible and the burgers themselves are sort of O.K. I live really close by so I have given them numerous chances and regret it every time. Their fries are stale, soggy, and often cold. The salad is a joke: the lettuce is white and tastes like paper, the tomatoes are not even red and look a week old. The cucumber is limp and vaguely bitter. The salad came as takeout via Grubhub and when I went back to ask for a refund bc it was so terrible, they said to contact Grubhub (I understand that's how it should work technically but may be try and make your customer happy when the issue is a $12 spoiled salad). The medium rare burger I asked for will come out well done, practically blackened, and so very dry. Other times it's alright, closer to medium. We literally live on the same block as them and a delivery order (I don't know why my bf this was a good idea instead of just walking over) once took over 40 mins. Seriously, don't waste your money. The 3 star average rating is generous.
author: She F.

description: Food was super good although my boyfriend's bun was hard and stale. The woman who took our our order acted as if she had better things to do. Because of the E. Coli outbreak I wanted to see where their lettuce was from and all she said was "Costco". I explained to the issue to see if they would check and see what region of the US and she wouldn't. It was a number because I was going to get two burgers and a salad and ended up with just two burgers. I suggest that as a restaurant they pay attention to important things like that. If someone were to get sick they could get shut down and that would be a shame. Their food is too good for that!
author: Angelea R.

description: Honestly, this burger was just not good. I had the turkey burger, and I was barely able to eat any of it bc there was just no taste. It was also extremely oily. I did eat it at an event where they used a delivery surface, so there's a chance the burger may have been better fresh, but still, the flavor of the meat just wasn't very good.
author: Sonia S.

description:
I've been going to this Big Mouth location since I was a 6th grader. I absolutely love it! The burgers are juicy, tasty, and overall a treat (I'm personally a fan of the Big Mouth Burger). 
This location is smaller than the Millbrae one (which unfortunately closed down recently), but has a chill atmosphere with one tv which is usually on and w a low volume. 
This is my go-to burger place and I highly recommend.
author: Cynthia M.

description: Ordered on grubhub and 2 milkshakes were missing upon delivery.  Also missing were the garlic fries listed with the Giants burger.  Lastly, my kid's hotdog came with onion, pickles, lettuce and tomato.  Who puts that on a kids hotdog?  Between the onion/pickle tasting hot dog and missing milkshake, my kid was in tears!
author: Ellie F.

description:
I ordered a salmon Caesar Salad along with a burger for my boyfriend. I have been here a couple of times and have never ordered a salad before. We ordered to go.

First of all I was expecting an actual piece of salmon but unfortunately all they do is slice the salmon patty they use for the burger.

Now let me get to the horrible and disgusting part...
I ended up taking out all the salmon patty and then I was mixing in the dressing when.. a live small cockroach came crawling out of the box the salad came in. There was also a small piece of black plastic that was mixed in there.

I have never ever experienced something like this before. It was so disgusting that my boyfriend couldn't even finish his burger either. I really liked coming here for the burgers, unfortunately because of this issue I am never coming here again. 

Goodbye Big Mouth Burger!
author: Sandra C.

description:
Note: one star off only because they won't do delivery over the phone (you have to use some dumb app :/).

Big Mouth burgers are the BOMB.  They give you lots of options with your order and provide fresh cut thick potato fries the way...your french mom used to make(?)  BBQ sauce is always tasty and thank Gawd they actually give you a decent sized meal for the price (unlike anything else in SF these days, womp womp).

the place itself is a bit of a hole-in-the-wall but the people at the counter are very nice and the chefs in back is always working their ass off to bring you a kickass meal.

Show them a little love in the tip jar.
author: Thomas T.

description: My dad and I walked into this place and we were so hungry and we were ready to eat a delicious burger. The burgers looked good, the fries looked good, but the RAT looking at me DID NOT look good! You heard me right! Not even a minute spent in the restaurant and we spotted a rat! Remy from Ratatouille was on top of the rangehood right next to the menu ready to take our order! My dad pointed, and said "Eww, there is a rat!" The cashier looked over and saw the rat, but didn't even seem concerned and kind of brushed it off! We left instantly. We were in and out like In-N-Out Burger Lol! A really horrible, and unpleasant experience that I will never forget. I'm not trying to be a BIG MOUTH, but I'm just keeping it real.
author: Paolo Q.

description: Recently ordered food for delivery and to my surprise everything was delicious.  I normally wouldn't order hamburgers for delivery because my assumption of the bread becoming soggy or the meat not being hot. However; I was so wrong or food was perfect and no soggy buns were had.  The burgers were fresh and sweet potato fries and dipping sauce too were excellent.  I will definitely be ordering from here again. And my overall delivery experience was perfect and b.c actually came earlier than the time given
author: Lila N.

description: I ordered a LUNCH meal through Uber Eats from this location (so I thought).  It took 1 hour and 4 minutes to arrive.  If I caught the bus to the location and back, it would not have taken an hour!  So, wfinally hen the driver got here, I asked where did you come from? He said San Bruno!!!  Why in the world would I order a LUNCH meal from a San Bruno location and I work Downtown SF????  Needless to say, the food was cold when it finally got here AND to add insult to injury, it WAS NOT EVEN WHAT I ORDERED! It was someone else's order...smh.  I will NEVER order from them again nor will I use Uber Eats again.  Signed...Still hungry.
author: Annie W.

description: This place is the way to go. I always get the 49er burger. It's actually a chicken breast , which I prefer on a wheat bun. The fries aren't frozen they're definitely fresh cut. This is the place to go if you like flame grilled. Always a treat.
author: Larry S.

description: Their food is really good it taste natural their fries are awesome well the regular ones anyway I haven't tried any other kinds . I'm a cheese head so I know good cheese wen I taste it and they had good thick slices
author: Kieanas L.

description:
One star services from start to finish.
The letuce on one of my burgers was TOO soggy. That wasnt the only thing soggy, so were the Onion rings on my burger.
When i asked for ketchup the cashier had 4 in her hand and only put 3 out of 4. That wasnt enough ketchup to begin with then she takes one back...
author: Miss M.

description: They have good fries! Burger isn't bad. I've only had the blue cheese burger here and it's not that bad. A good place in the area
author: Nessa H.

description:
When To Go To Big Mouth Burgers:

1) You want some fresh air and "only in the Mission" people watching.

2) You want a healthy Garden Burger. (Forgot to get the wheat bun though. D'oh!) 

3) He wants a "Hangover Burger" with egg, bacon and cheese (which he enjoys despite the lack of hangover). 

4) You don't mind kissing your resolution to eat healthy good bye with some serious garlic breath. (Garlic fries, yes. Mediocre onion rings, nope.)

5) You're in a milkshake mood but are too lazy to go down the street to Mitchell's. #MissionIceCreamProblems
author: Amy C.

description: The burgers are good. But, the customer service sucked (were openly rude after they made a mistake on an order and gave one of my burgers to someone else.) also, it's overly priced. ($3 for a slice of cheese) Even for San Francisco. I might come back eventually but definitely am turned off by the lack of professionalism.
author: Luke E.

description: Best burger I've had in pretty long time. Nice employees too. Good sweet potato fries.
author: Grayson Z.

description: This is my go to spot when I'm in the neighborhood. Perfect service, amazing food, and always a good choice.
author: Tamara R.

description:
Service: very nice and friendly, didn't wait long for the food, the girl didn't rush me and she was very sweet. The cook was also nice. 

Food: very tasty and cooked well. Fries were really good. I got the leafs meal burger and it felt like a regular meal which was a plus because I spent less. Glass that all orders comes with a side and you don't have to pay separately. Def coming back !!! 

Boyfriend said the bathroom was not appealing though.
author: Tyler G.

description: The 49er chicken sandwich was great! Thick, hot and moist! Minus one star for the super greasy, semi-burnt fries. A change of the fryer oil is definitely called for! The wait seemed rather long for there to be only one person waiting for an order (me!). Then, a woman came in to claim a pretty large (phoned-in?) order so, it became clear why the cook was preoccupied. Minus one star for the cashier who looked like she would rather be somewhere else! Smiling to a customer matters!
author: Tony B.

description:
Ordered delivery --

Burger was flavorless and huge but the biggest disappointment was the fries. They were flavorless, dry, and clearly old.
author: Ri R.

description:
Food was decent, but service horrible. The cashier lady did not pay attention to my order both my orders were wrong i had to wait another 15 min to get my meal. Not once did she make eye contact
Very unprofessional
author: brock l.

description:
Some broad came in here stupid little dog. It was upsetting some other people so they said something. I was not too into it either, and I like dogs. 
So the lady says that it's a service dog, she looked like some hipster rando that thinks she is better than everyone else. I doubt it was a service dog, she was just being a jerk. I can't stand those types. Nor do I like my burger with stray dog hair. 
I usually enjoy eating here, but not today.
author: Jorge P. G.

description: Good size burger patties, but both the burgers and fries often feel overcooked (like, borderline burned). It's also in sort of a rough location, and the restaurant itself feels tiny and cramped. Big Mouth Burgers isn't bad at all (the teriyaki burger is good, mostly because the pineapple and sauce seem to compensate for the dryness of the patty), but there are better burger places out there.
author: Erik B.

description:
The burger was a solid standard American burger. It was pretty good but there was nothing phenomenal about it. I trusted the reviews and opted for the kid size burger. It was definitely enough for me! 

The reason for my two stars is the garlic fries. It was honestly the worst fries I've ever eaten. Stale, soggy and lacking in flavor. I was so disappointed given the positive reviews on the garlic fries. Needless to say, the fries went uneaten. I really hate wasting food and even if the fries were mediocre, I would still eat them. But they were sooo bad, I threw them out.
author: Samantha S.

description: Best tasting burger in town that I've had. Garlic fries are awesome. I'm going back to Big Mouth, remembering the Morrissey song, because Burger Meister has changed their buns. LOL. Should have stuck with your buns. See you on the weekends.
author: Irving S.

description:
Second time eating here. First time I ate here it was great. Today, my second time, i ordered 2 burgers, regular fries and garlic fries. 

Half done with my burger and garlic fries I see small pieces of paper inside the bag of the garlic fries. I read the label and it reads, "not eat". Once I read that I stop eating take the pictures and throw it away.
author: Gilbert B.

description: If I could give this place no stars I would, just ordered the big mouths burger and let me tell you. I've never had a burger this bad in my life and I'm not exaggerating! The burger was so black and burnt and also dry. The cook has no idea what he's doing even the fries were burnt like come on man you see the black burnt patty and you still serve it? Never coming here again!
author: Carlos A.

description: Ordered the grilled chicken sandwich (which comes with pesto) with a side salad. Salad was Caesar and a little bland. Sandwich smelled good like backyard BBQ grilled chicken but flavor was bland and it desperately needed sauce. I added mayo which helped tremendously but still pretty bland. Chicken was cooked perfectly. My friend got a burger and said it was just ok.
author: Tish M.

description: I've been to this place twice and the last time I was there I had the most terrible service AND food!!!! The cashier was very rude and gave us the most terrible customer service! I was also looking forward on having some garlic fries but they served that just as terrible! The fries were soaked in oil and it was burnt! wasted $30 on this place. NEVER GOING BACK!
author: Marish R.

description: There are moments when you just crave a big burger with all the goodies -- cheese, bacon, tomato, lettuce, with good fries -- with enough grease to give real flavor.  This was the moment I ordered two burgers for myself and a friend.  Fast delivery.  Matched expectations, though I suspect the bacon was key to giving the extra flavor.  Will order again when the burger-urge strikes -- probably next month.
author: Bill N.

description:
The burgers are great! The place isn't the best looking and wouldn't be a nice spot to invite someone, but the food is really good.
I have tried the Texan, blue cheese, and few of their chicken sandwiches. They also have onion rings, fries and sweet potato fries. All are great.
The also serve smoothies and a very small selection of beer.
author: Jad A.

description:
i went to get a burger today, even though their health score is sometimes pretty low.
the girl at the counter looked up when i came in and then looked back down and continued doing whatever she was doing. no "hello" no "i will be right with you", no nothing.
she finally finished and then just looked at me.  still didnt say hi, didnt ask me if i was ready or if she could take my order.  just stood there.  so i ordered.  the only words she uttered were the price.  didnt ask if i wanted a receipt.  didnt say thank you. no smile. nothing.
finally, my order is ready and instead of bringing it out to me like ever other person has ever done the numerous other times i have gone there she just sets it on the counter and mumbles that its ready.
guess what.................. order was wrong.
i'll still go back because i like the food but she should consider a job where she doesnt have to deal with people.
author: beth m.

description:
Any burger that has an egg on it is pretty much guaranteed to be hit in my book! The hangover burger was just that! 

I'm glad yelp directed me to this yummy destination! The options here are pretty diverse with some standard options and some creative ones as well. 

The best part about this place was the names of the burgers. The Joe Biden burger was a funny one. That would have Swiss cheese and jalapeno peppers. 

Like a said before I have a hangover burger which had bacon and eggs. My friend had the Giants burger with garlic fries. If I come back here again I may have to try that one out! Another burger that was tried by when my friends was the pesto burger. That one looks pretty great too!

The restaurant itself is not particularly nice inside and there are certain things about it that don't make sense. For instance, the water placement. But those things aside this is a great little hole in the wall burger joint that really delivers a good product.
author: Jon G.

description: Great food. Small dining area (about 24 seats plus tables outside). Custom burgers, nice thick patties. The garlic fries were really good. Three or four beers on tap. Perfect place for a friendly lunch
author: The P.

description: Very Good place, the fries where amazing and the burgers mouthwatering !! Burgers are huge so either get a kids or go with a big appetite !! Most definitely going back !!
author: William H.

description: I've had much better burgers and fries. Both the taste and quality of the burger and fries were lackluster, especially considering the price.  The place was also pretty dirty - there were only 2 other customers in the restaurant when I arrived, but I couldn't find a clean table to sit at.
author: Matthew P.

description:
Big Mouth Burger definitely lives up to its name. Those burgers are pretty darn big! I barely finished half my burger before I threw in the towel. Ordered the Blue Cheese burger, which comes with a creamy glob of blue cheese on the patty. Talk about being intense. That cheese will be all up in your business! The burger patty itself could have been juicier. I would have preferred medium and it was on the well-done side. I opted to upgrade my fries to garlic status for a couple dollars more and it was a good decision! Steak fries coated in garlic, parsley, and olive oil. Yummy! I realized after that blue cheese and garlic probably weren't the best of combinations...I had some pretty funky breath after. Good thing I wasn't on a date! 

Try the onion rings if you can! They have a crispy exterior with a soft onion in the middle that doesn't get dragged out into the cold after one bite. 

Service could use some work. I was met with no greeting or smile from the girl at the register and she was on her smartphone the entire time we were there. I guess I shouldn't have been surprised our table was still dirty from the previous customers.

Decent burgers at reasonable prices and there are plenty of choices. Big Mouth isn't a destination spot, but a good option if you're in the neighborhood!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
For years this place was one of my favorites, but now I can not say more that is the worst of burgers. I bought a "Hawaiian burger" and omg that disgusting. The lettuce looked old, the french fries so nasty, disgusting and old I WILL NEVER BUY ANYTHING IN THIS PLACE. I am so sorry because now the restaurant on the outside looks so dirty. They have neglected this place a lot. I do not know if they care but I have been a customer that they have lost

Durante años este lugar fue uno de mis favoritos, pero ahora no puedo decir más que es lo peor de hamburguesas. Compré una "hamburguesa hawaiana" y omg que asqueroso. La lechuga parecía vieja, las patatas fritas tan desagradable, repugnante y viejo que nunca comprar nada en este lugar. Lo siento, porque ahora el restaurante en el exterior parece tan sucia. Han descuidado este lugar mucho. No sé si se preocupan, pero he sido un cliente que han perdido
author: Tifanny C.

description:
Great Burgers! Great Fries! Great Beer! Great Kids menu!
Awesome, will be back!
Could use a jukebox or a pinball machine would be the only suggestion ...
author: Scundy B.

description: They are always so nice. Have never had a bad experience here. Order is ready promptly. Great & nice customer service.
author: Goddess D.

description: They're trying really hard, and they have so many condiments. I think this would be my favorite restaurant and hangout if I were on Peace Corps in a small town in Honduras. However, we're in San Francisco, and it was not memorable for me. They should salt the meat.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Great burgers. I really stand behind this place, even in this new burger boom when theres so many places to go out and get a specialty burger.

Don't even THINK about showing up after a quarter till 10 though. They've closed down, shuttered the windows, and are conspicuously eyeing the customers, giving them the sign to leave. You'll get no food, nothing. Not even an excuse or apology.
author: Chyllo S.

description:
My faith in the burger universe has been restored, many times have I been let down by places who had my hopes up high only to mess the burger up while actually serving it up, this place definitely delivered.

I ordered the Warriors burger, it's got a fresh juicy patty with some gorgeous amount of pastrami resting on top of it, Swiss cheese, grilled onions and their secret home made sauce which was tangy sweet barbecue tasting but better.

The meat was cooked perfectly, the pastrami had that east coast chewiness but also was very tender, the veggies were fresh, I'm not sure where they get those pickles from but those had to be some of the crispiest fresh pickles I've ever had. I also appreciated the generous amount of cheese that stretched like a mozzarella stick would, absolutely gorgeous.

They also give you a precious amount of onion rings that were like no other, I'm a huge fan of this place now, I will tell everyone of this wonderful establishment in San Francisco for as long as I live.
author: Miguel A.

description:
The selection for great burgers in San Francisco is nearly as venerable as the selection for farm to table fine dining. When it comes to the search of cheap burgers - well, the list shrinks and doesn't always look that cheap. Big Mouth tows the line of affordability and quality - and not just in the Mission either. The burger seems more and more like a throwback when compared to the chef driven burgers that dominate the scene these days but any chef would appreciate a 1/2 pound of USDA Prime Chuck cooked to a juicy Medium Rare. 

Perhaps even more compelling is the fact that these burger joints may soon go the way of the dinosaur as the latest Tech Boom is showing some long time residents the door to make way for a new wave of elite eateries for the new uber wealthy. In this sense, Big Mouth isn't just Bang for your Burger Buck but also a taste of a "Vanishing San Francisco".

Full story and mouth watering burger porn pics here: http://bangforyourburgerbuck.com/big-mouth-burgers-san-francisco-ca/
author: Ali K.

description:
My Son and I split the Big Mouth burger. Oh, so good! The grease just runs down your arms. The bun was fresh and the meat was seasoned to perfection. The fries were hearty and fresh from the fryer.

Great stop-off for a good burger just off the 24th & Mission stop.
author: Elisa A.

description:
I loved it, the fries where well season very strong garlic  at least that's the way i like it,

I've had the regular burgers which is meh, a burger is going to taste like a burger you know?!

I normally order the giant burger  great taste and flavor also comes with a price to match,

could be lower but meh it is a pretty big fat burger enough to fill me!

my overall experience was great i still continue to go their when i feel like garlic fries and a burger!
author: Dylan C.

description:
Holy giant burgers!! This place has pretty giant foods. 

I came here for take-out, on my way out to downtown. It was on the way for me, and I was kinda hungry. On my way out to downtown on the bus, a person commented on how good the food smelled. I nearly ate the thing on the bus.

I don't think it was great transported. The fries got soggy and were really dry...and she gave me like, 3 packets of ketchup for 3 full orders of fries. Seriously!? Whats with the lack of sauce, people?!

I got the Giants burger, which was really nicely done. I got it mid-rare, and they KNOW WHAT THAT MEANS. Omg. This is a big deal for me. A lot of places I go to give me mid-well for mid-rare. Really? Does well sound like rare?! 

Ordered online, and it was confusing for the staffer. In all fairness, I wrote that I was going to pay in cash, when in reality I wanted to pay with card at the location. That was a little weird to them, I guess. But it worked out. Staff here seem to be a little more local, which is always nice.
author: Lily W.

description:
Finally, stepped foot inside this place.

We had their big mouth burger on gluten-free bun, with onion rings and a strawberry milkshake.  

Burger was moist, full of flavor.  And I'm a fan of the gluten-free bun (it's not so filling!) (Around $8, and add $1.75 for GF bun)

Onion rings were okay. 

Strawberry milkshake = win.  Mitchell's Strawberry Ice Cream. Need I say more?

Prices = moderate. Burgers $9-12.  Sides were around $4-5. We shared everything for under $20.00.  

Service = friendly.

Seating = small dining area, and two tables outside.  It's a bit dark inside.  We chose to sit outside as it was nearing sunset and turning out to be a clear night.
author: Fannie S.

description: Terrible food..the burger patty had no taste whatsoever. Yes, you can lather it with chipotle sauce. But cant change the meat!
author: Shital R.

description:
After a dismal experience at Mo's the week before, my girlfriend and I decided to try again. This time, we weren't looking for a fancy burger with frills or anything; we were looking for a dirty burger that would satisfy that quintissential American need for meat on a grill.

The interior reminds me of an old 70s diner (not that I was alive to experience one -- I was born in the 90s). Rustic and kind of dingy paint job with rickety tables. I dig the feel.

My girlfriend played it safe and ordered the Big Mouth Burger, which is a quality burger that's clean and did her good. Being the adventerous warrior I am, I went a little further and ordered the Giants Burger. Let me tell you something -- the name isn't just homage to the baseball team down the road; it's actually giant. The patty is thick and is layered with cheese and lies under two onion rings that are both about a full inch thick and about as wide as the patty. The top bun has a slathering of BBQ sauce. By the time you throw on the lettuce, tomato, and red onions, you're looking at a burger that stands a full 5" high. Needless to say, I had a pretty tough job getting that sucker in my mouth.

But when I did, it was SO worth it. The patty is cooked to perfection and really explodes with flavor and juice. The onion rings are probably some of the best I've ever had. Crispy, large, and seasoned amazingly! Absolutely perfect! Combined with the BBQ sauce, and they've got something really really good going. One thing to take note of, they should really consider renaming it to "Cardiac Arrest Burger". Remember how I talked about wanting to get a dirty burger? Well this is it. I could definitely feel my arteries fill with fat and all the Big Mouth goodness with every bite.

The burger also comes with a side of garlic fries, which my girlfriend and I personally thought were way too garlic-y and oily. Could definitely do without that distraction. If anything, they probably go way too far.

Big Mouth Burger isn't for the weak of heart -- literally. 

Eat on, champion.
author: Zi-on C.

description: This place has TERRIBLE customer service. Tried to order from them online and they use EATS24 which then outsources to bicycle delivery messengers. Our order took an hour and a half. We weren't able to get any viable intel on what was causing the issue and when we were checking with here the woman working rudely hung up on my wife mid phone call. Save yourself the trouble of wasting your time here.
author: Dave C.

description:
Got food poisoning the last time I went here for a caesar chicken salad. I went in one more time after just to make sure it was there, but really its the only thing I had that day besides coffee and a biscotti.
I saw the cook use the same tongs to remove the chicken from the grill after he cooked it as he used to pull the chicken out of the marinade. Really you need to use a different tong to pull the meat off so there is no cross contamination.
author: Rondi K.

description:
Good spot!  I enjoyed the house salad with chicken. I loved that the chicken was freshly grilled and served hot on top of the salad.

My fiancé enjoyed his oriental chicken salad, too.

The service was a bit slow - it took a while for our salads to arrive.  

The staff was warm and friendly.

Props to this place for having a diverse menu of burgers, sandwiches, and salads, with plenty of healthy options!
author: Barnali D.

description:
Big Mouth Burger is good at one thing, and excellent at another.

AS A BURGER PLACE: It's decent. Burgers are big enough and there are a lot of different options to choose from. Garlic, pesto, teriyaki...it's all there. The burger itself though doesn't have a lot of flavor though, meaning that the condiments have to do most of the work.

AS A SIDE PLACE: Fan-freakin'-tastic. Their french fries are crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. That is next to impossible to pull off, but they did it with panache. I can't wait to try out their onion rings next -- they look just as good.
author: Casey S.

description:
Looking for burgers in our current area can be a little tough as most are chains, however, Big Mouth Burgers makes them fresh and HUGE!

Half pound of meat with lots of veggies on the side and a big stack of fries (regular, garlic or sweet potato) included on the side. Prices are not too bad at around $10 bucks for the amount of food you get and the patties are juicy. I only wish they served thinner cut fries but not a biggie.

Lastly, service is friendly and a major place is that they serve my favorite Mighty Leaf tea's in case you're not feeling like plain old water or soda or in my case, have a sore throat. They even have a side of honey! 

Yep, will be back!
author: Petra S.

description:
One of the best burger joints in San Francisco! If you appreciate a good, quality burger, you won't be disappointed. Many restaurants, or other burger joints may have a decent burger, but Big Mouth has perfected it. Although, you'll have some grease, it's not unbearable like most places and is just right for the natural taste of what an actual burger should taste like.

If you're a burger connoisseur you won't be disappointed!
author: Joshua N.

description:
They weren't kidding around when they named this place Big Mouth--those are some pretty burgers they make ova ther.

The onion rings were huge too, and So* good when dipped in the cool cheese dressing. Mmmm cheese dressinnnng.

$10 for a burger and onion rings is definitely not cheap, but they didn't hold back when packing the burgers with lettuce onions and tomatoes. 

The place is usually opened late, with lots of rooms inside, so it's a great place to stop by after drinking in nearby bars, or if you're in the mood for some big burgers.
author: Henry L.

description: Delicious but they forgot the cheese in my burger, which was extra $, as well as the toppings, but otherwise good
author: Mabel J.

description:
Excellent choice. Burgers are good with very nice receipts 
I recommend it a lot.  Price are ok.  Service is also good
author: David R.

description:
I don't love everything on the menu, but that's why they have options. 

The onion rings are great, but I usually can't eat a whole order + burger by myself, so it works for sharing-- I'm not 100% sold on the fries so I usually spend the extra dollar to sub out for the onion rings (though... I don't get why those are more expensive). 

My favorites are the falafel burger or the 49er (but sub BBQ sauce for the pesto). 

Little known fact: if burgers aren't your thing (I've never met anyone who could eat both) they have a decent selection of Mitchell's ice cream with which to make tasty milkshakes-- or a root beer float made with root beer on draft!

A final word of warning: this is a messy (but delicious!) endeavor, and this isn't Burger King so it takes some time. Even the napkins in the bag get soaked when I take it a few blocks home, so make sure you're well-stocked and not wearing your favorite dry-clean-only outfit. The buns can also get a little soggy with all that juice, so fortune favors quick or fork/knife eaters.
author: Krista L.

description:
Best fries I've had in my life, and I mean literally, I've traversed the globe. But this is a burger joint and to be fair, the burgers are a little disappointing. It's all about the patty. Some scienx: the meat to burger ratio was off - the patty was just not thick enough. After reading other reviews I expected to be overwhelmed by the size, but I was let down. And the texture - far too gritty, I don't want to be sea added by a chorus of arthritic cow knuckles when chewing down. Relentlessly sawing at my teeth. And if we are getting technical: the bun needs to be real brioche, not this long-life mass-packet stuff. But other than that, I'd say they are pretty decent, they use all the right toppings at least. 

It's like the Burger King is the frontman in a jazz ensemble, trying to reach those soothing low notes with his gritty vocals. Something isn't quite right.
author: Andrea F.

description:
So good! I ordered a hangover and garlic fries; the burger was HUGE and super tasty and the garlic fries were so good and tasty! 

You have to go with a empty stomach to eat all the burger! There's no space for a dessert   Hahaha.
author: Vanessa J.

description:
Very disappointed. ...


I've eaten at other big mouth burgers before and had a wonderful experience.  The one on Mission st in SF should be aboided. The place looks grimy and is very expensive for the quality of the food. The root bear float was terrible. A scoop of grocery store quality ice cream in a plastic cup and a can of toot beer. Thus was very dissapointing.
author: Octavio D.

description:
I had the eponymous burger here, and it was totally...fine. Nothing to phone home and rouse the relatives about, but for a decent price point and some half pound of cow, it's not bad. 

Fries were great, and the cole slaw wasn't too mayo heavy. 

You have a choice of many condiments (roasted garlic, sun-dried tomato aioli, etc.), and there's usually plenty of space to eat in.

Milkshakes here use Mitchell's ice cream.

Right by 24th street BART!
author: Kevin L.

description: Decent burger.  Not great... not bad... totally A-OK.  Had the Giants Burger with garlic fries and thought it was good.  Would come back if was in the area and really craving a burger, or have a hangover, but won't go out of my way.
author: Zoran L.

description: I have lived in San Francisco my entire life and hardly a day goes by that I don't crave a hamburger and so after more than half a century I'm pretty sure I know where all the best places are but let me tell you I had missed this one! The hamburgers that were served at our table for friends were all unique and mouth-watering! I had the blue cheese burger and the only place I ever like that is at the ramp and they really put a different spin on it! I have to also stop and commend the staff the young lady who took care of us was just exemplary when it comes to customer service and customer satisfaction! She waited on us hand and foot and I have to say thank you. We had a great time, the food was excellent and the staff /employees were over and above board! Thank you
author: Jim S.

description:
Gotta sayyy it was a pretty dang big burger! I just got a classic burger from the kids menu, your average hamburger. Asked for extra lettuce and tomatoes. 

It was only around 5-6 and i received a big mouthful with freshly cooked potato wedges. I completely inhaled the burger. It was pretty good for a quick meal dinner no lie. I'm very picky with burger joints though and this place was just aight. But maybe i need to give their more extravagant burgers a try. They all sounded pretty yums.
author: Kaitlyn E.

description: Horrible!!!! I got this delivered. I ordered a ceaser salad. They put the dressing on there so when it arrived it was soggy. I also ordered to kids sliders with no onions. I received one big burger with onions and no cheese. The burger was burnt and tasted gross. The top bun was super hard and the bottom bun was soggy. Never again. That was a waste of money.  I didn't even eat it. Get it together guys. There's a million other burger joints out there people can chose from
author: Dani G.

description: I'm vegan and was surprised to see on the Manu vegan burgers,  what I got had mayonnaise on it, after arguing with the lady  they replaced my meal with another dish that wasn't vegan as well,  had to just leave the place without eating.
author: Ohad C.

description:
This is such a late review. 

I went here on 2015.05.30 with some friends from South Korea. Its a small place, almost hidden away. I've had a tough time finding places that have perfect onion rings, and I think I found my go-to place in the city. Its fairly priced, and you definitely get what you paid for & more. Their food is sooo yummy. Just remember, if you like cheese on your burger be sure to tell them. Still, it was super good. This is a place I would frequent if I still lived in San Francisco.

For anyone whose deciding between their fries & their onion rings, GET THE ONION RINGS. You'll thank me later.
author: Maria G.

description: Hangover burger is delicious. Their fries are homemade and delicious as well. Costs $14 which isn't cheap but its a good quality, heavy duty serving of food. More of a treat-yo-self burger than an everyday burger haha
author: Mark T.

description: Great place to stop for a very good and big hamburger. The burgers are made to order and are very tasteful.  They have several different types of burgers to choose from with a variety of toppings.  Everyone in my group all got a different type of burger and we all loved them. They also have other items on the menu, and they even serve beer, which was a surprise.
author: Jeffrey G.

description:
- food: solid, working-class burger
- atmosphere: t-shirt casual
- staff: usually pretty friendly
- price: cheap if you can refrain from the extras

additional info:
- always get the onion rings over the fries
author: J. B.

description:
Lo and behold, in the mist of the slow but sure yuppie-fication of a neighborhood I grew up in.  A nice burger spot is here among the tartare eating, Perrier drinking crowds who have taken over this area.  It's Tuesday night, I'm still rubbing my eyes from my afternoon nap.  I need a place I can just throw on my bummy jeans and my baseball cap. A place I can watch a little NBA game while I eat. Where I can drink out of a can like I do at home.

Big Mouth burger is that place where you can be comfortable, nobody here is gonna be pulling your chair out for you.  Many burger choices to tickle your burger fancy.  Salmon burgers, chicken burgers, vegetarian burgers, and of course what you really should get if your going to a burger spot, ground beef.  

I had a hangover burger. That is a fried egg with bacon on top of the burger. Really? Is there any better way than to go over the top?  I mean if I wanted a normal boring burger, I'd go to In-N-Out.  No. Give me a cholesterol filled, artery clogging bundle of joy to wrap my hands on and stuff my face with.  Along with that I had onion rings, the best I've had in a long time.  

And just in case guilt of your high calorie meal hasn't hurt your conscience, there's the always delicious sweet Mitchells ice cream to refresh you after your savory burger. A pretty good dinner for a tuesday night if you ask me.
author: Michael L.

description:
Big mouth! Classic burger joint in the mission district. You can't go wrong with a nice patty, and some potatoes cut fries. Great services, beers on tap, and two tv's for viewing. This is a laid back neighborhood spot and you'll feel good eating here. Nice selection, chicken sandwich, salads, vegan burger, etc...

Tip: if you're not looking to munch down on a big mouth burger, try ordering the kids sized burger and fries. Hits the spot! Great portion and cheaper!
author: J M.

description: Blue cheese burger and garlic fries, yes please! The crew that works here are super friendly. Mitchell's milkshake are dangerous but bomb. Yum yum
author: Common B.

description: Great people, service, food, and drinks the only complaint is that if you are ordering something bit more fancy say milkshake it doesn't look same on what you ordered more of a cheap melted shake came with metal cup.
author: Lorrie T.

description: Salads have given me mild bubble guts multiple times.
author: Joe D.

description:
Definitely big portions and nice flavor, but the fries could have been better. We got one normal, sweet, and garlic. I didn't try the normal ones, but the garlic ones were super smushy and greasy. The sweet potato fries were not as bad, but I like my fries crispy and not so oily. 

But, like pizza, burgers are burgers (unless you have a massive knowledge of a "good burger" I suppose).
author: Bahar A.

description:
A pretty solid burger but not spectacular. The Hangover burger shows a lot of promise. But you have to be pretty spectacular to pull me away from Phat Philly next door. The patty wasn't as juicy as I'd like; Well done, not medium. 

I do like that their burgers come with fries compared to other places that make that a $3.50 extra(i.e the place next door).
author: Michael H.

description: This burger joint is great! Stumbled upon this place while walking to Dolores Park and boy was I surprised. I ordered the Bog Mouth Burger with a side of fries. The burger was cooked to perfection and the fresh cut fries were on point! I'd highly recommend this place to anyone in the area. My bill came to about $9.75 which wasn't bad at all. It has seating inside the restaurant for about 20-30 people with 2 small tables outside as well. Can't wait to try this place again before I head back to Ohio!
author: Doug E.

description:
Solid, specialty burgers.

I've been here twice for the blue cheese burger, and I'm struggling to try the other ones because it was so good both times. I can't get over the portion sizes in addition to the amazing aioli. I'm not a huge fan of the coleslaw so I learned quickly to just opt in for sweet potato fries for the extra $1.50. 

For those interested, they have a new burger now that comes with a gluen-free bun.
author: Alice H.

description: First time here! Mew didn't have lunch so we decided to eat here, it was recommended that I try the Hangover Burger with everything it is was AWESOME! I'm not usually a burger person, but it is well worth the price! I would definitely go here again
author: Mona Lisa L.

description: Best burgers and garlic fries in SF Bay Area! I've been coming here for years!
author: Sergio L.

description:
Ordered the Big Mouth Burger with sweet potato fries and got normal ones. Place was full of what seemed like locals watching a baseball game, so I stood for my takeout and watched the staff make my food to order. 

Was it good? Yea, it was the kind of burger I'd make at home. Solid, a bit bigger than a normal burger chain, and tasty. Nothing special though. 

Lost points for killing a bug crawling on the counter in front of me, and having pink juices flowing from my burger when I got back to my destination. Yes, that means it wasn't completely cooked.
author: Bonny A.

description:
Sometimes I think that today's fast food has ruined the concept of a real hamburger. A real hamburger should have quality ingredients, prepared and cooked to your order, not a meat-blend burger with soggy veggies, pre-heated, pre-packaged and ready within a minute. I guess this is why I dont eat burgers that often. 

Big Mouth Burger is all that it claims, it's one BIG burger served with big steak cut french fries, (Fries so big you wonder how big the actual potato was). I couldn't even finish my meal, although I was starving when I sat down. 

Next time I am upgrading it to a Bacon Big Mouth Cheeseburger, then and only then, will I be in Burger Heaven. Well maybe add a Mitchell's Ice cream Shake....
author: Rebekah T.

description: Burgers are still bomb! Shakes are thick and not too sweet. Love that they have you assemble your own burger. I will still recommend this spot for burgers. Yumm! Staff here care and have been here a couple years. Negative one star because it does look understaffed (more work for the employees:( ) and the bathroom needs remodeling, otherwise I'm still coming here!
author: Susana R.

description:
Big Mouth Burger has only a dozen tables and only 1 was occupied at lunch.
menu: burgers, salads, sides ,,,,

eats: 1/2# big mouth burger, ordered med. rare(7.95)
-all natural ground chuck with lettuce, tomato, pickle, red onions, mayo
-meat came out almost raw, red meat, some grease, but no meat juice, just tasteless meat. soft bun fell apart latter
-fries mushy on the inside, not crispy on the outside, a waste
-not informed of choices of sides, just that fries included. 

crumbs:
-med with cheese, etc. would pe a good burger here, not med. rare
-courteous service
-baked bean or cole slaw side much better side than fries.
-not my kind of 4 star eatery.
author: Victor G.

description: Just tried their vegan, gluten free burger with sweet potato fries yesterday. (I added cheese because I'm not vegan.) not sure what the name is; it was just listed by the register. Hit the spot. One of the best vegetarian concoctions I've had in awhile. My girlfriend got the salmon burger and was totally impressed by how moist and creamy it was. "It has capers!" she repeated, delightedly. It took a bit longer than expected to come out (like, almost twenty minutes), especially because they weren't backed up with previous orders. Still, we were totally impressed by the quality of the food. If we're in the hood and looking for a bite again, we'll be back.
author: Jen H.

description:
A great low key burger joint in the Mission. I had the Blue Cheeses burger the other day.. not a big fan..
BUT.. they do a good ole fashioned cheese burger perfectly. My 8 year old little girl loves the place.. 

Onion rings are great.. fries are hit or miss.. get your burger with onion rings..(they serve 'em with a little side of ranch) Not great for the diet, but totally deeeelish
author: Cmd C.

description:
I don't think it is better than any chain burger so can't really give more than 3 stars. It's not super cheap either but that's due to the portions. Fries? Meh, 2 stars at best. 

You asked and I tried, gave a generous 3 stars, now it's your turn. Where is the closest Burger King?
author: Gokhan T.

description:
We were celebrating a friend's birthday & he chose to have it here.

Even though I knew this is a no frills burger joint, I was still less than impressed when I stepped in.  But never mind that, it's the food that matters.

The Boyfriend got a Big mouth burger which didn't look very big for a half pound patty; & it was dry.  I got the 49er which had a big piece of chicken breast that was dry, burnt, & when eaten alone, pretty flavorless.  The 2 of us shared a Garlic fries which was tasty but not very garlic'y.

The Mission is a up & coming foodie paradise so I think I can find a better gourmet burger somewhere else.  But if you just want something quick & dirty, this place is passable.
author: Karen S.

description:
Big Mouth Burger. What a disappointment!

After reading and rereading all the raving reviews, I just had to ask if I was at the right place. Surely not all the Yelpers would have bad taste, so did I come on a bad day? Seriously, I'm so upset that I need to go back for a revisit just to make sure! Where the F was my fine tasty juicy burger????

The standard Big Mouth burger is $7. Comes with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, pickles, a choice of spread and choice of bread. Cheese and other toppings are extra. The burger is at a decent size, and loaded with a pile of thick cut fries. I was excited to take my first bite! But instead uuuuugh! The pattie was sooo dry, I had to load it up with ketchup. Then I had to add pepper since it was almost tasteless. 

*mad mad mad mad mad*
author: Marti L.

description:
This was the best burger and fries I've had in a while.  We went there after a sunny day in Dolores Park and couldn't have picked a better spot. Quick service, beer on tap and a good selection of burgers, although once I read what was in the Giants Burger I read no further.  It has provolone cheese, onion rings, bacon, lettuce, tomato, & BBQ sauce with Garlic Fries.  Yes. That was EXACTLY what I wanted. 

We got a table outside and before we knew it, the most delicious looking food was in front of us.  My friends got other burgers but everyone agreed my Giants Burger looked the most delicious.  Stacked VERY tall and perfectly cooked, I couldn't be happier.  The bacon was on point and the onion rings were nice and fat and battered just right.  And those garlic fries... were crispy on the outside, soft on the inside and oh so greasy in the best way possible. Rather than being topped with diced garlic which I expected, they may have been drenched in garlic butter. Whatever it was, it worked though.  I felt like a pig but every bite was amazing.

I like that they don't pretend to be anything other than a burger joint that makes delicious burgers. If you want great burgers without any drama and you're in the Mission, go to Bigmouth.
author: Nick C.

description:
Decided to drop by before heading over to work. The name of this place makes you curious to see what this place has in store.

I ordered my burger with most of the fixings off. The price wasn't too bad (about 9 bucks after tax) and I believe it came with fries which isn't really common considering the location (Valencia St.).

The burger took a while longer than I expected and seeing as I was short on time, I kept track of every minute very closely. Once I got my burger, I added my usual favorite toppings. 

Despite what you might expect, the burger tasted really plain and it reminds me of wholesale hamburger patties from Restaurant Depot or something. It's not bad if you're really hungry for a burger, but my expectations were completely letdown. Sigh...
author: George Z.

description: Awesome burgers, grilled cheese sandwich, sweet potato fries, garlic fries. My whole family loved it. Great staff also. Thanks for the great culinary experience. Decent prices.
author: Dave B.

description:
My first 1 star since 2010. 

Decided to give this place a shot so I used their website to place my pick-up order. Their website reroutes to Eat24 so really you are ordering through them. 

Pay for everything and walk over. 

Once I get their the girl behind the counter seemed flustered and was being short with all of the customers. Whatever, it's a rush on a Friday night. I get up to the counter and tell her my name and that I'm here to pick up my take out order. She turns to one of the line cooks and asks for my order to which the cook just shurgged. 

She goes on to tell me that "whatever service they use f*@1 up a lot, I need to place your order now" 

Ok, I get it. Kinda of frustrating since I paid online for the sole reason that I could walk in and out and not stand around waiting for a burger to cook. 

15 minutes later I get my burger and head home to find the bun is completely stale. So stale that the cook had to have felt it before he placed it on the patty. 

If you're looking for a good burger in the Mission go to Liberties just around the corner. This place is wack.
author: Christina M.

description: I ordered thru eat24 and although the food arrive early it was cold ( I had to reheat the fries and burger) and salad was a total mess. Lettuce looks old! Very disappointed!  One star for eat24 fast delivery!
author: Aida D.

description:
Service: Fast, weren't pestered by the server as with other places.
Food: Nice selection of burgers and very fresh and flavorful!
Price: Matched with what we got, very reasonable.
Bottom Line: I'd go back, the lunch was excellent.

I had the bleu cheese burger (and garlic pesto spread on the bun) with fries, was a delight!  Sat outside at the table, wish the table had been a bit more sturdy but all in all I'd go back for more.  

To sum it up: If you're wandering around 24th Street building up an appetite, give your feet a break and palette a treat because this had to be the best bleu cheese burger I've had for a while!

Tip: Try and get a seat outside, because there's plenty of room on the sidewalk for others to pass by, giving you fresh air while you kick back.  Also allowed my dog to try out their french fries!
author: Sean K.

description: This place is awesome. Great presentation on their burgers, and their salads are to die for. Takes a bit long, but well worth the wait. I thoroughly enjoyed my Oriental Chicken salad. Will be returning here to refuel after dance class, before practice.
author: Jen M.

description:
Don't understand all the great reviews........... The few times I've been here the food has been nothing special.

I've had the turkey burger which was ok.

The beef burger I had recently was nasty it had a really gamey taste to it and was super greasy. The fries are not that great either. they really have no taste and last time where soft and cold.

2 stars for the fast service and cute cashier lol.
author: Michael W.

description: My review is strictly for the french fries.....My son ordered 3 french fries, which we picked up, and half of the fries we're sooo dark, and had a burn taste to them... I mean come on the whole 3 orders should have been fresh, and good to eat.. I wanted to call them so bad, but my son said No don't call we always go there, blah, blah, blah, so please big mouth if your listening, please, please get the fries right......
author: Bridget A.

description: Still an old school favorite.  Great burgers and sandwiches.  Solid turkey burger.  Great fries and rings too
author: Zach H.

description: Work around the corner and have eaten here a few times. Almost always place an online order. Burger is always over cooked, added items are sometimes forgotten. On my last burger I added mushrooms and avocado, hold the pickles. They missed all of it. When I went back and told the girl at the register and she game me a look like I was a huge inconvenience. Told her twice what I ordered, got the burger back and it still had pickles.
author: Kyle H.

description:
After reading stellar reviews from a couple of my favorite Yelpers I finally got a chance to visit this popular burger spot on 24th Street.  

I really like the fact that they give you different options to personalize your burger the way you like it.  I actually stood in the doorway and studied the options before approaching the counter to place my order.  I had a Big Mouth Burger on a French roll with the Spicy Chipotle Mayo and I had provolone cheese added for a bit extra.  I chose the French Fries as my side order and I had a canned soda.  There is a free water dispenser beside the cash register area.  They give you a number, you find a table and they'll bring your food to you when it's ready.

The restaurant is super busy during the lunch hour, and since the burgers are cooked to order expect a bit of a wait.  The wooden tables and chairs are well worn, but they're situated close enough so you can glance at what your neighbor is eating without being rude.  

I was quite excited when my food (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZPVCTXm4olsIEk4rWwAIWQ?select=-0VGLm7m4lezFu-ZVgLpNQ) arrived, and the first thing I noticed was the huge amount of cheese on top of the burger.  I was curious about the spicy chipotle mayo because so many other reviewers have written about how good it is.  I took a fry and wiped some mayo on it for a taste even before I assembled the burger.  Oh my, the spicy chipotle mayo is awesome!  The fat skin-on fries are very meaty, but I wished for a bit more crispiness on the outside.

The burger comes with the usual accompaniments of fresh leaf lettuce, sliced tomatoes, a slice of red onion and pickle chips.  It's stated that the burger is "broiled medium" but mine was more like medium/well.  There was just a hint of pink color in the meat, but the burger remained somewhat juicy.  I loved the provolone cheese which had fantastic stretch and tasted very milky.  Overall, it was a very good burger, and I will definitely return.  The portion size is big so come hungry!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: Messy food. The texan gave my bf a first degree burn because of the sauce. French fries were amazing though.
author: Kelly A.

description: Pretty good burgers, but the cashier/server was not the friendliest (nor the rudest, for that matter), and the prices are nothing special. Didn't really get what makes the place so special
author: Chad T.

description: Well we got the 49er burger which is the the chicken and the hangover burger .  Both really good but the hangover one was incredible!  The chick taking the orders was hella koo too! Have to try it again!  You should too
author: Gonzo X.

description:
You ever into the Smiths?
"Big Mouth Strikes Again" was like an awesome song in the 1980's.
I used to dance to it with my Flock of Seagulls hair and Linda Evans shoulder pads....I could flip my disco now.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k5CltsEN8DQ&feature=related

Flash forward two decades later, give or take, and here I am at Big Mouth Burgers. Big Mouth strikes again. But it doesn't look like a club where the Human League and Spandau Ballet would hang out. Nope, it's really more of a working-class burger joint with furniture bought from a fire sale at Frontier Village. Whatever happened to Frontier Village, by the way?

Anyway, a hearty burger can be found here. I had the $6.40 Big Mouth Burger which was definitely a good portion of beef cooked medium. You get your choice of breads, spreads and extras. Not quite the variety found at Custom Burger but not the same price either. I went for a toasted French roll with spicy chipotle mayo and a slice of melted pepper jack cheese and a few sauteed mushrooms for good measure. The cheese and mushrooms did add $1.90 to the tab, but you do get a nice side of tasty steak fries, or if you're some health nut, you can have cole slaw or baked beans instead.

I like the vibe in here, very casual with a lot of locals just hanging out, and the service is good. They are very good at giving you the stepwise directions in ordering if you're a rookie like me. It's very conveniently located a block up from the 24th Street BART station near Valencia. And as Morrissey wisely said...

Big Mouth, oh ... Big Mouth, la ... 
Big Mouth strikes again 
And I've got no right to take my place 
With the Human race 
Oh... 

FOOD - 4 stars...a good burger with a lot of optional toppings for extra...I usually hate steak fries, but these are good
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...Davy Crockett and Daniel Boone would like those wooden tables
SERVICE - 4 stars...patient and friendly
TOTAL - 4 stars...always nice to find another burger option in this vegan-crazy city
author: Ed U.

description: Good food, friendly and great service. Great burger joint in the Mission. I've been here more then a few times and have never been disapointed.
author: J B.

description:
I've been a long time fan of Big Mouth ever since my dad started bringing home their burgers years ago. I ate in shop for the first time last night and finally got a chance to try one of the burgers while it was still piping hot. I ordered the blue cheese burger with a side of onion rings and a diet coke. 

The burger was seasoned properly and the sauces were delicious, just enough spice to make them noteworthy. There was just enough blue cheese to justify the name without being overpowering. 

The onion rings were the bomb. They were tender and crispy with just a touch of sweet to the beer batter. I think they may be the best onion rings I've ever had in San Francisco.

The diet coke was a little expensive for a can of soda, but worth it for the caffeine boost it gave me. They also have complimentary water which is self serve.

Definitely going to swing by again next time I'm back for a visit, the take out never disappointed in the past, but the fresh burgers are even better.
author: Kelly L.

description: The burger was juicy, staff was friendly, the fries were horrible and the cheese had no flavor, they didn't even have ice for my soda!I would not go back.
author: Brian S.

description:
We decided to get some burgers at Big Mouth Burgers in the Mission last night before going down to At&t park to watch the Giants try and hold on to their first place spot last night. Since we had devoured so much sweets and carbs for lunch we wanted nothing but salt and red meat for dinner. 

The BF ordered the Big Mouth Burger and added avocado and mushrooms. I ordered the Hawaiian Burger- pineapple, teriyaki sauce, and bacon. We also ordered "the biggest fries you got" (although in retrospect perhaps we should asked for the largest order of fries, because although very Big Fries, there was only a few of them. I got two cans of diet coke (one can is never enough with salty food, plus the BF only ordered water so I knew he'd be stealing "sips"). Grand total with acceptable bistro service tip of 10% came to $28

Pros:
The burgers were good. Not med rare like I had asked for (more like med well) but still juicy enough. They also had to be atleast a half a pound. According to the menu they were also organic which made us both feel better about our gluttony. The toppings were clearly fresh and generously applied. I believe there was almost a full avocado on the BF's burger! The french fries were steak fries cut fresh in house and very tasty. We ate every one. They all served beer on draft though we did not partake, they had floats and milkshakes too. There was sufficient seating  inside and two outside tables. I liked the counter seat along the window best because 24th street is a great place to people watch.

Cons:
The first thing you notice walking in are the swarm of flies over the heads of the dining guests. I'm assuming they were not paying customers but since the doors and windows are open I assume they invited themselves. The restaurant has a crowded feel to it. I think they really tried to squeeze as many tables in as humanly possible! It terrifies me to think of eating there if the place was at maximum occupancy. 
Like I already mentioned the burgers were both over cooked. The meat, although organic, lacks flavor and may possibly contain no seasoning at all. The fries are salted perfectly but have no other seasoning and I believe they may wish to consider changing the frier oil a bit more often. Yesterday it was apparent that the grease was dirty. Kinda gross but we were hungry.

I gave Big Mouth 3 stars because that is what 3 is right. Just Good. Although what bugged me most is the cost. $28 is too much for two burgers, one fries, and 2 canned sodas. I could've gone down to South End and had a burger, fries, and drink for $7 or to Pie for a slice and beer for $6.28.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Best burgers in the mission. The only rival I've found in all of SF (in the inexpensive category) is Roam Artisan Burgers on Fillmore, which is probably a bit better. I've tried most of the cheapish 4-star burger joints in the city.

Why are they great? They're big, juicy, and most importantly have a great variety of styles and toppings, from the blue cheese and pesto to the grilled pineapple with teriyaki sauce to the excellent salmon burger with avocado. I will play my hand here and admit that I'm not a burger meat connoisseur. I can tell a great paddy from an alright one, but I'm not after the kind of gourmet burger where the meat is supposed to stand alone. I love quality toppings.

Also, the fries are great too!  Both regular and sweet potato. They're a bit thicker than normal, and are the natural style I like with a bit of potato skin remaining.

My vegetarian girlfriend likes their turkey burger more than any other she's had in SF.  She's sampled far and wide, including many other 4-star places on Yelp.
author: Tim K.

description: Great food but DON'T GO to the one on 24th street! I found a fly in my food and on numerous occasions friends have found hairs and other disgusting things in the food!
author: Manda B.

description: This is one of the most best places to buy a burger if you want better then McDonald's. There fries are to die for and the burgers will make your mouth watering so if you like a good quality burger this is the spot!!
author: William V.

description: Really good hamburgers. There arent many places like this in the city. You gotta try the Giants burger. It's served with garlic fries and onion rings.
author: Papi R.

description: Good burgers, good fries, good times. Might offer the best burgers in the mission. Very flavorful and highly filling.
author: Drew M.

description:
Had the big mouth burger, with cheese, and fries, to go. 

All the ingredients were fresh and the patty was juicy but could have been more flavourful. The fries are actually thick, skin-on and seem to be hand cut ... Turned out to be tastier than they appeared (which was an unappetising brown and over-cooked look). 

Overall, a solid burger n fries, and a big size, but nothing amazing.
author: Tennille D.

description:
This burger is literally enough to keep you going for an entire day.

For a good ol' fashioned burger and steak fries, come to Big Mouth. You can get a side salad which is loaded with crisp romaine lettuce. They have a kids sized burger but after you add toppings it comes out to the same price as a hangover (95 cents per extra topping of avocado, bacon, mushrooms). So being the American I am, I inhaled a burger twice the size I originally wanted because it was equal priced.
author: Jess C.

description: Just finished eating! Super full it was quite a big portion. Me and my boyfriend couldnt finish our burgers. I got the frontier which wasnt what i expected the steak was indeed really thin but still juicy some parts. My boyfriend got the hangover burger and he said it was alright nothing extraordinary. The garlic fries were really tasty and flavorful. The onion rings not so much i think it was not that crispy didnt like the batter they used . I dont think i would come back here for anything but all in all food was decent and will get u full.
author: Jenny L.

description:
I had their signature Big Mouth Burger and onion rings.  The patty was juicy, but lacked flavor. I prefer a burger from Jay's over Big Mouth.  However, their onion rings were great: crunchy, but not that "hard" kind of crunch, and really flavorful.  

You can't order online, their online system is for another store, not the one on 24th.  Cash or credit card.
author: Anna Y.

description: The service was not up to par. They made a mistake and gave me the wrong order. I had already reached my job before finding out and they said that it was my own fault and that I should hurry back and return the salad because the woman that ordered it was waiting. This was my first time and last.
author: Linda N.

description:
So I gave them three stars only because their customer service isn't that great. But I would give them 5 stars for their food. My avocado turkey burger was just amazing. 

I called to put my order in for pick up, who ever was taking my order was not paying attention hence the missing shakes I ordered. To top it off they ran out of straws.
author: Krizia L.

description:
Big mouth burger: create your own, its big, cooked well done and flavorful. Veggies were fresh. Pretty good overall. 
Fries: too soggy for my taste, but decent. 
Facilities: small, unassuming, and fairly clean. 
Overall: although not the most impressive joint, burgers are worth coming back for. They have a generous menu of choices.
author: Ed O.

description:
Cash and credit card accepted.
a few beers on tap few in bottles.
Mitchell's ice cream is awesomeness, a few flavors only.
author: Nacho G.

description: I fell in love with the 'dive' atmosphere immediately. Cramped in an obvious way, it hides an amazing menu of palate pleasers. Amazing burgers!
author: Douglas S.

description:
Burgers are huge!! I've bought the Small mouth Burger from the kids menu and it's still a good size and very filling.

I take off 1 star for one the cashiers. She seems and acts like she hates her job and I don't like dealing with her. She rolls her eyes at you if you want to add something or change something even if she hasn't put the order in yet. There is one other cashier that I had the chance of dealing with and she was very nice and offered her advise as to what she thought was the best. Was very friendly right off the bat
author: Samantha P.

description: Someone please call the health i Spector!!! Not only am i sure this place is crawling with roaches, but the cook scratched his nasty hair and went about his day....yikes
author: Justin A.

description: I would say the best burgers I've had in my life. Very friendly staff and nice atmosphere.
author: Alex S.

description:
I came here with two teenaged buys and we were all STARVING. We ordered two burgers, a steak sandwich, sweet potato fries, and a Big Daddy IPA.

The beer was delicious; the fries came out first, which was good because we were dying. The burger was good -- not GREAT, as I had expected. They are a little thin, so medium rare isn't really possible. We were hungry, so everything was eaten, but it wasn't over the top great - thus, only three stars.

Umami Burger, it is not. But it's not In-n-Out either. Although, to be honest, I might prefer the latter because for the 3 of us to eat lunch, after the tip, it came to almost $50! Gack.
author: Delilah B.

description:
Randomly driving down the street for shopping and saw the intriguing words.. "Big mouth burger" We three agreed it was a must stop for food. Didn't bother checking reviews with my iPhone battery at low I looked over the pictures quickly and they looked awesome. It was early afternoon and I was famished, looking at the number of people inside dining and waiting on food I thought it must be good. From what we saw on the tables it all looked good. And boy was It. Couple different burger options and non, the chicken breast sandwich sounded yum but I needed something filling and when there's a sandwich named after the place might as well try it. The menu states they make everything to order and offer many options to add on to your burger like spreads, breads and cheeses. I got the big mouth burger with pepper jack cheese and garlic spread. (Peep the photo if you like) The burger is served with toppings, red onions, green lettuce and tomatoes. The fries are thick cut like British style chips, the burger was filling, juicy and everything tasted as great as it looked. I'm sitting here now typing this review wishing I could have another. I would suggest trying it during a non typical time for food, in other words at a time when it isn't crazy busy so your burger gets the attention it needs. 
I'm the kind of burger connoisseur that needs a juicy taste filled patty. i think burger meat should have a taste to it before its cooked. With all this said, these were some good burgers.
author: Jacob J.

description:
This place has been "bookmarked" for the longest time.  Finally came in with my BF, with high expectations and were kind of let down.  The burger was good, a little overcooked but still tasty.  We ordered the bacon cheeseburger.  The bacon was cooked to our liking, not too too crispy.  The fries could have been a lot crispier.  I think that a wedge cut or steak cut fry has to be crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside.  Service was fast, but lady I ordered a diet coke, not a regular coke (get off your iphone!).  

I'll be back to try other items off the menu.
author: Lesliegh H.

description: Yummy burger. Very American burger style. Juicy. Comes w a side. Staff is friendly and great.  Not too expensive. I would get the kid size if you are not a huge big guy with a huge appetite. Decor can use a facelift though.
author: Carrie T.

description: Excellent burgers, have gone here a few times now and never disappointed. The wait is a little long so highly suggest to call ahead of time and place your order.
author: Travis T.

description:
Quality burger right here in my quality 'hood.  Go with the blue cheese burger, it's creamy and bursting with flavor, that pesto the perfect nuance to the greasy downhome deliciousness.

I eat here all the time, and it's always good.

It'll be five stars in my book when they start offering grass-fed beef (not that hard anymore, guys, many other places in the city offer it), which is healthier for the cow, for the human, and for the planet.

But for now, damn, it's a fine burger.
author: Tony B.

description: My wife and I went here for lunch during Sunday Streets for lunch and sat at one of their outdoor tables so we could eat with our dogs.  I had the Blue Cheese Burger with fries and everything was very good.  My wife had the Caesar Salad with Salmon and thought it was both huge and very good.  It was great being able to sit outside with our dogs and enjoy our food.  The person working the counter not only brought out our food, but brought out a bunch of condiments and napkins for us.  I really enjoyed everything and I'll definitely be back.
author: Scott L.

description:
The perfect thing for a Sunday AM hangover. 

Did I metion you can get a pint here to wash down your mamoth burger and fries?
author: Paul V.

description: I don't understand how this place got 4/5 stars. I ordered a bacon cheese burger and wondered where's the rest of my burger? Also the burger lacked flavor and was very dry. This place sucks
author: Garrick G.

description: Pretty good burgers.  I usually get their salmon burger, which is a little plain but pretty good as a lighter meal.  The coleslaw is a bit on the horseradishy side; not bad, but not my favorite, either.
author: J S.

description:
Big Mouth Burgar

At first glance this looks like a really great burger joint with clean tables and plenty of places to sit. There is a large menu with a wide verity of burgers and beer on tap. I was looking forward to a great burger and a tasty beer. When I stepped up the counter to order my Anchor Steam I was sadly disappointed, as they don't have San Francisco's own. I settled for a Sam Adams. All the tables were clean but as I took my first sip of my fine frosty beverage I noticed that the ketchup bottle had dried crusty mustard stains inside while at the same time the glass had that scent that the dishwasher needed to be sanitized or that the glasses were washed with food. You know the scent I'm talking about, it's disgusting. I don't know about you but I don't like crusty mustard chunks in my ketchup and my beer smelling like anything other than beer. 

I ordered the Big Mouth Burger with fires. My burger was brought to me in less than five minutes with a large portion of potato wedges. The fries were cooked well done and were good. The burger on the other hand was a disaster. I only ate the entire thing because I was really hungry. The burger was so dry and flavorless that I considered ordering another beer to wash it down. The bun had been warmed but was more on the stale side than toasted. 

The menu is so extensive though that I will be back some day in the far off future to try some of their other offerings. Another thing that will bring me back is the employees are professional and friendly and did give me the feeling that my business was genuinely appreciated.

Health Card = 94
author: Justin S.

description: This place is nothing to write home about. The service was bad; the cashier had a attitude, fries were cold and tasted store bought, and finally the burger was lacking a flavorful punch. Overall if your in the area and hungry try another store. You will be glad you didn't waste your money and time at big mouth burgers
author: Nathan A.

description:
Okay, I paid 8 bucks for the Big Mouth Burger (maybe it was 9?) Anyways, I'm always taking the 48 bus and each and every time I pass this, I am tempted to get off and eat here.

The Garlic Fries are really good. I would definitely get it from here.
author: Eric A.

description: I live in the Mission and I always find myself at Big Mouth Burgers. I've been sticking to the BlUE CHEESE BURGER!! Hits the spot! The dipping sauce with the sweet potato fries is awesome too. Yum.
author: Emily C.

description:
Definitely a good burger, and a very convenient location if you're in the neighborhood.  Fries were good too.  

If you're driving there, good luck parking - not too easy around that stretch of 24th.
author: Mike H.
