description: I feel like three stars is being generous. I've said this before but there are other burger joints I would hit up first before coming here. But there ok, nothing special. Hella choice but stick to a regular cheese burger.
author: Bantu Z.

description:
Mmmmmm.  Veggieburger with bacon.  (Or the Hypocrite Burger)  Is this a conspiracy?  My old boss told me to get this.  When I was at the restaurant someone else had gotten one, and made sure to come up and compliment me on my choice.  

I haven't gotten my membership ring yet guys.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I was in SF visiting and came here on a recommendation by the front desk guy at Elements Hotel (see my review on that place), since I was craving a good burger. It was a short walk from the hotel, so I headed on over. 

The place is kind of a dive, but clean. I ended up ordering a burger with bacon, mushrooms, avocado, blue cheese crumbles, and a garlic mayo or spread. The guy taking my order literally paused and gave me a look like "are you sure??", but then was like "alright". With fries and a can of Pepsi, it came out too $14. Way more than I wanted to spend on a burger, but I figured I'm on vaca so what the hell. 

When my order came out, I realized why he gave me that look... the burger was huge! I took one look and knew I wasn't going to be able to finish it. I have to say: THIS WAS THE BEST DAMN BURGER I HAVE EVER HAD!!! It was like a circus in my mouth! My pleasure button was on over load! It literally made my whole day. I'm half Filipino, and all Filipinos do is talk, think, and eat food, ha ha. So food can be my ultimate happiness, needless to say I was a happy camper :o) The fries were quite good as well. 

The guy who took my order must have seen my face and came out and said "Good burger eh? I come back with a box for you" (think Russian or similar accent). I was more than happy later on when I was able to dive into this burger for a second round! 

If you're in SF, don't pass this up for a good burger!!
author: Leonard T.

description: Big-mighty-tasty-deliciously-to-the-highest power burger! The best burger I've had in a very long time, beats the burger from In & Out, Burger King and other places. Got the Big Mouth Burger with regular fries, the AWESOMENESS of it - I mean, just by looking at it before taking a bite looks good already. I'd go here again!
author: Jackie A.

description:
Part 3- Saturday 9/5 around 4pm
As I promised I came here to check out the hype of Big Mouth Burgers before the one I FTR opens. If you like to customize ur burgers like I do then go for the Big Mouth Burger or a Turkey Burger. The reason: you get to choose:

Buns:  plain, wheat, french roll, herb foccacia

Spreads: Mayo, Chipotle Mayo, BBQ sauce mild or spicy, Teriyaki sauce, roasted garlic, Pesto, Sun Dried Tomatoes

Cheeses: Blue cheese, swiss, mild cheddar, pepper jack, provolone or American cheese, 

other extras include bacon, avocado and mushrooms

I went for a Big Mouth Burger on a plain bun with cheddar cheese, Chipotle mayo and the usual tomatoes, lettuce and pickles.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZPVCTXm4olsIEk4rWwAIWQ?select=R_HhTByVKg7YWLDAXzUcjg

The burger came with these enormous hand cut fries that were jest delicious! I could tell they were fresh and not some frozen store bought fries.  The patty was grilled jest rite while the chipotle mayo gave it a fiery kick. Before we got our burgers since no one was around I wanted to take some pictures of place and the cashier told me it would be $5 for each picture I took. Of course i knew she was kidding but i told her i was writing a yelp review. I go to use the restroom and when I come back my friend told me that she gave us some free dipping sauce. Homemade bbq sauce and homemade teriyaki sauce. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ZPVCTXm4olsIEk4rWwAIWQ?select=tLJvyn3f3EffI_y6wbK43g

Someone wants 5 stars!  Even with the extra sauces which were yummy I chose to give them 4 stars since this was my first time coming here. I do plan to come back and give some more different combination's a try!! I do have a big mouth for that big burger!! see :O
author: Jonathan W.

description: There's nothing remarkable about Big Mouth Burger. It's what you'd get at a cookout. I like cookout burgers, but I also don't pay $9 for them.
author: Heather B.

description: Wow the burger was huge!!! I ordered "I ordered a hangover aside with the garlic fries; the garlic fries were so good and tasty!
author: Krystal S.

description:
What we got: 

Caesar Salad
Spinach Salad
Burger
Pulled Pork Sandwich
Sweet Potato Fries

What we liked: 

Caesar Salad
Spinach Salad
Burger
Pulled Pork Sandwich
Sweet Potato Fries

Get it? It was all very good. And HUGE! We each had enough to take home and eat while our significant other wasn't looking and judging us for eating too much. 

So why the three-star review instead of five? 

Well, because the service wasn't anything to jerk off over. In fact, the guys behind the counter were pretty rude. 

And they had Star Wars on high volume, blasting James Earl Jones' booming baritone all over the (tiny) restaurant. Nothing against Mr. Jones, nor Mr. Lucas, but I prefer to watch my movies at such volumes in the comfort of my own home. Neighbors be damned. 

But I will definitely eat here again. I'll just call first to request a movie. I'm thinking a silent film ... 

~M
author: Mel H.

description:
Ordered a Hangover Burger, not because I was hungover but because it sounded like the most caloric thing I could find and when this chick is hungry, I don't think of a salad.
The Hangover : Cheeseburger, fried egg, bacon & chipotle mayo.  With fries.  Bring it!

Ordered at 12:55, left at 1:05 with a delicious smelling bag & on the way back to office... yes I had to have a hot fry.  Holy baby Jesus, real potatoes?  Imagine that.

Devoured it in 2 sittings - it's called Big mouth for a reason.  

Very pleased, will return next time I'm craving a mean ass burger!
author: Athena S.

description:
I come here when I don't want to feel to guilty after eating a burger.
But the must have is the delicious Ceasar salad. The lettuce is so crispy!
Love it.
author: Anthony M.

description: Big Mouth Burger is my favorite place to grab a burger in the neighborhood. I like the restaurant, it's a cute little hole in the wall with some interesting and varied burger concoctions. And delicious milkshakes! It's right off BART too. Big Mouth is perfect for lunch or a casual dinner.
author: Denise B.

description:
Walked in, looked at the menu and ordered the Big Mouth Burger. Gotta stick w/ the item on the menu that's named after the place, right?

Turns out it's just your typical burger. Patty, cheese, lettuce, tomato and onions. In fact, the patty was a little on the dry side.
author: Ken K.

description: I always walk out of Big Mouth Burger with a happy tummy.  I ordered their turkey burger with wheat bun and sweet potato fries.  Their buns are always fluffy and soft and the patties are thick and meaty.  I love the dip that comes with your fries.  Love the seating by the window, you can have a great meal and people watch in the Mission ( never fails).  Definitely going to try their Hangover Burger next time.
author: Mimi N.

description:
Felt like burger and fries while in the Mission so trekked it out to 24th St. to Big Mouth.

I got the Bleu Cheese burger and while it was good, it didn't hit the spot for me.  One side of the bun had a pesto spread while the other had a reddish/tomatoish spread.  The bleu cheese was thicker than I would have liked but otherwise the buns and burger was pretty good.

The fries are thick and tasty but I would have liked it a bit crispier.
author: Melissa L.

description: I moved to the Mission not long ago from the South and this place has quite honestly the best burgers I have ever shoved into my face. The classic Big Mouth burger is huge, and you're given a heaping helping of amazing fries. Wait time is minimal considering the place is usually packed with sports fans, locals you usually run into more than once. As for complaints about the meat not being cooked? The descriptions of the burger clearly say it's cooked medium so open your mouth and specify if you want something different. Don't down food service folks and food because you can't read a menu. This isn't a hipster haven with gourmet experimentation. It's a classic burger joint with gut-bomb eats and friendly service. I can't recommend it enough.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
The workers here were all really patient with us, as I was having the hardest time deciding what to order. After being turned away by another restaurant for a birthday dinner, we wanted to grab a quick bite, but we also had a cake with us. The lady at the counter was fine with us bringing in the cake, and even provided utensils and plates. 

I eventually decided on the grilled chicken sandwich on a french roll. I was a little surprised because the chicken was still moist.  All the ladies basically ordered the same thing and everyone liked it! I had a bite of the Big Mouth burger and it was pretty juicy itself.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I would give this place a solid 4 stars BUT the service here makes that difficult. I can't stand snarky people preparing my food and taking their sweet ass time when I'm looking to spend my hard earned cash. 

So yes the burger was solid and gigantic and the fries plentiful enough to share but the prices don't warrant attitude. 

I'm not sure if I'll be back maybe some day....
author: Jade W.

description:
I've managed to visit this place twice now. Once extremely hungover and once mildly hungover. This review is from the latter. 

Location: 3/5
Parking isn't great and the place is pretty small. Although that's pretty much describing most locations in the Mission. The seating is alright but not much room for a group. 

Service: 3/5
I guess a good burger takes a long time but 10 minutes for a burger when there was no line is a little lengthy. I guess I've been starving, hungover, and a wee bit impatient each time. 

Food: 4/5 
This is probably the best thing about this place which makes it worth the 10+ block walk from work on the occasional Friday afternoon.  I've tried a BBQ burger and the Big Mouth Burger (the signature/safe bet). The wait is worth it for the most part as the burger has fresh ingredients and is served open so you can add sauces. The fries were good but were cooked inconsistently; some fresh, some crisp, and some soggy. 

Not many places to get a good burger in the mission but I'll definitely hit this place up again. Good hangover grease.
author: James G.

description: Thought their burger was really underwhelming. Decent but just not up to that four star rating at all, charred to hell, quality of the meat was just all out poor. Very nice food presentation, impressed by the presence of fresh tomatoes but it wasn't enough to save the burger. :/ also, just PISS-POOR fries, greasy, mushy, cold, soft, unseasoned, with thick unappetizing skins on them. Your menu looks so pretty and appetizing!... But not for me.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Signs you are about to have an awesome burger experience:

- The burger (turkey in this case at no extra charge) is bigger than the bun
- Sides are not limited to just fries, but also tasty things like baked beans
- Bun options include a delicious whole wheat
- Service that makes you feel your burger is the most important they'll make all day

Big Mouth is awesome.
author: Jason B.

description: Delicious! Loved the burger and fries and milkshake. Really nice staff too. Loved it.
author: Alyssa K.

description: The Big Mouth Burger with bacon was the best burger I've eaten in a long time... possibly ever. Better than Umami (over-hyped), the Counter (expensive, but good), and Super Duper (not nearly as greasy)
author: Abhishek S.

description:
Fresh, delicious, yummy

We ordered:
the salmon burger with fries
the turkey burger with fries

Everything was made to order, with fresh veggies- made just the way you like it.

I am not one for fries, but these fries were amazing, not greasy at all and still had the skin on them. YUM

The burgers were delicious as well- fresh, juicy- everything you want from a burger.

We will def be returning- there is no doubt about that!
author: Sherri B.

description:
How McDonald's (just a block away) stays in business with Big Mouth around is a mystery to me.  Even if you count my $10.06 tab for Bacon-cheddar cheeseburger with fries and two cans of coke as high,,, what you have to realize is that you get more that two times the food that the same $10 would buy you are McD's.  So two people could buy a burger and split it for a completely satisfying meal.  The food is 10 times better as well.

The burger what just what I needed.  Meat was perfect.  The bacon was a little to crispy for the way I like it but was still very good.   The bacon definitely was not burned in any way.  The cheddar cheese was a peferct match for the rest of the burger and there was plenty of the both the bacon and the cheese.  The veggies were fresh and dawm good.  Purple onions!!  MMMMMM!

Have a look at my photos. The cheese is oozing down the side of a tall patty.  A patty that other so-called burger joints put in the picture for advertising then yank it off the plate right before it's send out to you.  Big Mount delivers the same huge burger tasty on your plate as I had on mine.

The steak fries were the only questionable bit.  I thought they were a little to greasy.  But you know what?  I still ate 3/4 of the fries anyway!

They have soda and beer if you are looking to kick back a brew with your cow.

If you an SF dweller looking for a great charbroiled hamburger then get off yer dead one and get over to Big Mouth Burger.   

If you take public transit  it just a block west from the Mission station on 24th.   If you are taking the highway (101) get off on Chesar Chavez.  Turn left on 24 th and go about a mile.  They are on the right hand side of 24th (north side).

While they aren't Val's (Hayward), Big mouth still makes one tasty burger.  I am going to give them 5'ver  just becasue this is a Bay Area burger place you should visit if you relish great burgers.
author: Chris R.

description:
For lunch, Matt and co-worker brought our "Big" mouth and "Big" appetite to "Big" Mouth Burger place on 24th St.  This place is another one of Matt's "Big" list of bookmarked places.

Being both extremely hungry, we both ordered the "Big Mouth" Burger. Our $6.50 famous classic burger cooked in any way comes with the usual condiments and choice of buns, spreads and comes with complimentary Fries. But, if you want cheese, bacon, avocado or grilled mushrooms they charge an extra $1.00. (Matt: Swiss & avocado Co-worker: American & bacon) Nevertheless, for $8.50 it was a really good and greasy burger. Our burgers were placed in a pizza pan. With a can soda, we left the restaurant for $10.00 a person. 

Yes, Matt has found another 5-star hamburger place and another good restaurant along the long 24th St. Strip.
author: Matt G.

description: Place to get a solid burger and fries. They also have Mitchell's ice cream.
author: Will D.

description:
Fat juicy burgers.
Tasty patties.
All the condiments you could ask for on your burger.
Crispy onion rings and garlic fries.
Mitchell's ice cream shakes.
Fast and friendly service. The owner/manager was nice enough to come out, greet everybody in line, and help out whoever was next in line.
Cool spot to bring some friends.
Great stuff!
author: Alex F.

description:
I really do want to give this place more stars. I got their "hangover burger" - which consists of a bacon cheeseburger with a fried egg on it (one of my favorite burger combos) and chipotle mayo. The size was good and the order came with fries but it wasn't the highest quality thing I've ever eaten. The bacon was especially subpar. It came out with the type of consistency that leaves rock hard strands and reminds you of chewing through beef jerky. Also the price tag was a little higher than I would've liked for what I was getting. Thumbs up for the size and the type of burger but not one of my favorites.

Also, as a pickles-on-the-burger skeptic: they list all of the things that go in their burgers, yet they leave pickles off the list, which are a big part of the toppings that you now have to dig through to fish them out
author: Taylor C.

description: I love this place! Delicious burgers. I come to this place at least once a week. I prefer this spot over any other burger joint in SF.
author: Don D.

description:
When I see good reviews for places like this, it actually disturbs me.  In addition to being extraordinarily boring, Big Mouth Burger managed to hit 4 of my pet peeves in one visit.

1.  Underseasoned, or unseasoned beef.  This is my biggest burger pet peeve.  I tasted the meat by itself, and it had no flavor to speak of.  Since there's a decent amount of the beef, it was like a black hole of flavor that made the whole burger taste bland.  I felt a little gross using the greasy and grimy salt and pepper shaker to try to coax some flavor out of it.  (It still didn't really help)

2.  Overcooked beef.  The menu says their burgers are cooked medium.  Mine was cooked well done.  Not to the point of dryness, but it was not good.  It was actually on the bitter and unpleasant side.

3.  Underseasoned, and soggy fries.  

4.  High price.  


I opted for the chipotle mayo spread.  It had a little zing to it, but it did not add anything to the burger, even when I put on some extra.  It didn't do much for the fries as a dipping sauce either.

2 stars is being very generous.  I am not spiteful about my experience, and the burger was edible.  That is the best I can say about my visit.

Do yourself a favor and read some of the reviews in detail.  Even some of the 3-4 star reviews list a negative experience.
author: Michael K.

description:
MY Metro Navigator once again did me correct..........

Fluffy and I were taking a break from the hectic world surrounding us and decided to drive to the city to take our most prescious Mona to Golden Gate Park for a nice walk ......

Ofcourse I became starving and had to quickly fill my appetite....so Big Mouth we went....

Yummers excellent suggestion navigator I love you the burger was huge I mean freaking gigantic and tasteful...

Usually big burgers don't carry a lot of flavor but this one did....

Also their Root Beer floats are like no other that I have ever seen before in my existence and it was bombers....they dumped some Vanilla Mitchell Ice Cream in a cup and handed me a Root Beer soda wow thanks .....I am a happy girl..

Workers well lets just say I could have been there hanging out all day they are super fantastic.............I know how to get there by heart now!
author: Veronica B.

description: Wanted to try this out because of high yelp ratings. Service is polite and adequate. Burger on the other hand was very dry, charred on the outside and simply disappointing. Fries were as hopeless as can be! Had much better at Barneys up the street.
author: A K.

description: falafel burger, fries, and coke (you're welcome.)
author: Jon T.

description: This place hits spots I didn't even now I had! Swing by. I gobbled up their Giants Burger
author: DJ H.

description: Just happened on this spot on a Sunday lunch. Burgers are HUGE even the kids burgers. I chose the Giants burger with BBQ sauce, onion rings, provolone, and it came with a side of garlic fries. Freaking delicious! Hubbs had the Bleu Cheese burger and it was scrumptious as well! Shared a strawberry milkshake which was ok. Service was fast and friendly, not a very busy time at all. Will definitely be back to try the other burgers!
author: Maribel C.

description:
I believe the consensus is that big mouths should be shut, but this place proves otherwise.  

The burgers are good, delicious and fresh.  The fresh part is kind of key because while one doesn't exactly eat burgers for health, it is nice to have one that isn't a total grease bomb.  Don't get it twisted though, these are still delicious without making you feel like you've been dipping your hands in Crisco.  Despite being "Big Mouth" burgers, I found mine quickly and easily consumed.

Which brings me to the conundrum.  

I want to give Big Mouth the four stars I kind of think it deserves.  However for nearly $10 (I got avocado on mine), I know there are bigger and juicier burgers out there for the price.  It isn't that the burgers here aren't good, just speaking relatively, they don't match up to some of the other awesome meat morsels I've tasted.

We'll see, Burger Wars - San Francisco has just begun...
author: Steven R.

description:
I ate here for the first time today---WOW what a Burger!!  The burger was tasty and done to perfection!  They cut their french fries in house. They have quite a variety of burgers.  I am going to have to eat my way through the menu over the next few months1 I am glad that I tried this Mission Meal Miracle!!

CHEERS
author: John S.

description: This place is fine for a quick meal, but the menu items lack finesse and there is no real melding of the flavors. Good luck appreciating any one part of the food. Garlic fries just taste like raw garlic. Blue cheese burger tastes like cheap blue cheese... it's not that I don't like blue cheese, it's just that... what's the point of having onion on a blue cheese burger if you can't also taste the onion?? Service wasn't that great (didn't get everything I asked for), although it was reasonably fast.
author: P U.

description:
First time here at this restaurant, employee was friendly. We order The 49er Burger for Dinner Yesterday (Saturday) and French Fries. The burger taste okay and size was big. The Steak fries was thick, crunchy, big and good amount serving. It was addicting and filling.  
I would recommend this place if you love burger. I will come back again to this restaurant and eat again here.
author: Gruber T.

description:
Second time I've gone into Big Mouth and got the wrong order. For $19.25 I was given two veggie burgers with cole slaw instead of the two turkey burgers I ordered.  Its a huge pain to get home and find the wrong order. Second time in a row 
Wrote to management and never heard back. Not surprised.
author: Annie A.

description: Some flavorful-sounding burgers, but the real thing didn't live up to the menu. My Giants burger - provolone, bacon, BBQ sauce, lettuce, onion, tomato, pickles - tasted like something I could've gotten at Wendy's. It was there on paper, but the prep lacked any finesse. The garlic fries were a huge disappointment too - totally soggy. Fast and friendly service on a decent Mission price point gets two stars.
author: Jayme B.

description: The little girl behind the counter has a serious attitude. She refused to allow me to switch my salad dressing for a different kind. Ooook, so I'll have my salad dry and ask the nice guys behind the counter for a side of the dressing I wanted. Seems like she's the only person who had an issue with my request. It's too bad cause, I like their burgers and the other people who work there are nice and accommodating.
author: Ms. G.

description:
oh yea.

burger, fries, drink. simple and correct. not much more to stay.
author: Ameer N.

description:
The service was great which makes me feel bad for giving such a poor review.  But I got the Blue cheese burger and fries and would have been happier and walked away a few dollars richer if I had just gone to McDonalds.  And I am not at all a fan of the clown.

The burger just kind of was.  Yeah, it was a burger with blue cheese nothing in particular wrong with it if you like mediocre and blah with a slathering of blue cheese and pesto.

The fries were the biggest disappointment.  I arrived and ordered right before noon and had my food half gone before anyone else showed up for lunch.  Yet, the fries were DOA.  Had my fries not been murdered by a heat lamp or malfunctioning frie-olator and I had been instead greated by hot crispy yet not burnt fries I could have overlooked the mediocre blah burger and this review would garner 3 stars.

It is a shame too as service staff was great.
author: Max Jonathan S.

description: If I could leave them 0 stars I would ]. It took over 20 minutes to get my order and then they give me the wrong thing! It's over priced and not worth it. I WILL NEVER GO THERE AGAIN! The cashier didn't understand what I was saying and now I have to go spend more money on something I don't want!
author: Allie F.

description:
Burgers are good (organic meet), 
lovely service, 
shabby environment.
author: Daib S.

description:
This is one of those places where it can be both advantageous and dangerous to arrive hungry. While the servings are plentiful and hearty, it's also easy to get carried away and get in way over your head... or should I say stomach?

I had the Frontier sandwich (yummy steak) and Ryan B. had the blue cheese burger. Both were great! I should say that they cooked the meat on the Frontier sandwich sort of medium rare, but I like that. If you want yours done differently, make sure to specify that! Eating steak in a burger-like sandwich proved to be a challenge (very chewy compared to ground beef), but the delicious flavor of it more than made up for the cumbersomeness.

We were stupid and got an order of onion rings, even though our sandwiches came with sides. D'oh! Way too much food! And fried food to boot! Like I said, come hungry, but be modest and stick to a sandwich + included side per person. Anything more is too much.

They also have some good beers on tap, like Sierra Nevada and Boont.

All in all, a solid meal at an OK price. Don't expect to be able to do much in the way of physical activity for the rest of the day though.
author: Nicholas F.

description: Definitely my favorite burger spot in the Mission.  I recommend the Blue Cheese Burger.
author: Yoichi N.

description:
Good place with decent burgers, but didn't live up fully to my expectations.

I had a Big Mouth Burger (the "classic") with mild cheddar and chipotle mayo and a side order of sweet potato fries. The burger had a nice char, but the cheese was the best part. The chipotle mayo was decent, but it was applied so sparingly I could barely taste it.

The sauce they give you for the sweet potato fries is tasty, but it doesn't compliment the flavor of the fries and ends up being too mustardy.

A good burger if you're in a pinch, but nothing you'll be craving if you're not already walking by.
author: Nick S.

description: Quality burger and fresh food. Service is pretty average/poor. But sometimes I don't care. Fries are delicious!! Why do they have tv AND radio on at the same time and same level....?
author: Maxime D.

description: Very good burgers. Wait times are not that long.
author: Lem B.

description:
Holy, this place has good sausage. The burgers are okay, and the salmon burger is really dry. Nevertheless, I give this place four stars just for their Louisiana Spicy Cajun Sausage and hearty sides. The Sausage is filleted, juicy, meaty, and spicy in more ways than one. 

Grilled onions + Louisiana Spicy Cajun Sausage + Dijon mustard with side of coleslaw + baked beans + Rootbeer float with Mitchell's Ice cream = intense workout with my  personal trainer...BUT COMPLETELY WORTH IT.

Rosmunde, I'm sorry but you got nothing on this. Word to YO mother.
author: Joann A.

description:
I want to like this place more. I love non-chain burger joints. This place is all right. I live nearby so I'll probably keep going and I'm all right with that. Probably wouldn't make a huge trip out to hit this place.
Haven't had everything on the menu yet. Had the blue cheese burger (it was all right, I think I'm not a huge fan of the blue cheese and pesto combo but that might just be me). Then tried the big mouth burger with bacon. I'll echo other reviewers comments about the bacon. It tasted like it was cooked earlier in the day... just had a chewiness to it when I like my bacon crispy.
They do have a lot of non-burger sandwiches. haven't tried any of them though. I wonder if having too many non-burger options actually is taking away from their burger quality.
author: Eric P.

description: You get what you part for is a nice way to sum this place up. I got upset stomach after going here. The ambience also sucks. The salad is just a bunch of characterless lettuce. Don't order.
author: Neeraj K.

description:
What can I say? I've been on a burger kick recently. Somehow, that magical barnyard mixture of cow meat (the burger) on top of pig meat (the bacon) delicately topped with some secrections of a cow's teat (the cheese) has just been consuming my soul recently. It happens every so often after I get tired of drinking my unicorn horn and rainbow milkshakes.

Anyways, when I walked in, I was pleasantly surprised to see quite the menu selection! You'd think a burger place would only have a lot of burgers (and IMO, that is their general failing). However, this one has chicken, turkey burgers, sausage, and veggie options! I hit up some linguicia.

The linguicia was delish. Juicy, greasy, spicy mustard, and onions on a toasted bun. What more could you want? Oh yeah, a giant pile of fresh cut fries (could have been crispier, but I know this is an artifact of the fresh cut-edness).

There is some beer here too, but nothing too groundbreaking. Its enough to fill the booze void and make sure your liver stays in shape. That being said, for $13 or so, I had a lunchtime pint and a meal that filled me to the brim. Awesome. Lastly, I've gotta compliment the bar seating against the window to watch some 24th street peeps walk on by. Kick ass!

Well done fellas...I'll be back.
author: Sean C.

description:
I've heard nothing but great things about this place and sadly I didn't have the same experience.
I went on a Sat. night about 6:30 and told them I needed to be out by 7:15, no problem they said.
I ordered a basic cheese burger w/bacon and Pesto.  I wanted a shake as I heard they were good but slim pickins as to flavors (for me).  I waited 20 min. for my burger and when it came it wasn't cooked like I asked it to be.  When I commented they said it was "red Pesto", excuse me.  So I sent it back.  When I got there, there were only 2 other diners.  When I sent my food back, there were over 7 tables occupied and 7 waiting in line.  I waited over 20 min. "again" to have my burger cooked well.  When it did arrive it was "almost" done to my liking, and it should have been after 20 min.  Now I have 15 min. to eat this meal.  Fries were good and plentiful, prices reasonable enough.

But this service thing and not having my burger cooked the way I like it and then challenged by this fact, I may not return.

Windows were greasy looking and place smelled like old grease.

I also had to keep asking for silverware as they 1st time they took my plate I lost my set, then I had to get up again, pass through the crowd, try to get someone's attention to get silverware again.  I say, put it out where folks can get to it.

Would I go back, I don't think so.  

I hope your experience is better.
author: Marla B.

description:
OMG! How had I never been here before? The bf and I were craving burgers something fierce last Saturday night so we yelped "burgers" (how Meta, yes, I'm writing on yelp about yelping a place) and this place popped up. So, we made the trek to the Mission. 

I'm  a pretty plain/uncreative burger eater and go the traditional route, so I ordered a cheese burger with a side of baked beans (I LOVE the cole slaw, baked beans, and fries side options) but my bf went for the trifecta: provolone cheese, bacon and avocado with the aioli spread. Can we say "wow!?" He ordered a Tecate beer on tap and it was delicious, crisp, and  icy cold.  I ordered a root beer float...excellent! My Mug root beer came in the can with a cup filled with mounds and mounds of rich, vanilla bean McConnell's ice cream for me to combine to taste.
author: Dee I.

description:
Best burger in a long while.  Big Mouth with spicy chipotle mayo and American cheese on a French roll, extra pickles.  You know how you have that particular feeling on the cutting edge of your teeth, when the bun and burger cling just a little? I like that, and this burger did that.

Well crafted fries too. Will be back.
author: Rob P.

description:
It was a really good burger. 

Only thing I gotta say is the menu is overwhelming. Not clear enough and maybe a little more organizing. Hire a Graphic Designer to make your menu.
author: Anthony P.

description:
Gather round, chilluns, and let me spin you a yarn of beauty and grace, of wonder and wishes and rainbows of beef that will drop into your tummy like a pot of gold created by a leprechaun of beef and fill your head with delicious dreams. 

The always-epic, totally awesome crew from the San Francisco Burger Blog recently visited Big Mouth, and we enjoyed ourselves quite a bit:

http://sanfranciscoburgerblog.tumblr.com/

If you don't want to follow that link, the favoritest burger we had that day was the Hangover. If I had the energy after eating it, I would have given everybody who worked at Big Mouth a high-five, because it was an accomplishment of culinary goodness that rivals the work of Einstein. Except Einstein never put bacon and a fried egg on a cheeseburger, so he must have been totally stupider. 

If you're going for the first time, don't waste your time reading or thinking...ask for the Hangover Burger, then grab a seat and clear your schedule for the rest of the day, because you've got digestin' to do, buddy-boy. It's a half-pound patty, topped with 'merican cheese (that's how true 'mericans pronounce it) and then topped with an egg fried sunny-side up, but not very runny. Then they throw three strips of crispy, awesome bacon on top of that. There's some spicy chipotle mayo involved too, but your mouth will be so busy savoring the burger, cheese, egg and bacon that the mayo will be like the ugly girl who showed up to prom by herself and waited in the corner for somebody to ask her to dance. 

Big Mouth is a great spot to grab a burger for lunch, the prices are good and if you've been having a few drinks, walk past the cheesesteak place next door (which is also pretty great) and get a Hangover Burger. You will fall in love and forsake all others. 

Oh, and the fries and onion rings are also pretty good.
author: Drew H.

description:
Came here on the fly cause its not that far from my bf's place.

The regular burgers look pretty good, but there is only one vegetarian option (garden burger).

I ordered the garden burger, but the place was so hard to hear (and the guy at the register's English wasn't that great) he thought I said big mouth burger.  Garden burger and big mouth burger do not sound the same, but thats what they ended up giving me.

After the burger was finished and they gave it to me and said "big mouth burger" I said "umm I ordered a garden burger"

The guy then said "....I said big mouth burger" and then just kinda turned away and told the guy at the grill to make me a veggie burger.

So not the greatest experience, the burger was alright, but the fries were probably the best.

-2 stars for only having one veggie option and the attitude.  The place is EXTREMELY tiny.  There are tables inside but only enough for 2 people at each table, unless you squish two tables together, but the place is really cramped.
author: Kameron K.

description:
Check your to-go bag before you go. 

If I would have, I would have them redo the blackened fries, which were mostly inedible and, aside from the five yellowish fries I found, ended up in the trash.

Not sure it would have been worth having them redo the dry, tasteless chicken burger especially since other reviews complain of the same. Calling this a 49er burger seems disrespectful.

Next time I'll go back to the much-better Burger Joint up the street.
author: katt a.

description:
Solid burger with AWESOME fries.  Seriously the fries are huge steak style and delicious.

I got the original big mouth burger but they have a lot of different ones including chicken, turkey, pork, salmon, eggplant and veggie so it should make everyone happy.

I would go next door (Phat Philly) for their $2 PBRs.
author: Jason S.

description: Please disregard the last review.  Big Mouth isn't anything special and I don't particularly like eating there.
author: Andy Z.

description:
Another sadly disappointed reviewer here. Maybe I was just expecting a juicy, delicious burger but it was a wide, flat, semi-dry thing. The bun was pretty decent as were the toppings but at that point I was already kinda bummed. Service was mostly indifferent and seemed distracted the entire time we were there.

Worse than that though? THE FRIES. I am so confused, I think I must have had a really bad batch. The ones that were crispy and oily were super delicious however those would be few and far in between. The rest of them were burnt tasting and limp; a huge disappointment to someone who loves potatoes in most forms.

Next time I'll go the opposite direction to Barney's instead.

Thumbs up for the root beer float though.
author: Salina Z.

description: The fries are soggy and mostly inedible. Since they come with the burger you can't not order them so they lose a star for that.The burger was good, but nothing outstanding. Altogether a very average burger place with lousy fries.
author: Jim T.

description:
Burger fans, here is an example of integrity, burger integrity.  I've heard about Big Mouth for a long time and assumed it was out of the way and maybe too much of a greasy spoon, but I FOUND it and love it!  Located in the heart, maybe upper right ventricle, of the Mission at 24th and Valencia, it's kinda hard to find unless you're really looking for it.  Found a parking space, not as hard as I thought it would be, and walked in through their small storefront door.  It's a simple, unpretentious and well worn joint with almost no decor other than the often copied permanent chalkboard menu done in color and calligraphy.  There are four red stools in one front window, the kitchen and pay station on the other.  The cooking area is open and it's all compact and easily navigated for such a tiny space.

The menu is all about burgers, and there are ten varieties plus a Caesar Salad ($5.45) on the menu, but the variety includes their basic Big Mouth, a fresh ground Turkey, a free range chicken breast, thin sliced marinated flank steak, Louisiana Cajun sausage, sliced Pork loin, Eggplant vegetarian, a Garden Burger and their Salmon Burger.  Each of the burgers is offered with a plethora of choices of bread, spreads and cheeses and then there are the sides:  fries, hand cut and the size of Lincoln Logs a kid can barely get his fingers around.  They were perfectly cooked and come with each burger or as side dishes.  

Other things that are enticing to a burger aficionado are the sides which are in addition to the delicious fries are baked beans and a zippy Cole Slaw.  Just below their simple Kid's Menu is a one paragraph list of Beers and Beverages which includes great shakes, malts and floats made to order with our own local Mitchell's Ice Cream, five beers on tap and a handful of bottled varieties and soda's and juices.

This is one of the best burger joints in San Francisco and if you like them a fraction as much as I do, then make sure you make a beeline over to Big Mouth, a true burger emporium of distinction and aplomb.
author: Stu S.

description:
Dude.  I was a wee bit drunk and stumbled like 8 blocks to get here because I had a serious MEAT CRAVING.

This place did not disappoint.  The burger was BIG and JUICY.

The fries were DELICIOUS and LONG and THICK.

Best burger in San Francisco.

(God, I love unnecessary BOLDING of words.  LOVE.)
author: Evan L.

description:
We decided we wanted a burger. I took out my trusty iPhone and fired up my Yelp app and searched for burgers in the area. Big Mouth Burger was the one with the most stars and we aim for good food, so off we went.

Unfortunately, we didn't think there was anything special about the burgers. The ingredients were good, no doubt, but there was something missing.

The burger patties were too round and perfect which led me to believe they were probably frozen like any other patties.

The fries are hand cut, but mine were undercooked and tasted like starch. 

The serving was hearty, I normally clean up my plate but it was too much.

For the price, I wasn't sure it was worth it. I don't know if I'll try it again though--there are too many other restaurants to go to in the area.
author: Inga B.

description: I ordered a sandwich off the "Vegan & Veggie" menu section and asked for no cheese because I am vegan. When I got my sandwich home, it had bacon on it. I brought it back and they refunded me apologetically, but I can only assume that was more malicious than a just mix-up.
author: Sophia L.

description:
I have a softspot for places that are always trying to push the envelope and take everything one step further.

Clearly, a bacon cheeseburger is not enough. What is enough? The Hangover Burger, a bacon cheeseburger with a fried egg! Delicious, delicious overkill.
author: Mark A.

description:
BIG juicy burger and fat steak fries. 

You will not leave hungry. 

From now on we have decided to share a burger and fries and avoid the food coma and meatmares.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
I can't stop thinking about this burger.

I ordered the Hawaiian burger -- sans pineapple -- at nearly 11pm on a Saturday night. I was a few margaritas in and parts of the night remain splotchy but I can't forget the burger.

The fries were delicious and cooked precisely as I like them.  The burger was big, served open, and with just the right amount of teriyaki sauce.  The wait wasn't too bad and the place was close to empty at that time (I think it was near closing). Everyone I was with ordered something different and everyone was pleased.
author: Jeanne M.

description:
OMG!!! Went for the first time last night. Had the Turkey burger which comes with a huge amount of fries (or other sides are optional)!!! It was the tastiest turkey burger I have ever had. I'm sure to be back so I can try everything on on the menu. 

Looking for a burger? Definitely try Big Mouth!!!!!
author: Rita J.

description: this place sucks!! the ambience is not good!! right when you enter the cashier does not smile or is making faces when i ordered!! i prefer the burger stand next to it forgot the name though!!
author: Karlo G.

description:
after not eating red meat for 9 years i started back up recently and now that cow is back in my diet i've been craving it like a crazy person (but not like mad cow crazy).  i was overwhelmed by the menu at big mouth and sorta wish they had more specialty combinations available -- i just wasn't sure what to put on my burger!  i ended up going with something relatively easy and it was damn tasty.  not the best burger i've had since i started eating red meat again but it was good.  the fries were not good though and i ended up throwing most of them away.

maybe the fries would be better if i had dined in instead of taking my lunch home with me...
author: Lauren P.

description:
I was dubious but hungry.  I had just dropped my zipcar off at 24th & Valencia and was faint with hunger.  Big mouth was across the street.  I had to try it.  I ordered the standard cheddar cheeseburger.  Sided up with home made baked beans and beer batter onion rings.  Crimony what a big burger came out!  Tasty and meaty, done perfectly, just the right amount of mayo on it to start.  It was big and perfect.  The baked beans were home made!  Tasty and smokey, cooked aldente.  I would cry but the tears would ruin the bun.  The onion rings done just right, the onion inside perfectly cooked, not greasy.  
After my cholesterol levels drop to just "dangerous", I'll consider going back.  Afterall, I was  almost in heaven.
author: Jim H.

description: Been here twice and definitely a good place a burger in the south end of the mission. Both times the price has been around 10-12.  Small place with only 2 outdoor tables though; both times I've gone were at off hours.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Yum yum yum yum.  I am a veggie burger kind of person and its usually easy to serve an ok one but super hard to serve a great ok.  This place nailed it.  Its smoky and grilled.  The steak fries are delicious and big.  When its nice out they have a great area to sit outside.  

My boyfriend loves the sausage too.  Mmmmm.  So good.
author: Amy N.

description:
Update on Big Mouth's French Fries - 
I stand corrected regarding the french fries @ Big Mouth. I don't know if they changed the way they prepare them or what...but stopped in last night and grabbed a burger/fries/beer and the french fries were outstanding! They were thick and cooked prefectly and had a true potato taste to them.
Big Mouth just moved up on my burger spot list!
author: Terry M.

description:
Sometimes I give in to my cravings and eat here for dinner.

Veggie, turkey or beef - all delicious with cheddar cheese and chipotle spread.  Would you like fries with that?  YES please!
author: Lynda N.

description:
If you want a big, tasty, satisfying burger then Big Mouth Burger is for you! Although the cost is a little on the pricey side for a burger I can tell you with all honesty that it's well worth it. My favorite is just a regular big mouth burger with fries and a side of chipotle mayo. That stuff is spicy (at least for me it is) but good for dipping fries in. Good tip: If you're not too hungry try the small mouth burger.

Bottom line, I'm giving them 4-stars because their Root Beer float is not all that. The ice-cream they use is subpar and a great float is only as good as the two ingredients that go into it - the quality of the ice cream and soda are KEY!
author: Yolee R.

description: Pretty solid little burger joint. Since Papalote's around the corner I've never bothered going in to Big Mouth Burger, but the Mexican place was closed so we ventured out, and now I'm happy we did.  I was pleased to see my good buddy's 'Young, Broke & Beautiful" sticker on the soda machine behind the counter. I took it as a sign and proceeded to order.  We picked out a garden burger with blue cheese and onion rings and a falafel burger (yes - as in a falafel ball rolled into a burger pattie!)  for about $20. I wasn't thrilled with the price, but the taste ultimately won me over.
author: Amber K.

description:
My burger was about average, my friends' burgers were worse.    They charged ALOT for below average burgers.

The fries and onion rings were good.

The service was very friendly.

The chef's worried me -- touching raw meat with no gloves or hand-washing, then handling all other non-cooked parts of the burger.  I'm crossing my fingers I don't get food poisoning...
author: Ben M.

description:
Not the best burgers I've had in the city, but damn close, and DEFINITELY the best within walking distance.  Burgers are enormous, cooked to order (as in, medium rare actually comes medium rare), exceptionally tasty, and vegetables look and taste like real vegetables from real plants.  Also, there's a ton of selection.  (I particularly like having the option of getting avocado slices on my burger!)  They also do a very tasty chicken burger.

Then there's the sides.  Some of the best onion rings in recent memory -- big, battered just right, greasy but not too greasy, and always hot.  And last but not least, the milk shakes.  Ohhhhh baby, the milk shakes.  So tasty.  Mainly, I have to avoid going here too often, because I always end up getting a milkshake and it's always bigger than my head.  But sooo delicious!  Big Mouth Burgers, you ROCK. :D
author: Angela B.

description: Burger satisfaction for sure. meat could have been a little fatter, but all in all I was HELLA full after eating it all. Had HELLA fries that i couldnt finish, but i ate them later. damn that burger was good lol craving it again now. Big Mouth Burger with bacon is the way to go. Gotta go back and try all the burgers they all sound hella good!
author: Raymon B.

description: The burger was memorable.  Delicious and perfectly cooked as were the nice homemade big fries.  Sat in the window and enjoyed watching the endless variety of people in the neighborhood. The place itself could have felt a bit cleaner or something could be done about the decor, given the price.  Two burgers and fries and cole slaw and two sodas was about $ 26.00.
author: elizabeth m.

description: I ordered a really good made-to-order burger from this place.  The portion was enough to feed three, the burger was juicy, the condiments fresh, the service a -okay, and the fries were killer!  Not my absolute fave, but I will return soon for another tasty lunchtime meal!
author: Brendan S.

description:
I had a friend in college who was a peculiar type of gentleman. While he had a brilliant engineering mind, his social skills were (cough) lacking. We would sit in stunned silence as we watched him eat all of his french fries before devouring his cheeseburger in a total of 2 minutes. He also had a habit of placing his hand in his pants among casual company. We didn't see it as an act of perversion; it was just his way of telling us he felt comfortable. Among our group of computer nerds, fondling your twig and berries publicly wasn't discouraged. I think he is now a professor of computer science at an esteemed University you would probably know of. Be afraid, be very afraid.

But overall, he was a nice kid and would LOVE Big Mouth Burgers if he lived in SF. It is comfort food prepared exceptionally well. I often think about my old friend as I sip a corona with a perfect blue cheese burger and fries. It's the good stuff.

In fact, I think I'll give him a call to see what's new. I just hope his hands aren't in his pants while I talk to him.

5 stars.
author: John T.

description: You can't get a better burger than the hangover burger at Big Mouth Burger. You can try... but you will be disappointed. Bacon & eggs on a burger... what scientist at NASA figured this out? Make sure you order runny yolk on your egg, or you won't get the full effect. I recommend the Cheddar cheese as well. Try not to pass out from the awesomeness that hits your tastes buds like some sort of black magic burger spell.
author: Chase L.

description:
This place is over rated!!!  Go to another spot...

First off...I ordered their signature Big Mouth Burger.  I was with a group of friends, and most of us ordered the same thing, to try it out....

BUT WHY was my BURGER OVERCOOKED AND DRY?!!?!?!   Come on now folks!!  

Also, I asked for Grilled Onions, and the cashier even said, "We got you bro."  Then, when my order came, guess what... NO GRILLED ONIONS!!

...and lastly, I was the last one served with my burger, and looked at my friend's orders, and their burgers looked pretty large.  Then, when my burger came... it looked like it was a SHRUNKEN version of my friends burgers, and We ordered the SAME F'N THING!!!

So...

1)  Dry and over cooked burgers 
&
2) doesn't take the orders properly.  They definitely did NOT "Get me bro"
& 
3)  High Chance your burger will be SMALL.  

It's pretty hard to mess up a Burger, but BIG MOUTH does that just right!

...and also, don't get me started with asking for sides of condiments!!!  FYI:  The Sun-Dried Tomato Aioli & spicy chipotle mayo is sparsely used!!!  LOL!!!!  

I DO NOT BELIEVE IN BIG MOUTH BURGERS
author: Samurai J.

description: Since I love burgers with bacon and cheese, I decided to check this place out. The place doesn't look fancy but the food was AMAZING ! I had the hangout burger without chipotle sauce ! Dude half pound of beef with cheese, bacon and a fried egg on the top of it! You need to shower afterwards. I love it !! 5 Stars for sure.
author: Shadi K.

description: Small, cheap place with excellent burgers. Nothing fancy, but the ingredients are always fresh and the service is very friendly.
author: Paul S.

description:
We decided to try out Big Mouth Burgers,simply because ..well who wouldn't want a juicy burger and Pearl Burgers is not near us.

This review is based on take-out.The lady who took our order over the phone was polite and patient.

Big Mouth offers a selection of breads,spreads and extras to go with your sandwich.I thought to myelf the Herb Foccacia for my burger sounded like a match and the roasted garlic as my spread made me drool at the thought of how it would taste.

We ordered:

The Big Mouth Burger on herb foccacia w/ the roasted garlic spread,mild chedder and  toppings:lettuce,tomatoes..etc

The Turkey Burger

Order of fries(good portion) and a strawberry milkshake.

The burger was cooked the way I wanted it and there was nothing wrong with our order since it was to go.The burger had a good taste and I mean the foccacia bread with it was tasty.The meat patty was not that thin,but not overwhelming..just right.The fries were ok,not too thin but not thick as Barney's.

The strawberry milkshake was thick and delicious and the Turkey burger my friend had was ok.


Overall,I really enjoyed the burger and they have veggie options like
the "Californian" w/eggplant,red & green peppers and onion or the 
"Garden Burger" if you don't eat beef. They have a decent selection of burgers also and with that a few decent selection of breads.I would say try the herb foccacia.The spreads:spicy chipotle,pesto and sun-dried tomato will spice that burger up.

I will come back for more fatty food,but Pearl Burger is waiting for me.I will make it there one day,but Big Mouth is worth a try.

Prices decent.
author: Dani D.

description:
So the fam and I just came back from a 3 week trip to Asia.  

IMMEDIATELY upon landing in SFO, we needed a burger.  In a way I have never needed a burger before.  So we dropped off our luggage at home and headed straight to Big Mouth.

It definitely hit the spot.  I made my own burger of sorts (Jack cheese, spicy chipotle mayo on french bread) and the rest of the team tried the Hawaiian burger (teriyaki sauce and pineapple), the blue burger and other variations on the Big Mouth.  The only reason we didn't clean our plates was because the burgers are so massive (and even then, some of us finished).  Fries are thick cut, skin on and very tasty.  Onion rings are solid, but the onion-ring ratio needs some work (a thicker onion would be more satisfying).

I really like the options Big Mouth offers in terms of topping and bread.  Its a great spot for a quick bite, even if you haven't spent the last 3 weeks eating noodles and spring rolls!
author: Kristin P.

description: Soooo good!  These burgers are huge.  While I get the Hangover burger at the San Bruno location, for some reason I always stick with a bacon burger here.  Heaven!  The milkshakes are awesome because they use Mitchell's ice cream.
author: Tamara N.

description:
This place probably serves one of the best burgers in the Bay Area!

We didn't know where to go for lunch so I suggested Big Mouth since I've always wanted to come here and try it out. Parking is horrible! But you are in the Mission District and so be prepared to circle around the blocks..

One thing that made me want to come here is because their burgers are hormone free!!

I went for the Big Mouth Burger. You can choose from different types of bread.. lots of different spreads... and CHEESE...

I'm a plain kinda gal so I just chose the plain bun with plain mayo, and American cheese.. What makes me like a burger is when it comes out, the cheese is MELTED. I HATE seeing that my cheese is not melted!!!! It looks disturbing to me. They not only give you one slice but TWO! The burger was huge! It was served with the original toppings of lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, and red onions..

Served on the side with it is the french fries! I don't wanna be a Rachel Ray but I just gotta say those fries were YUMMO! 

They even have a kids menu.. and are vegetarian friendly!

Service couldn't of been any better!
author: Juliane N.

description: Four words: Best.  Turkey.  Burger.  Ever!  I have eaten and enjoyed many a turkey burger (don't eat red meat, so it's a nice alternative), and when I bit into this one, I wasn't even sure it was turkey!  To me, it tasted like all out charbroiled beef.  Amazing!  Next time, I'll get one w/ avocado on it!  Mmmm!  I have passed by this place a hundred times and never popped in for a bite until today.  I'm so glad I did!  I had a caesar salad on the side (instead of fries,beans or coleslaw), and it was ok.  Not the greatest, but it was nice and refreshing and filled me up.  I will definitely be coming back in the future!
author: Beth H.

description:
I've been in search of a wonderful burger experience since I had the $10 blue cheese burger in 1993 at Stars Restaurant.  I haven't gone back to Stars even though they relaunched in 1999--Lord knows what they're charging their burgers for right now!!!  Forget the Persian carpet, I wanna reasonably priced "good" burger

Today, I found the Holy Grail burger -- a 2007 blue cheese burger for $7.40 made with natural ground chuck "without hormones, antibiotics, insecticides or chemical residues" (so their to-go menu says) that comes with a good-sized order of fresh but french fries. 

The burger came medium. It wasn't dry (lots of places seem to put so much bread crumb in the burgers that they might qualify for being vegetarian) or skimpy or overcooked or undercooked. It also didn't come with a smear of yellow stuff masquerading as mayonnaise.

My blue cheese burger was magnificent and satisfying.  My husband--the strong and silent type from the Steve McQueen mold--said, "It was 'K. We'll come back again." He had the burger with pepper jack cheese and a side order of cole slaw.  He doesn't like cole slaw!!!  He seemed to have liked it here.  I wonder if there are people who order their burgers with a side of baked beans.

It's a pretty good menu. The food is made to order with your choice of breads, spreads and french fries, baked beans, or cole slaw.

Breads Choices: plain bun, wheat bun, french roll, herb foccacia

Spread Choices: plain mayo, spicy chipotle mayo, bbq sauce, teriyaki sauce, roasted garlic, pesto with lots of garlic, and sun-dried tomato aioli.

Extras ($.95 each): blue cheese, swiss, mild cheddar, pepper jack, provolone, american, mushrooms, bacon, avocado.

Their big mouth burger comes with lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, red onions, and mayo & a side for $6.40.

For $6.40, you can have a
turkey burger
cajun sausage sandwich
eggplant sandwich
garden burger

For $6.95, you can have a
chicken breast burger
marinated steak burger 
pork loin sandwich


For $7.40, you can have a
blue cheese burger with pesto aioli
salmon burger

The caesar salad is $5.95 plain or $7.95 with salmon or chicken.

Sides are $1.95 (half) or $2.75 (full)

Now get this... their shakes are $3.50 and made with Mitchell's Ice Cream! I remembered being horrified at Joe's Cable Car Restaurant where the prices for shakes aren't listed but the waitresses can give you a quote!

No more even thinking about 
Joe's Cable Car Restaurant
Starvin Marvin's (I know why they're starving)
Gunter's
The Bashful Bull
The Burger Joint
Nation's
Beep's
Whiz Burgers
Clown Alley
In -n- Out
Fudruckers
Sliders
Barney's
Mel's

The only other restaurant I'd go back to for a burger is Bullshead and that's for a classy burger where I can hold hands with my husband and all that sort of thing at a real restaurant with wait people.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
I guess my expectations were too high.  This fatal flaw was due to two reasons:

1.) I heard amazing things about Big Mouth
2.) I had just eaten at Taylor's Automatic Refresher a few days before.

I ordered the veggie burger, but the lady at the cashier failed to inform me that I had choices.  Yes, I should have examined the menu more closely, but as this was my first time and I was nervous (liken to *the* first time?), I just announced that I wanted the veg burger.  I didn't know that I could choose my sauce, cheese, or extras.  Usually people ask, "would you like..... with that?"

As for the burger, it was decent, but as the cook informed me, it came from a pre-bought box in the freezer.  All they did was unwrap and thaw it.  My unskilled ass could have made it at home.

Furthermore, like many burger joints who overlook the growing vegetarian population, my burger was thrown together with far less care than the other meat burgers at tables around me.
author: Christine M.

description:
I really love hamburgers but they have to be great for me to really fall in love with them.  And of course you get what you pay for.  My husband took me over here on my lunch break and the following day our stomachs did not think the experience was that great either.
My burger quest continues....
author: Holly L.

description:
Ohh yea!  A burger and fries please!  No... not flies... fries!

Big Mouth Burger makes a good burger. But beware, when you enter the establishment, the flies circling the middle of the room might throw you off.  It's kinda amusing how all the customers are hunkered down along the sides enjoying their meal.

I ordered their signature burger with mushrooms.  Their burgers are made to order, so you get to choose your choice of bread (plain, wheat, french, herb foccacia) and at least 7 types of spread.  All their sandwiches and burgers come with a side of fries, baked beans or cole slaw.

When I got my burger, I sat outside to catch some rays and escape from the swarm.  I could smell the charbroiled meat and mushrooms rocking out from between the bun right before I took my first bite.  Tasty!  Good size burger and the red onions, lettuce and pickles were fresh.  Top it off with their fat french fries and you have a good meal for a decent price.

Solid burger joint in the Mission.
author: Sam T.

description:
This place is seriously over rated. It's a bit funky but if you can't take funk don't come to the mission. The staff is friendly enough but not organized. For some reason they completely finished my burger before they started the fries so the burger was cold before I got it. They over cooked my burger, instead of medium it was well done.  The bread was a bit stale which made it dry and the pesto aioli was kind of bland. I just expected more from the reviews and the $8.63 the total came to for a burger and fries. I can make better at home. The best burger in town is at the rotunda at Neman Markus.

******updated 6/26*****

Last night I had to get something fast after work because I had something to do soon after and stopped at Jack in the box. They have a sirloin Cheese burger that you can get with cheddar cheese and grilled onions that beat the hell out of the burger I got at Big mouth. It's pretty sad when you're beat by fast food.
author: Manny F.

description:
Yum!

This place is good. They have a lot of options, and I can't comment on all of them. But their chicken sandwich and turkey burger are both delicious.  They have above average fries - not fantastic, but a good mix of crispy outside and soft interior, at least when hot. They are not as good when they cool down so I recommend chowing down on them first, especially if you think you are hungry enough to conquer them and your very generously sized burger.
author: neil c.

description:
the other night my bar manager came to work with a Big Mouth Berger and said "Hey Sweetie wanna share this burger with me?" I looked at it and thought man that is a big burger....alittle puzzle...and scared.
But I thought " Okay thanks I will have alittle and some of your fryes" 
I took bite and it was man so good. 

I have not been to the establishment but take is just as good. That is why I only gave it 3 star but I will update. I really like their burgers.
author: Der Maibaum L.

description:
I ordered the following:

Big Mouth Burger on a Herb Focaccia Bread with American cheese and bacon & Fries (I spared no prisoners to my artery valves)  

Not having had a burger in a while, I came into here with my mouth salivating for a good juicy cheeseburger.  I could say that I left full, but was left wanting more on my taste buds.  I guess I came to Big Mouth expecting more than what i received.  Don't get me wrong the place was good, but I have had better burgers.  Good and friendly customer service was a good plus. 

I guess my saying has to come into affect "I will try any food twice" to see if  I missed something.  Keep posted for my update.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Big Mouth has been a weekly addiction for me for the last few years, and easily earns 4 stars for their LARGE, mouth-watering, perfectly grilled burgers and delicious fries (the fries really deserve their own review - they are PERFECT). They deserve all the reviews that call them one of the best burgers in the bay--every bit as good as Barney's and Burgermeister.

WHAT EARNS THE 5th STAR is their new "Chevap" sandwich - this is an anglicized spelling of Bosnia's famed Cevapi.  Spiced skinless thumb-sized sausages with onions served in a ciabatta.  My recommendation for eating it is not to bring the whole thing to your mouth like a burger, but to use your fingers or a fork to eat the sausages and tear off hunks of bread (which is slightly soggy from the grease...mmmmm....).  That's how they do it in Sarajevo and Banja Luka.  And my friends: IT IS DELICIOUS.

With my first bite, i was transported back to the Bascarsija district of Sarajevo, with minarets overhead and the sound of coppersmiths ringing down the cobblestone streets, and the rich smell of chevapi wafting from every corner. Big Mouth's Chevap sandwich isn't as good as that, but it's a close second, and to my knowledge, they're the only people in San Francisco with this sandwich.

To be fair, they should serve it in a thick pita-like bread, and a simple cucumber and tomato salad would be a nice side (i recommend the coleslaw as a side for this - fries are too much, the grease-soaked ciabatta is enough). But that doesn't take away from the fact that this is some TASTY food.

GOOD WORK, BIG MOUTH!!
author: Zachary L.

description:
I don't know why it's taken me so long to write up a review for Big mouth, since I've been coming here for years. I came here more often when I was going through the whole I hate meat, give me veggies stage because they have tasty veggie burgers, and big portions of ceasar salad. Thankfully I got through that stage and am now stuck with choices, choices, so many choices. You want: veggie?salad?sausage?chicken?something with bbq on it? They have any of these options. And if you really can't figure out whether you are craving a hot dog, or burger...they have a perfect compromise : The cajun sausage (spicy!).

For about $8  you get a burger with cheese, your choice of buns and spreads and a side of fries, or beans, or slaw.
author: X marks the spot ..

description:
100 reviews?!  by god!

Big Mouth is a good place for a decent, cheap burger in the hood.  It's not amazing, but not horrible either.   Their fries are pretty good and they do them frjtz style with special flavored sauces to go with them.  

I still like Burgermeister better, Zeitgeist wins for best atmosphere, and Slow Club has the best burgers in town.... but, if you're hungry and don't feel like traveling far then Big Mouth Burger is always a good bet.
author: Shayna N.

description: That was a damn good turkey burger. Their home fries were rocking too and they serve beer. No fancy decor like Burger Joint, but that doesn't matter it's good enough...
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Who here watches HIMYM? If you don't recognize the acronym, you probably won't be familiar with the episode I'm about to rave about.

Marshall and his hunt for the best burger in NYC. Poor Robin wasn't able to get one single bite due to bad timing, so she started eating out of the trash. Goliath National Bank and Barney. Legendary. Regis left his live game show at the ring of Barney's call. 

That had to be one of my favorite HIMYM episodes. So why do I share this? Because my sister and I had that exact craving... to seek out the moistest, juiciest, delicious burger in all of San Francisco. 

Did Big Mouth meet that standard? For that evening, yes. On other occasions? Sure did. I've had the Big Mouth Burger and a Southwestern a few times. MMMM... pair it up with onion rings and you're set for food coma heaven.

Typically I wouldn't pay more than $10 for a burger meal, but I'm more than happy to drop the money to get the euphoric feel from Big Mouth any day... until I gain 50 pounds, that is. 

Clean restrooms! I've christened it and can tell you... it's wonderfully clean.
author: Teresa Y.

description:
Walking back from the 24th St. BART I decide on an alternate route.

I pass the Bethel Christian Church on 24th and Valencia, a church I've always thought was pretty and wanted to try out; My thoughts:

oh Jesus!!  ok what time is the Sunday late service? mkay, 11am, not bad, not bad - enough time to kinda get rid of my hangover, I mean if I have one... of course the better thing to do would be to just stay in on a Saturday, yeah. i'll just do that one weekend. i can do that. i can do that? i CAN do it! I can.

The devil on my shoulder starts to cackle.

HEY! Big Mouth Burger!  I've always wanted to try that place out, too!  Perfect, I'll go to church one morning and then eat lunch and have beers here afterward with all my new friends!  Wait.
author: Kelly H.

description:
Don't need much to fancy up my burger. I need beef, grilled--cheese, American--mustard, yellow--onion, white--ketchup, mayo, tomato, and lettuce on a bun. Give me a pile of fries and two pints of beer. Big Mouth Burger gives you that beautiful staple of American culture that is the good ol' fashioned cheeseburger. They use fresh ingredients, quality beef, and it comes hot and seasoned correctly. The staff is friendly as well. Don't know what else you can ask for.

I used to live like 100 feet from this place, and I had to try hard not to eat here once a week. Not that I didn't want to, it's just I realized that I gained a pound every time I killed a Big Mouth Burger, and I had to take at least a two-hour nap afterwards.
author: Berg W.

description:
Sometimes a girl must indulge in a hearty meal that requires an intense workout for days to come. This place made me forget about my girlish figure. I love food, and nothing beats gorging down food with my greasy fingers complete with a savory burger, fries, and a coke (or beer if you prefer!). 

I finally visited Big Mouth, attracted by their colorful chalk board menu. A variety of burgers to choose from, along with turkey burgers, veggie burgers, chicken, and steak sandwiches. Oh, and a small kids menu as well. Yes they carry a few selections of beer. They offer different spreads too (chipotle mayo, pesto, etc.). My final decision was the Blue Cheese burger with fries on a herb focaccia bun. With my big mouth I took a huge bite, and wow I was quite impressed. Very nice flavors...pesto really topped it off. The blue cheese was very creamy and flavorful. And the fries: yum! big steak like fries skin & all! It's always fun when your fingers get super greasy, and by the end of the meal there's a mound of napkins in front of you. 

I was happy with the service, and the lady at the front was very nice. I like the fact that she said "Thank you" as we walked out. As for the eating area, a small squishy place, so huge groups of people aren't advised. And yes, they take cash & card.

Well, wiping my greasy fingers all over myself, I walked out feeling satisfied with adding to my clogged arteries. Man I slept well that night.
author: Catherine O.

description: One of my office's favorite haunts for lunch. The garlic fries are especially awesome
author: Angela V.

description:
OK, so I am on a mission to find the best goddamn burger in SF.
Yesterday I went to Joes Cable Car, today I went to Big Mouth... these were my first and only trips so far to both establishments. 

I figured I would have a good shot between the two of these highly rated burger joints at finding the "golden" burger judging from all the reviews either proclaiming that Joes was indeed THE best even though its a ripoff or that Big Mouth is THE best even though its half the price of Joes.

Well here's the straight story fellow burger questers:
Big Mouth Burger is no Joes Cable Car... not even close. At half the price I would expect this though. At Joes they just use finer meat and cook to order, at Big Mouth a burger is a burger (and I must say mine was too well done). The buns and the supporting leafage is comparable at both places.  

Fries:
The fries at Joes are really good. Not too dry not too greasy. True they dont come with your $10 burger but they are superior to the Big Mouth Burger fries (which are included in your $7 burger). 

Service:
Joes wins. Big Mouth Burger is a dump and my cashier girl was a ditz. She forgot my girlfriends shake until we were both nearly finished with our meal. 

Decor:
Joes - clean but cheesy, Big Mouth - gnarly and nasty grungorama.

Bottom Line:
Joes is so far the best burger I've had. The consistency of my medium rare burger was SO light and SO fluffy... it was really indescribable. I read a review calling the Joes patty "loose" and I think thats right on in a really tasty way. 

Big Mouth is nothing special really, the burger was ho hum IMO. I left Joes feeling good and satiated but almost wanting another burger, I left big mouth with a brick in my stomach. 

If you want the best burger and dont mind spending 15 at the min for a basic meal... look no farther than Joes Cable Car.
author: Adam G.

description:
Yum, that was good.

I really liked this place.  It's a solid burger.   Nothing too fancy, just a nice little burger spot.

A friend recommended this place so I checked it out.  I ordered a cheeseburger (why yes, it was cheddar) and some fries.  No shake this time around.

The fries are great, I'll go ahead and say in the top 5 for SF.  The burger was cooked well, the ingredients tasted fresh and I left the place full.  

The restaurant was on the small side, but nice and clean.  It has some seats along the front window, so there's your people watching right there.
author: Charles R.

description: Anyone who thinks all Europeans are epicurean sophisticates ought to meet my German cousin. Provincial as all get out and every time I asked him what he'd like to eat I'd get the same answer- "burger!" On his last day in the city, I decided to indulge him once again and took him to Big Mouth after a trip up to Twin Peaks. He had the turkey burger and fries and seemed pleased as punch with his selection. Truth be told I was pretty happy with my order too though next time I think I'll go with the small mouth burger (from the kids menu) as I could only eat about half of my big mouth burger. Fries are good. Not as good as Kelly's but tasty nonetheless.
author: Miriam W.

description:
My BF lived reallllyyyy close (almost too close) to Big Mouth Burger and we probably could have eaten there every day.  I can't find one single thing to complain about the burgers, they are SO good...and ginormous.  We used to share a burger and fries and be satisfied.  Love the fries too, nice and hot and salty, and not the weird thin Mcdonalds ones I'm not a fan of.  

A fantastic burger place, absolutely.  Eat it there so you can enjoy it in it's freshest form.
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
Here's the thing.  This place has really good burgers.  The fries were okay.  The table was sticky, which really pairs poorly with finger food, since I have to hover my limbs above the table while eating, lest I contaminate my burger with....whatever's on the table.

I must, once again, recommend Pearl Burger instead.  The burgers are better, the fries are better, the shakes are better, the ambiance is better, the restaurant is cleaner.  Big Mouth is decent.  Prices are fine.  But it's nothing to write home about.  Which means 3 stars.
author: Ben P.

description:
Yes, indeed these burgers are ideal for a big appetite. 

Made to your liking, served with a heapful of fries, and delivered to you on a pizza pan. I enjoyed a classic burger that was juicy and cooked perfectly. On my second visit, I  was surprised to find a very big portioned Grilled Chicken Caesar salad that was fresh, crisp and had a good amount of dressing without overpowering.

Hats off to some good ol' burgers!
author: Dave S.

description:
The name doesn't lie.  It was a big burger.  Tasty, too.  I really liked the pesto and bleu cheese burger.  

It is a great people watching location and pretty damn convenient.  Not overpriced and THEY HAVE BEER.  That steals a point from In-n-Out.

So, yeah.  If you want a burger in the Mission, go here.  It kicks Burger Joint's ass.
author: Dottie G.

description:
So a couple of weeks ago I had a deadline, 24 hours, tick tock - do you hear the clock ticking?- and a paper to write.  I was blaming myself for not starting earlier, it's a bad habit. 

In front of me, I had a burger and fries.  And all those thoughts ("You could've started earlier Glu! How many hours left? Why do I do this to myself?") just went away with my first bite of fries. Perfection. Food so delicious that you're only concentrating on what you're eating.  Then came the burger.  Highlights were the patty and cheese. Juicy and fulfilling. Yum. 

I don't know how I managed to finish, but I did.  I was satisfied and I could barely move. Roll over. Burp. 

And I also finished the paper.
author: Glu C.

description:
Truly Great burgers and fries. 
Sorry this will have to be a redundant one letter review:
mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
author: Tyler A.

description:
Really..freaking...good.  Not quite perfect in every way, but really good.  It's a little on the pricey side, but if you only do a burger once in a very rare while, it's worth it.

Ambiance: 4 stars (clean but unexceptional, but what were you expecting from a burger joint.  That said, we could eat outside w/ our dog which isn't an option everywhere.)
Price: 4 stars ($21 for one kid's cheeseburger [3 oz. of meat], one mushroom swiss burger [8 oz. meat], and two beers. We consider the fact that you can pay with a credit card a plus)
Food: 5 stars (both burgers were ordered medium rare and were  properly cooked.  The cheeseburger was beautiful and simple, the mushroom swiss burger was succulent and awe-inspiring.  Fries are the thick ones...very fresh.  The fact that they served beer was nice too.) 
Service: 5 stars (this wasn't a "waiter" sort of place, so the standards are different.  Still, our food arrived in a reasonable amount of time, everyone was friendly, and they cleaned up promptly.)

This place is a touch too far away to become "our burger place" but it's still good eats.
author: Thomas K.

description: Pretty solid little burger joint. Since Papalote's around the corner I've never bothered going in to Big Mouth Burger, but the Mexican place was closed so we ventured out, and now I'm happy we did.  I took it as a sign and proceeded to order.  We picked out a garden burger with blue cheese and onion rings and a falafel burger (yes - as in a falafel ball rolled into a burger pattie!)  for about $20. I wasn't thrilled with the price, but the taste ultimately won me over.
author: Traviseo L.

description:
I'm SO SORRY Big Mouth!
