I guess I'm a superficial bastard, but can you blame me?  I mean, your yellow awning is kinda old and dirty looking, and the font (if you can call it that) is... well, ugly!  The brown-on-brown-on-brown interior is also barfy looking, and the multiple paint treatments are nauseating.

I've dismissed you all these years, even though I pass you every day on my way to Bart.  Well, no longer!  I recently tasted your giganto, juicy Big Mouth burger and your super thick-cut, crispy on the outside, hot and fluffy on the inside fries with the skins on.  It was simple!  It was delicious!  Such flavor!  Who knew you use natural beef?  And use Mitchell's ice cream in your root beer floats?  The service also rocks!  I'm in love!
author: Vicente G.

description:
i didn't know that the best root beer float i could ever concieve of would be served in a red plastic cup. aren't those only used specifically for PBR from a sweaty house party keg? I guess either way i'd be absolutely delighted. 


(the burgers are fucking delicious too by the way)
author: diana m.

description:
Do you ever think as lunch time rolls around, "gee, a BURGER would be fantastic!"
But you end up sorry for it as the food you get doesn't seem to match your minds eye of a "burger".
Every time I go here to Big Mouth, I get exactly what I was craving - a good burger.
Consistency in the red meat trade is priceless.
Thankfully they don't know that and value it at about 6.95 a plate.
SCORE!
;-)
author: Theo R.

description:
Wowzers. This place has an amazing veggie burger, and the salmon burger ain't bad either. I have lived next door to Big Mouth for 2.5 years now, and never went there until I started dating a hard core carnivore. I always knew they had a veggie burger, but I have grown weary over the years of ordering veggie burgers from burger joints as they are usually the same old frozen garden burger that you could heat up for yourself for $.50. Last night, however, I was lazy and decided to give it a try, and whopppeeee!! 

Vegetarians should unite around this veggie burger....
author: Jennifer C.

description: I live nearby and always wanted to try this place out, but never had the time until today. I walked in and looked at the menu. As soon as I saw the word "Salmon" I knew what to order. I ordered a Salmon burger along with a side of fries. Both weren't that bad at all. The salmon burger tasted great, not too dry and not too undercooked either. The fries tasted like they were from actual potatoes! I ordered to go so I didn't notice any cockroaches or flies flying around. The restaurant looked clean enough to me. Another plus is that they serve Mitchell's Ice Cream. I'm just a little bit irritated that they couldn't get my first name right...
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Best. Burger. Ever.

Seriously, you go to a place like Joe's Cable Car and you're like, "it's pretty good, I guess...", and you're trying to figure out exactly what the hype is all about.

But here, one bite and all will be made clear.

The best thing is that there's lots of interesting buns, cheeses, sauces and toppings to choose from, so you can really make a burger tailored to your own particular tastes.
author: Wes M.

description:
BEST BURGER IN TOWN!!!

nice and efficient staff
affordable 
huge servings/portions
variety of bread
owner is nice and pleasant to everyone
next door from where i live

nuff said
author: Malou C.

description: Okay...I've been here a few times and would give the burgers a 3.5 but I just called for a pick up order and the women on the phone was so rude. Her attitude was quite overwhelming and she sounded so bothered to explain that they did not have certain items on the menu She also hung up the phone without stating a price or how long it would take. I know this place is supposed to be a dive and I don't particularly expect chipper employees but no need to make your customers feel bad.
author: Kimberly M.

description: I have eaten here twice so far. Good burgers, flat and large. A good variety of build it yourself items, for a decent price. The fries are thicker then what I like--not crispy enough. The onion rings are good. Service is pretty fast, and they bring it out to where you are sitting. The first time I came here the order taker was like an automaton, maybe the end of his shift?; the second time I came here, the order taker was eating his burger, and when he came to the register he had ketchup smeared across his face. I tried not to look at him. The main downside to eating here is the overhead TV that is running all the time. Last time we ate here, we sat in the window seats and couldn't see the TV, but could still hear the other patrons discussing what was playing.
author: Herschell L.

description:
I give Big Mouth 5 stars in reflection of their food quality only.  The Big Mouth burger will ruin you for other burgers of the cow, chicken, and turkey variety.  My favorite is the Joe Biden: a swiss cheese burger with jalapeno peppers and a root beer.

I must admit that service could use a bit more of a smile.  I'm not wiling to lower their star rating because of this, but I do wish they were a bit more friendly (and a bit more organized) behind the counter.  Also, the ranch sauce that comes with the onion rings must be made of liquid gold, because they ration is out in thimble-sized containers.

Still, this is the best burger in town, by far.
author: Brian L.

description: I didn't notice any signage regarding "Mega Mouth"; perhaps they decided to keep thier original name.  Like the first two posters, I have to say the fries were awesome.  I describe them as In-N-Out, but thicker and hence better.  I enjoyed my burger with mild cheddar and felt the quality of all the ingredients was first-rate and very fresh.  Good cheese, spread, and bun selections.
author: Marc S.

description: This place is good because you can upgrade your burger into something fancier without paying fancy-restaurant prices for it. For example, my boyfriend and I split a burger with tomato-aioli spread and pepperjack cheese. It was pretty good. The fries are really thick... not quite steak fries, but i think they are made from real potatoes.. i might prefer the thin ones. all in all, a pretty decent burger. i'm not itching to come back but if i'm in the neighborhood and craving a burger, i'd probably go to big mouth. (a burger, a beer, and an order of fries = $14)
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Perfectly, flame grilled burger dripping with artery clogging meat juice ...CHECK!

Just out of the fryer, hand-cut steak fries still glistening from its momentary oil bath ...CHECK!

Flawlessly, blended Mitchell's vanilla milk shakes with the smooth and creamy consistency of the finest foie gras...CHECK!

An emergency 10 AM appointment to see a cardiologist...MINUS ONE STAR!!
author: James C.

description:
Ultra-casual inexpensive burger love-in! 

If Fuddruckers was a residential home then this would be its guest house...found metered parking next to the church across the street...easy to spot with the artsy store sign...as casual as an airport cafeteria...chalkboard overhead documents the wide variety of choices (buns, sauces, meat/veggie/salmon options, beverages, sides,..etc.)  genuinely friendly young staff takes order at register and gives a number dais...diverse non-alcoholic beverage selection behind glass window in view...beers on tap...serve it yourself water in dixie cups...after much indecision, I went for the traditional BMB hamburger with the works though they offer all sorts of theme burgers (the hawaiian with a pineapple slice, the texan with pork and bbq sauce...etc)...

Well-proportioned colloidal suspension that is their rootbeer float...they use famed Mitchell's ice cream for the float aspect!...stack of Onion newspapers near the door;  so I laughed mao over a couple articles while waiting for my order...storefront window seating was fun to watch the random people walking by.

Meals cleverly presented on wax paper on a frisbee sized aluminum metal pizza plates...I've probably had one too many happy meals so my senses are warped, but it was one of the freshest burgers I've ever been served in a restaurant....flame-grilled left some minor charring...high quality hamburger meat with fresh sesame seed bun, fresh lettuce, plump fresh tomatoes...tasted like it had just been served off my neighbor's grill at a Fourth of July picnic.  

French fries had all the positive attributes of both major fry types (apologies to Houston's stringies) meaning they were (1) thick and real like homemade pub fries; and (2) golden and crisp rectangles like a 1950s burger joint.  No brand name condiments in sight...instead red and yellow plastic squeeze cylinders...fries were so good that my companion and I paper-rock-scissored for the last one. 

If you happen to overindulge the prior evening (e.g. Zeigeist followed by Amnesia) then this place is the cure!
author: Matthew L.

description:
So I took a stroll down in to the Mission, to run some errands.  I hit the library (yeah, I wasn't one of those folks waiting at home for Harry Potter to arrive) to pick up some flicks.  

Getting hungry, I stopped on in at Big Mouth.  I've passed by this place several times and always thought, I love burgers, why the hell have I not tried out this place?

Got the basic hamburger with cheese, and half order of fries all for under 8 bucks.  It is a big burger, but not as juicy as I thought it would be, so I was a little bummed about that.  I think it would have better if it was cooked medium or medium rare, I don't know if you can ask them to cook it a specific way.  The fresh cut fries were tasty, there were some soft ones, but the majority were nice and crispy.  

Would I go back?  Only, if I'm feeling the need for a burger and was in the area for convenience sakes.  I still prefer Fat Burger.
author: Jenn A.

description:
I love cheese burgers.  I have even been to cheese burgers annon.  I can't be helped.

Burgers are my crack and Big Mouth is my dealer.  The food isn't super cheap but the food is high quality.  Every sandwich on the menu is really good.  The chicken, the vegi and the beef.  All great.

As everyone else has already said, the fries are off the chain also.  Get your burger on.

Woot.
author: Thadd L.

description:
BBQ sauce on burgers? Hell yes. Messy as hell? Hell yes. Great fries? Purgatory yes.

Everything at this place is pretty great, but the fries lack flavor. Maybe it's grease that's missing?
author: Andrew T.

description:
I'm informed by my fellow diners that it's wrong to use 'potatoey' as a positive attribute of fries. But the fries at Big Mouth are indeed potatey, and are perhaps the best fries I've so-far sampled in America.

The burgers are like your favourite uncle - solid and honest, not fancy, and without pretense. Also, they're full of tasty cheese.
author: Glen M.

description:
Pretty good burgers!
The fries are just okay, I prefer french fries without the potato skin.

It's nice that they are near the 24th street BART station, because it's very difficult to find parking in that area.
author: George M.

description:
I just had the blue cheese burger for the first time, SOOOO gooood.  I usually go to Barney's up 24th street, but forget about it -  this is my new first choice for the ultimate hangover meal. 

The wheat buns are REALLY good, their american cheese MELTS in your mouth.  And the ranch, don't even get me started (but...put it in bigger containers!)

The best part about it is that use Mitchell's ice cream for their shakes.

Not like i have, but it sounds like you can actually eat healthy there too, they have veggie and salmon burgers as well.  

I have eaten there once and don't care for the atmosphere, just get it to go and take it home. YUMMMMM.
author: B H.

description:
I had the Texan sandwich here last week, and was disappointed. Plenty of food - in fact, too much - but the thick slabs of pork tasted prefab, somehow, with a texture reminiscent of canned ham. The barbecue sauce was skimpy and wasn't all that, anyhow.

The fries, however, were delicious: salty, earthy, abundant. And hot.

So: Two stars for the fries all by theirselves; one more star for the cool name. Since so many other yelpers recommend the stuff I didn't try, Big Mouth gets one more chance.
author: Michaele M.

description: I always order the same thing....big mouth burger with cheddar, no tomatoes. Currently, I think this is the best burger in the city. Try it out. Plus, they have cold beer on tap, and water for my dog.
author: Devi G.

description: Fantastic find.  Huge burgers, quality meat, nice thick fries, and Mitchell's milkshakes.  Love it.
author: Laurence W.

description:
I used to walk by Big Mouth every day on my way up the hill from BART, and I always wanted to go in and get a milkshake; however, I was walking up the hill in an effort to walk other such caloric delights, so I figured I shouldn't. I broke down one day and bought a chocolate milkshake, which they make with Mitchell's ice cream. It was pretty tasty, but rather small for the price.

Milkshake scale: Most of the boys to the yard. (http://www.yelp.com/list_details?favorites_list_id=quuUwlD01pr7A2ilWll59g&fsid=ynm2A3vgDA8geOZCJKti8g)
author: Katie I.

description:
I walk by this place all the time and decided to try it when my friend was craving a big juicy burger. We'd previously tried Barneys in Noe Valley so thought we'd do something different. He got the 49er (chicken breast) with pesto spread, and I got the turkey burger with mushrooms. Both were fairly disappointing. 

My turkey burger had a burnt charcoal-ey taste. Some like that, but I definitely don't. And it was not very juicy at all. I ate half and didn't finish the rest. The 49er was just ok, not very flavorful or juicy. Ate a bite and didn't want any more. The fries are huge and thick, and so pretty decent but I just prefer my fries skinny. I think the best part of the meal were the sauteed mushrooms (which I ate on their own) and the fries. Would definitely not come back here, Barney's was way better.
author: Humaira M.

description:
This is my second favorite place to go for a burger in the city. The service is okay, and they could really use a soda fountain here. A single can of soda isn't enough to make it through a burger and fries here.

I usually get a cheddar burger on a wheat bun here, with fries. The fries are very good, but it's so much food that you'll likely be unable to finish it all.

It can take a while for your food to get ready, I've waited as long as 20 minutes for my food. I suggest bringing someone to talk to, or dog watching; 24th street is a popular place for dog-walkers.

The best place to sit is either outside to people watch and soak in the warm Mission micro-climate, or sit at the window and watch people double park in order to get into Big Mouth for their yummy food.

Forget about driving here, even though there is some metered parking.  The Muni stop in front of here (48, 67) takes up half the block!  There is the 24th street Bart station just a block away, and this area is well-serviced by Muni (14/L, 26, 48, 49, 67).
author: Mark B.

description: I went here at least once a week when I worked nearby.  Over a period of 7-8 months, and the burgers and salad were reliably delicious.  Last time I went there though, there was a whole fly in my caesar salad.  I know this can happen anywhere but I'd like them to make sure they are taking all precautions against things like this happening in the future / to others.  I keep trying to stop by to tell the owner but every time I go there are new and other people working, not him.
author: Carrie L.

description:
I do like a good cheeseburger. I'll cop to that. Frankly, I want to eat cheeseburgers a few times a week. If I could do that and not feel like total garbage, I would probably go to Big Mouth one out of every three times, the other two being In-N-Out. That shit is like crack to me. I have to detox and call a friend to not rush back the next day. God, just thinking about it makes me want to go there. They are open late... Shit. OK. Steady breaths... back to the subject at hand...

Big Mouth is different. I really like their menu, all the different selections... though I usually just get the normal bun and cheddar or american cheese on it, with grilled onions of course. The sides, though, I do vary... The cole slaw is decent, and the fries are good. They have onion rings too, and they are tasty. The shakes are very good, made with Mitchell's ice cream!!! 

I actually eat burgers more like once every couple of months. Sometimes, I'm in damage control mode. Then I'll get the kid-sized cheeseburger, with cole slaw. Other than feeling slightly dorky for ordering off the kid menu, I feel almost ok when I leave - it's a good amount of food, but not too much. If I'm in a screw it mode, I'll get the regular sized cheeseburger, onion rings, and a shake. Then I feel like I wanna barf, but triumphant.

Once, they did kind of overcook my burger. I understand: that's uncool. I was peeved. But most of the time, they are really quite good.
author: Dusty R.

description:
The perfect Big (Mega) Mouth lunch for me is to have a friend that wants to split.  I know for many people this is 'gross' and believe me I won't eat off your plate unless invited.  If invited I'll share half of mine with you!

I usually order the New Orleans Louisiana spicy cajun sausage, butterflied and grilled on a french roll with grilled onions, dijon, lettuce, tomatoes & pickles.  Yep... good eating or  sometimes I get the Californian Eggplant, red & green peppers and red onions marinated in rosemary and olive oil, grilled with provolone on foccacia with pesto.  I'm getting hungry...

All the burgers are great and the beer is on tap.  Easy BART/Public transportation.  The owner is cool (he's always at his place in the haight now-a-days) and they have Mitchell's ice cream.

OK, we have cajun sausage, burgers/fries , beer, ice cream- just add good company and you have the five major food groups required when eating at a burger joint.    

I often wonder how the chain burger joints survive.  I just don't get it.
author: ein bier bitte k.

description:
The burgers are tasty, the fries are good, and there is beer on tap [one is even a homebrew, I think]...this is a solid hole-in-the-wall burger joint for Mission-dwellers.

The menu is small but inclusive, which is to say that it is easy to make a choice, but there is also enough variety such that people who keep kosher, eat vegetarian, or just don't like red meat will leave sated. I find this refreshing and convenient, especially since it would be annoying to have to toil over a menu while ordering at a counter. Instead, Big Mouth is a good, easy meal with simple, familiar choices. Try the bleu cheese burger with bacon and pesto aioli.
author: Jon W.

description:
Good burgers and good fries.  Nothing really to write home about.  I like the fact that they have different sauces to get on your burger; not the normal mayo, ketchup, and mustard.  I think I had my burger with some kind of chipotle sauce.  I think Burgermeister is better.

The reason I'm not giving Big Mouth Burger a higher star rating is the fact that there was a LONG hair between my burger and the bottom bun.  I've worked in the food service business before, so I know this stuff happens.  But, the problem I have is the fact that they didn't apologize.  That is just common courtesy when you mess up.  I went to the counter, showed them (I was very nice, not rude at all), and they just took the plate from me and walked off.  They brought me a new burger, but said nothing.  There's a very good chance I will not be eating here again.
author: TK B.

description: Man if you are craving for a burger this is the spot, be ready to be full after eating at big mouth. I feel bad that I can finish a whole burger myself, but after the first bite you cant help it. What i like about this spot is now another chain, but something local and small. I wouldn't say that its in a prime location in the mission but its close enough to bart, that making a quick transit stop for dinner wouldn't hurt
author: Peter Y.

description: The burgers are well cooked and they have a great variety for all picky eaters. They have good choices for vegetarians too and I love their coleslaw. The turkey burger is one of the base I've had :) I go here all the time during my lunch break
author: Claire P.

description: In the sea of 300+ reviews all generally praising this establishment, I don't think I could say anything different. I wasn't too impressed with the fries, but eh, they aren't called Big Mouth Fries are they?
author: Oz B.

description:
Sing the following paragraph to the tune of Gloria Gaynor's "I will survive"...

"First I was afraid, I was petrified, Kept thinking I could always live without bigmouth burger by my side, So I spent so many nights, Passing this place by, But I grew hungry, I couldn't take it anymore. So I went in, from outer space, I just walked in to find, that big mouth burger on my plate, I should have changed my stupid mind, I should have ordered it with cheese, Had I'd known for just one second, I'd be back in here next week..."

And so, this was my initial experience... went in there one night not on my own volition but came out quite impressed! The burgers are juicy, except the fries were less to be desired, but edible nonetheless. $5.95 for a burger and fries is a great deal! And they also have root beer floats with Mitchell's ice cream!
author: NirvAnna M.

description:
I ate here for the first time last night and was impressed.

I love that they are not overpriced for amount & quality of food that's served. Right on point.

I ordered my fave kind of buger, which is the Bleu Cheese Burger with nothing but cheese, meat and pickles. Yum Yum! It was cooked to pefection, juicy and with that real grill taste. However, I wish my cheese would've been a little more funky (pungent) if you will. I love love love funky bleu cheese. Also,the fries were huge and served generously. They didn't beat IN N OUT fries, but they were delish in their own right.
author: Eclectic C.

description:
Good burgers and sandwiches, but if you're gonna pay $7 for a burger, goto burgermeister .. or slow club for the best burger around.

its in my hood, so i like's that.
author: chad n.

description:
just gotta say the fries are sooo good! like taste like they were cut right there and fried individually! ha and the grilled cheese was nothing more than perfect!
thanks for the good grub. i will be back!!
author: Steven T.

description:
First time yelping but thought this was important.

Last night , we ordered the Bigmouth Burger (my fiancee)and the Garden Burger (obvi, me).

Something must have been funky with the meat in the hamburger because he woke up bent over, sweating and throwing up. (And, this was not because we went out and had 15 cocktails). 

Just a PSA.
author: Stephanie T.

description: They have a really good steak sandwich (the "Frontier"). The fries are good, but not great, hence 4 stars instead of 5.
author: Paul L.

description:
Big, juicy, delicious burgers, great choice of breads/buns and sides.  I live 3 blocks away and have to pace myself so I don't hit Big Mouth twice a week. 

A philly cheesesteak franchise has opened next door and is siphoning customers away with cheaper fare (and an HDTV). Come on out and support Big Mouth, an awesome local burger joint that fits right in with the Valencia corridor.
author: Beverly W.

description: Kind of a nondescript burger joint.  Have a TV for watching sports games.  Nothing to write home about.
author: Danny C.

description:
I can't believe in and out outranks this place....what are people smoking?
This is consistently one of the best burgers in the city and the onion rings are amazing. Fries are meh and the option of pesto sauce on the burgers is great (they have many other sauces to choose from)
author: Marie W.

description: The big mouth burger is on point, so are the fries. I'm full and for 10 bucks it's not a bad for the big ass burger you get. My girl had the blue cheese burger with a salad, I know a salad (WTF)... She likeee since the blue cheese is mixed in with a pesto. I'm satisfied and was worth a trip to the mission. Best part is free parking just a block away
author: Alex L.

description:
As noted by others, the best burger in the Mission.  Plus you can't drink pints of Fat Tire at Burger Joint.

The one thing that I don't like (but others do) is that there are too many options, spreads you can throw on the burger, frou frou toppings.  To me, a burger is lettuce, tomato, onions, mayonaisse (maybe mustard).  Good thing this is the standard issue at Big Mouth.

The fries here are excellent--not underdone like most places.  If there's one thing I can't stand, it's a fry that's barely blanched in oil.
author: David C.

description:
Really pretty good food. The wait was fairly extravagant, but the staff was apologetic and quite nice about it. I would and will visit again sometime soon. 

One thing to know - The fries are AWESOME... don't skip up on them. I would slap away the hands of Jesus himself if he went to steal a fry. Seriously.
author: Tyler W.

description:
My favorite burger place. Maybe because they happened to sneak inside my brain and figure out what i think makes a perfect burger? It's possible. I've only ordered the Blue Cheese Burger and it is big and tasty and comes with plenty of stuff on it. The fries are amazing with it. I also usually order a root beer float with it. My old boss is obsessed with their root beer floats. Mostly because they use Mitchell's vanilla ice cream. (It's the good kind where you can see the bean peices in it). I've tasted lots of other burgers and have always liked them. Salmon burger my friend ordered once was a little dry. 

Mmmm, making my mouth water just thinking about it. Might have to make a trip down there soon.
author: Ali R.

description:
Hey! looking to get full when you got that burger crave, well Big Mouth Burgers & Beers is wassup... A lil over cooked for me but I was still happy! Onion rings were great too.
Soooooooooooo go check it out!
author: Yolanda M.

description: Good burgers that are not too expensive at all. They definitely hit the spot. I can't say these are anywhere close to the best burgers I ever had but the burgers in this place definitely hit the spot. I enjoyed the HANGOVER burger..it has fried egg on top of a melty cheeseburger....you can't beat that.
author: Nir B.

description:
Went to Big Mouth last night before heading to a movie, so our dining experience was kind of rushed...

Service: great considering you order and pay at the counter. The guy behind the counter was really smiley and friendly. Food was ready within 10 minutes or so.

Food: Got the big mouth burger w/ jack cheese and mushrooms. It was HUGE and delicious. It also appears that the BM burger automatically cooked medium - not sure if you can ask for more/less well done. I was also pleased to see the homemade spreads and wheat bun options. Fries were kind of thick for my taste, but still good. They also have Mitchell's ice cream. If I hadn't felt like I was eating a heart attack, I may have gotten a root beer float too. Beers on tap only $3.50! 

Parking: found a spot almost immediately and since it was already evening, no need to feed the meter. awesome. 

Don't come here expecting anything fancy, and you'll leave happy.
author: kathy c.

description: Big Mouth is comfort food to me. When I can't decide what to have for dinner and I feel like indulging Big Mouth never fails. I love all the options they have for your burgers and sides. Can't go wrong with Big Mouth!!!
author: Monica N.

description:
Joined Yelp just to write a review on this place.  Absolutely the best burgers in the Mission, and for me, the best veggie burger anywhere. 

Everything they say is true: You pick the burger(everything from beef to turkey to chicken to eggplant and all!) You pick the bread(any kind you want!) And you pick the sauce(personal favorite is pesto.) You choose the side, but fries are the best, no question.

Bring your appetite and save room for the beer!
author: Emily V.

description: It does live up to its name...the burgers are big...i always get the big mouth burger with mushrooms and fries, dats my shiznit rite thurr...wash it down with a big mouth beer...nothin but the ITIS after that baby...and if you still got room, the root beer float for dessert is bomb too, w/REAL Mitchell's ice cream (arent they all nowadays?) dont let the rating fool you...the burgers are delicious, pepper jack cheese is melted perfectly and the greens are fresh, even the chicken burger and the Louisiana link were bomb...my only beef with it is that once you add cheese and in my case mushrooms...its a ten dollar burger, plus fries are an extra 3 bucks or so...so when you thought you were gonna have nice relatively inexpensive burger nite wit da fam...you out 50 or sixty bucks in less than 30 minutes...otherwise, delicious, nice staff...throw the fries in for free yo...im jus sayin!!!
author: Bane V.

description:
I was deciding between Burgermeister and Big Mouth, and decided I liked the prices better at Big Mouth.  Glad I went this way...though Burgermeister's closer to my apartment so I bet I'll find my way there soon enough.

Anyway, glad I went to Big Mouth.  Yummy turkey burger.  And I had them add mushrooms, which was delicious (but a whole extra dollar).  Really special fries.  Too bad I don't like potatoes.  And the milkshake from Mitchell's was deeeelicious.  Overall, it woulda been a fantastic tv meal in front of "The Wire," if only my vitamins, which cause me to turn bright red and experience excruciating pain all over my body, hadn't decided to kick in right then.  Yeah, I'm not taking the vitamin anymore.  Don't worry, I won't hold it against Big Mouth.

Oh, and we found parking right across the street, which was incredible.  And I thought the parking gods would curse us for driving the mile from my apartment to Big Mouth.
author: Gina K.

description:
It's always the same story - "I was craving a burger and then suddenly a burger fairy appeared and led me to a magical place of home cooked fries, perfectly cooked meat, fresh, crispy vegetables, and soft toasty buns..." My story kinda went like that, except the place I went to wasn't too magical, but it was big - the burger and fries I mean, not the place. 

Big Mouth Burger is definitely an appropriate title - it's not "Big Delicious Mouth Watering Burger," it's just "Big Mouth Burger." 

It was big - they serve it on these metal platters, not even plates. It was good, had all the necessary ingredients, and it was cheap - with two beers, they whole thing ran me like 13 bucks. 

If you're looking to fill your gut with cheap, greasy burger and fries before you go out and drink your weight in liquor, this place will definitely help you last the whole night.
author: Rusty B.

description:
Only criticism is the person taking my order didn't ask if I wanted cheese. I wanted cheese. Should I be expected to remember to ask for cheese? Now I know why McDonald's asks "Would you like fries with that?" Yes, I would like cheese on my big mouth burger. Thanks for asking.

PS These burgers were way too much for this little one to finish. And the fries? Perfect!
author: Susan L.

description: Try the New Orleans if you like the sausages.  The portions were good so the whole meal lasted me lunch and dinner.  There weren't many people in line even at noon on a Monday, so the process was quick.  Walk here if you can as parking is scarce during daylight hours.
author: andrew l.

description:
Turkey burgers! Yummy, juicy, turkey burgers!

In San Francisco, we have so many cheeseburgers to choose from that people can afford to debate which delicious deluxe third-pound monster is grilled to order better, or who has the better lettuce garnish. 

But Big Mouth offers up turkey burgers, which are almost good for you. The fries, not so much. They're really tasty (crispy outside, fluffy inside), but they're deliciously greasy and probably up there on the heart-disease-ometer. If this worries you, get the cole slaw. They give you a lot of it, and it's actually worth eating.

I have mine with roasted garlic and chipotle mayo. They have more sauces and potions and sides than your typical Burger Joint, but I get the same thing every time. I have been assured that the veggie burgers are also quite yummy. Their beef is probably good, too, but I can (and do) eat red meat anywhere at any time. Try the turkey!
author: Tarin T.

description:
Big Mouth Burger. The name alone should be cause for concern. Do you think your mouf can handle this much burger? I mean, have you seen the mascot?! That's not hyperbole. If you can't unhinge your mandible, then you may as well go eat at Herbivore. Hippie.

Seriously though, if you slap your dick on the idea of diabetes then this is the burger for you. I recommend the chipotle mayo.
author: Rob D.

description:
Per Brad...and make sure you save the rest for later..because you WILL have leftovers

Order the Double Burger w/
Mushrooms
Grilled onions
Raw red onions
lettuce, provolone
tomatoes
teriyaki sauce
and avocado
Their quality of meat is good, hence the love for this burger.
All their burgers come with freshly made fries. I'm talking real potatoes and not that frozen milk mashed potato stuff. No they actually cut the real Idaho potato and make sure its fried well.

I recommend the vegetarian sandwich, oh my god, now that is goooooooood stuff. It's marinated veggies, lettuce, tomates, onions on fresh foccacia.

Taste it and you'll be a fan for life.
It's off the 24th street bart, 26 bus lines, 14, 49 bus lines too.
author: Charlene C.

description: Great Burger!!! Love them... they also have Mitchell's Ice cream.... and bomb salads.... Not a bad price for a burger and fries too.. like 8 bucks i think... totally worth checking out...
author: Samantha R.

description:
This place was calling to me for a while, but I just managed to get there today. I have to say I wasn't too impressed. It wasn't bad by any means, but it wasn't worth a special trip for either.

The guy taking our order seemed more mad that I was ordering something than happy that I was there. The decorations were fun, especially the painting.

I had the Blue Cheese Burger, which was tasty, but the meat was overcooked. The fries were pretty delicious as well. 

I guess I am going to go with 3 stars. Minus 1 for the prices (a bit high for a simple burger) and minus 1 for not being a great burger place.
author: Josh C.

description:
After living here for years and walking past Bigmouth for Bart... one has to ask, 'Why didn't I try this place sooner?!?'

A juicy mouthwatering burger is somewhat of an art... and their french fries are like the mona lisa. 

There is a reason, they always have a line out the door!!
author: SF U.

description: They got a good variety of choices.  Good burgers too bad their bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible.
author: Aracelis F.

description:
Yeah I went here on a recommendation from a friend and it was just OK.  Zeitgeist has much much better representation of the classic burger.  Unfortunately you have to kiss ass to get one

ThumbsUP:  Hooray for San Francisco's loyalty to the small business
ThumbsDOWN:  Food is mediocre
author: Jeff C.

description:
Disclaimer:  I'm not a burger person.

That being said, I love a good turkey burger at least once a week.  Especially when I can choose the cheese, the spread, the type of bun, and the side.  They have a great selection of spreads, including pesto (yum), and wheat buns are available.  The fries are some of the best in the city--crispy outside, soft (not mushy) inside.  Beverages--soda in cans and beers on tap--good ones too.  Boont Amber Ale, for example.  The highlight:  Mitchell's ice cream and milkshakes.

This is not fast food--it's cooked to order.  So take your time, get a beer.  If it's nice out, grab a table and watch adolescent skate boarders attempt to jump the bench.  Or, sit inside and watch TeleMundo.
author: Charlotte O.

description:
I completely agree with Ben P.

Pearl's burger is better...cleaner...cheaper...need I go on?

Don't get me wrong, the burger I ate was delicious (4 stars).  The Fries were tasty (3 stars).  The roasted Garlic spread was amazing (5 stars).
So why only two stars?  
But the cockroach I killed was gross (minus one star).  
The oddly friendly horse fly that kept walking around our table was gross (he wouldn't fly away).
The dirty walls were gross (minus one star...clean the F'in walls...that's easy to do!)
The sticky table was gross (minus one star)

Overall, there are better places to get a burger for the same price and in a cleaner environment.  Not a bad place, but the cleanliness scared me off...

pearl's burger...tastey, cheap, clean, friendly...and a better bargain!
author: Matt V.

description:
REVIEW OF VEGEBURGERS ONLY:
  Okay, now let me tell you that weren't scared away by the header that you can get the best vegeburger ever here.  I've never been a hater, but I've never really liked most vegeburgers either, though I've tried them all.  I now consistently crave these ones. And I mean CRAVE.  I once walked 10 blocks to eat here, and I usually avoid walking at all costs.  Attn: chese and some kick ass spicy chipotle mayo are key parts of my best-
vegeburger-ever, so experiment with the other spreads at your own risk.
author: Caitlin J.

description:
Great burgers! Great french fries! Great milkshakes! Friendly owner. I discovered this place when I was working at 24th/Mission and, boy I was hooked! I visited Big Mouth about 3 times per week. 

Not a cheap burger place, but it's worth it.
author: Anabelle B.

description:
This place has a great atmosphere but I wouldn't say it is the best burger ever or anything.  

The cheese that I got on my burger wasn't melted enough, and I feel like there was almost too much cheese (is that even possible? I'm not sure, but it was overwhelming).

The people that were hanging out there seemed to be regulars, and really friendly.  

P.S.  could that container of ranch dressing get any smaller?  It was like Barbie sized!
author: Ryan S.

description:
So after an hour of watching Ultimate Recipe Showdown on the Food Network looking for the best Burgers, we decided it was time to get one of our own. Big Mouth is close by and seemed to get favorable reviews on here... Good Call!

In addition to their signature burgers such as the 49er (chicken),  and the Big Mouth, you can also make your own by choosing the bread, spread, and toppings.  I went with a Turkey on Wheat with Lettuce, Tomatoes, Avocado, PepperJack, and Jalapenos.. it was awesomely satisfying.. The burger is pretty damn big and so are the fries, which were great as well.

We also got a Caeser Salad, large size... and by large, they mean HUGE.  Unless you are looking to feed a small country, go with the smaller size (unless you want leftovers).  The salad itself was very good, however, and well worth it.

Onion rings.. greasy as hell, but good too. 

Nothing negative to say.. next time I want a burger, I will be headed back and looking to try a different one!
author: Niko B.

description:
I like to think of myself as a hamburger connoisseur. And really nothing makes me as happy as 1/2 pound ground cow with cheese. 

The burgers at Big Mouth are consistent, in flavor, quality and size. 

The only disappointment is the cole slaw - they somehow forgot the flavor.
author: Julia P.

description:
Decent burgers but nothing earth shattering here.  After reading the reviews of fellow Yelpers, I went with high hopes.  My burger was good but nothing about it made me say "Wow!"  The dining area is not very inviting looking so we took our food to go.

I like that you have the choice of 4 different breads.  And, any place that offers two types of BBQ sauces definitely scores with me.  I loved  the fries.  Big, thick skin-on fries done perfectly.   Their prices are super cheap and they give you a ton of fries with your burger.
author: Jeff P.

description:
Awesome burgers.

Best burger I've had in a while, and definitely better than Burgermeister.

Because of the juice.  When I finished there was a lovely little puddle of delicious burger juice on my plate...not ketchup overflow but actual meat juice.  That is the number one sign of a tasty burger.  (Speaking of number one, the only thing I don't understand is why you would name your place so people would nickname it BM Burger? eww.)

I'm not a fan of fries, so I appreciated the coleslaw choice, which was very light.  My pal had the ceasar salad which was PERFECT.

Plus the tables are what I can only describe as cowboy tables...big wooden slabs, comfortably coated with the fine layer of grease  that marks any home of a good burger.
author: Flemm F.

description:
So I get outta class at 9, hop on my bike and start cruising down Valencia. I'm racking my brain trying to think of something that's not a burrito and easy to grab right now.

Oh yea, duh. Big Mouth.

Oh so tasty meat. Oh so tasty bun, or focaccia, or whatever. Oh so tasty variety of spreads. The level of customization without being overwhelming is spot on.

Great shakes too!
author: Matt L.

description:
yum!

at first i wasn't too impressed by reading their menu, until i saw a small sign off to the side that described "the hangover" burger. it's a beef patty with cheese, bacon and a soft fried egg. i'm kind of a health nut, but i found this burger to be worth the artery clogging that it probably did to me.
author: Lindsey H.

description: A former co-worker used to rant and rave about this place, so I finally gave it a try in '08. I had a big mouth burger with fries, which was pretty bland. I wasn't impressed. However, I went back a few more times and had better luck with the turkey burger with sauteed mushrooms, onions, lettuce and provolone cheese....I thought it was yummy. I've tried their chicken salad too (nothing spectac).
author: Anonymous J.

description:
I heard the shakes are good.  I heard the burgers are good, but today I only went for the shake.  I really wanted a chocolate shake, but they were out.  How can you be out with Mitchell down the street???  

I was forced to have Vanilla.  Shake is good but I've had better at Johnny Rockets.  Thick shake are sweet and this wasn't quite there.

I am waiting to try their burger but those definitely look good.  I'll let you know when I get back in there.
author: Po L.

description:
Hmm... I don't get all the praise.

The burger itself was good, the bun was serviceable, but the vegetables were like cardboard.

The fries were awful. They were cut from whole potatoes but they were soggy, mealy, and lukewarm.

The three stars are for the good service and the good patty.
author: Eggy P.

description:
I would have given this place 5 stars if didn't bruise my pocket a little. 

The burgers here are good, don't get me wrong but the price for a burger is pretty high. But I guess that's the "price" we pay for a good burger. 

This place a little small like several restaurant in San Francisco and is something that I've grown accustomed to. 

Anyway, I had the blue cheese burger, I'm a big fan of blue cheese, and it was yummy. The contents of the burger started to fall out the back end but aww who cares. If it doesn't get all over the place, it doesn't belong in your face...thanks Carl's Jr. 

I would definitely come back even if does bruise the wallet a little. I love it here. 

*Cheers*
author: Jessica L.

description: Seriously one of the best turkey burgers I have ever eaten, with cheddar. It wasn't flavorless or dried-out. I had a turkey burger, a caesar salad (tasty as well) and a beer for $11 (I think). I highly recommend. And you can gaze out the windows at the creepy concrete/neon church across the street.
author: Rob F.

description: i was in the mood for a burger so we all stoped to this mouth watering burger joint and it was sooo good. I had a turkey bacon cheddar burger and fries...cant wait to go back !!!!
author: alessandra t.

description: had the hawaiin burger and it was kick ass! the service is great, the location is great and most importantly of all, it's the best burger I've had in this city. Thank you bigmouth burger!
author: Holly H.

description:
SO SO SO SO BOMB. 

and trust, I've eaten my share of burgers.
author: Vicky V.

description:
This place does burgers, and it does them well. The burger is very juicy and flavorful, and actually cooked how you ask for it. The portions are quite generous, although I didn't actually notice this until I had finished my plate and realized I was extremely full. The fries were good but nothing too special, and the a nice touch to the good slaw was th addition of horseradish.

The shakes were also an excellent treat almost certainly because of the quality of the ice cream. Rich and creamy, the shake was also a generous size.

Although I only tried a regular cheese
author: Joel W.

description: Tasty.  They were nice enough to let me get a small mouth burger, which was *plenty.*  If you get the huge steak-cut fries with your burger you may never eat again.  If you're looking for a decent, unpretentious burger in the city, I don't think you could do much better than Big Mouth (I haven't).
author: Joe B.

description: Big Mouth makes a pretty good chicken sandwich.  It's not a place to make a long trip for, but if you're in the neighborhood... sure, why not.
author: lawrence c.

description: Big Mouth Burger, how I love thee. In one of the best food neighborhoods in SF, this place is a blessing. The chipotle mayo is amazing, all the good toppings they offer, make this the best burger in SF imho. Try the hangover burger, it's got a fried egg and bacon on top of the burger, what could be bad about that combo?
author: mateo r.

description:
A juicy burger is my idea of a good burger.  Rule #1 when cooking a burger is to not press down on the patty as it's cooking because it squeezes all of the juice out and makes it difficult to cook the patty any other way than well done.  If you're looking for a flat, dry, and over-cooked burger this is your spot!

On the bright side, the onion rings are good.
author: Marianne L.

description:
Fun vibe, good beer on tap and great burgers!!

Get the Sun-Dried Tomato Aioli spread on french bread - killer!!
author: Andrew L.

description:
Whoa Nelly! This place is a must go if you're a burger buff. Classy and elegant, meaty and fresh, this is as good as it gets.

-You have complete power on how you make your burger
-So many ingrediants, "what do I do"

Your mouth is watering already, go dammit!
author: Glen G.

description: I have ben going to this spot for years it seams like the more we go the better it gets. This is one of the best places in the city to get a grilled chicken sandwich. I get the 49er grilled chicken sandwich on a french roll with fries. Good customer service the food hunters will be back! We give them A+ and recommend to everyone.
author: The Food Hunters C.

description:
I had a garden burger and it was one of the best I ever had anywhere!  This is way better than any other burger of it's kind I had in a long time.

This is what I've been waiting for!  Oh yeah, I took it to go, and the place is nothing fancy if you want to eat there, but the food is great...  fries are awesome too.
author: Christiani C.

description: Ate here last night and either have food poisoning or heart burn with food poisoning- like symptoms. I used to like this place but I won't be back anytime soon.
author: J Y.

description: Two words- mayo overload!!!!!  And my fries were soggy too  ;(
author: Glenda D.

description: Gone there with my cuz, we both had the Hangover Special that came with a fried egg and beacon in it.  It was a really good burger.  Price was right.
author: Peter L.

description: Nom Nom Nom.  My BF and I deemed Sunday to be our night out - where we go out to dinner and eat whatever we'd like.  Tonight, we decided on Big Mouth.  Hoooooly CRAP that's a lotta MEAT!!  I generally stick to a vegan + seafood diet(weight, not morals, keeps me eating like this), but decided to splurge.  I got the Blue Cheese Burger with Avocado, on the herb focaccia bread.  Yums!!!  My only complaint (minor!) is that the blue cheese sort of overpowered the burger.  I wasn't asked how I'd like it cooked, and it was done to medium; a little darker than I would have picked, but c'est la vie!  Twas quite the tasty burger - I shall be back!
author: Jennifer L.

description: This poor guy is one of those unfortunate mom-and-pop small business owners who has incurred the wrath of one of our fine mega-corporate goliaths.  The original name of this burger joint is Big Mouth Burgers, but the owner apparently ran afoul of copyright laws with Chili's because the pages of their glorious laminated, full-color menus are filled with "Big Mouth Burger" choices.  This place was named Big Mouth since at least three years before the Big Mouth brawl with Chili's, who has since sued the owner for trademark infringement.  So the owner apparently changed the name to "Mega Mouth Burgers", which is how it usually shows up on the internet, and told Chili's that if they want the signs changed, they should come and do it themselves! ha! take that multi-national corp! Anyhow, the burgers are excellent here, and I can vouch for the fact that they are superior to any burger on the Chili's menu, or any chicken crispers, jalapeno death bites or quesadilla explosions for that matter.
author: Rick H.

description: I've stopped by a couple of times didn't order the standard Big Mouth Burger and wasn't really impressed.  I started going to Phat Philly Cheesteaks instead, which is right next door.  When I was finally compelled to have a real burger, I decided to give Big Mouth another try.  It was just before noon and the lunch rush didn't show up yet.  The burger came out in about 6 minutes, cooked medium, larger than avg, with a heaping side of french fries.  The burger was juicy and the fresh condiments and spicy mayo spread made the burger a winner.  It was the best burger I've had this year, and that inlcudes stops at Burgermeister, Bill's Place, In-n-Out, and my personal favorite Red Robin.  I still like Phat Philly a lot, but I'll think twice the next time I'm in the area and want to consume +1,000 calories.
author: Neil W.

description:
had this burger yesterday and it was very good. $5.95 with fries i'm thinking it might be the best in this price range. i had roasted garlic added to my burger included in the price. my wife had blue cheese (.95 extra) and spicy chipotle mayo.

i'm can't tell all ya all how course or fine the grind was or if it was too densely packed. or how well the patty was seasoned. i season the shit out of it myself. i'll leave that to the pro burger reviewer. but i am a burger eater and know when one tastes good. hell with mustard and hot sauce, and all the black pepper i probably wipe out the seasonings they put in the patty. if i had to guess i would say the grind was on the course side. if that even matters. what the fuck do you want for 6 bucks? better than any fast food burger out there.

i asked for the fries extra crispy and out came peel on crispy little logs on the outside and soft pillowy potato inside.. i usually prefer a smaller fry but these thicker starchy tubers were a hit with my taste buds. 4 beers on tap at $3.50  a pint  so i had to have one of those. we walked out stuffed. overall a good deal. 

glad to have big mouth burger in our 'hood and we will go back. so hit this burger joint up for good food and beer on tap that won't set your bank account back much.
author: roger b.

description: Big stars for having roasted garlic as a spread on the burgers at no extra cost, for being reasonably priced, for not having to pay extra for french fries, and for being a pretty damn good burger. Spicy chipotle mayo and blue cheese? Yep, a fabulous combination I can assure you. Beer on tap, Mitchell's in the freezer. Love this little spot. Not a perfect burger but pretty great just the same.
author: margot b.

description: Came back to try out their vegetarian burger... WOOOW. INCREDIBLE! A huge, nutritious meal came my way and I couldn't be more stoked! This place is great!
author: Haz O.

description: Went here last night with my bfriend.  This place is cool because it's the kind of place where every one seems to know your name---assuming you are the kind of person that frequents Big Mouth Burger.  Needless to say, we both got the BM Burger and it was tasty and it was certainly big!  No doubt about it.  And it was really greasy.  And the fries were tasty.  The place was seriously dirty though.  Like our table was stacked with shit on it.  The lady working up front seemed nice.  And the vibe inside was way chill with the giants game rolling...
author: Lauren S.

description: Great burgers, generous portions and decent prices. Wil return
author: Nicole A.

description:
walking past big mouth on my way to BART, i've never really given it a second thought as it's a hole-in-the-wall sort of joint - for future reference, i like to drink at holes-in-the-wall, but not eat from them. so, as i was saying, i never gave it a second thought until i was looking for a burger in the mission and was tired of paying sky-high prices at burger joint for the smallest burgers ever. so i referenced the yelp and it told me "get thee to burger joint".

i've been here twice since my first visit, and here's why: great burgers at great prices. for about $10 i can eat a huge cheeseburger, fries, and one of the lovely beverages from the cooler. it's hard to find any sort of meal for $10 these days. (no, i promise i won't go off on a "well, back in my day" story...)

the burgers are great, cooked to order, and fully customizable. or you can order from their menu of specialty burgers. i prefer a simple cheddar burger on french roll. the fries are a little "iffy", but with some extra ketchup they do just fine. they're thick-cut fries and tend to be a little undercooked.

taking all of that into consideration, the last best thing about this place is its location. it's close to BART, which not only means you can catch your train whenever you want, but it also means this is a great spot to people watch. i like to sit in the window and make faces at everyone that passes.
author: Jeremiah W.

description:
there are so many yummy places in the mission that sometimes a gem such as big mouth can get overlooked. i've passed by this place countless times on my way to papalote. well, a man can't live on burrito alone. so one night i finally followed the burger juice aroma and walked into big mouth. the scene was mostly manly men with really big mouth chomping on greasy burgers. um, this was somewhat intimidating for a timid guy like myself who prefers eating in small bites. however, it was too late for me to leave. i had to dig deep into my manhood and find the courage to place an order in my most manly voice.

"one big mouth burger with fries, please. pretty please."

shit! why did i say "pretty please?" i'm such a george mcfly sometimes. ok, it's obvious that my manly skills need some work. in contrast, the big mouth burger and fries don't need any work. they were quite delicious and satisfying. i'd say that it's one of the better burgers and fries in the city. all for $6... perhaps next time i'll be man enough to eat there rather than take it home.
author: frisco j.

description: After much curiosity, I finally tried the chevap sandwich. Though it's a bit hard to eat--as in, it's quite large and the bread is a bit too soft to hold all the sausages, it's a bit fragile--it's really delicious. Probably better off in a pocket or hot dog bun type of bread (I don't know if that would kill the authenticity factor). The guy working here claims this is the only place in the city that has this. And don't have one of these before a date; the raw onions will stay with you. Something different for sure.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Beer, home fries, and [meatless]burgers--what a perfect combination.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
I read the Yelp reviews on Big Mouth and see many are 4 stars, so I figure why not give it a shot. Let me warn every one to take note of the DATE of the review. The very first review tells you  that a Big Mouth Burger is priced at $6, well according to the employee ( with the personality of a door knob)  who hand wrote me my receipt, I paid $8.71; thats almost 30% more folks. Furthermore, according to the aforementioned autographed hand  written souvenir, the burger, onion rings and a milkshake, total, out the door : $17.37.

 For Yelp to give Big Mouth their lowest 'Price Range' rating of  ' $ ' seems totally absurd. I don't know about you, but that's a lot of money for when your just planning on running out for a quick burger fix. If I knew I was going to get screwed, I would have at least showered and shaved.

The food was certainly edible, even though no one asked how I wanted my burger cooked or what kind of bread I wanted, ' spread", etc., ( but then, I was only the virgin customer). Yes there was a sufficient amount of grub, except for the 12 oz. milkshake @ $4.33.

This experience certainly makes me a bit leery about putting any reliability in anyones Yelps reviews. Frankly, I feel I could have found better value for the money at other burger joints like, In and Out, or Nations, or Burgermeister, or . . .
Can you tell from my review when it will be I'll be going back for more ? Hint : no I am not into S&M.
author: johnny s.

description: If the toppings weren't a dollar each, I'd give this place a higher rating. Otherwise, great hole-in-the-wall burger joint. Their shakes aren't the greatest, but the fries were good. You definitely don't need a big mouth to eat this burger. Since its in the Mission District, there's little or no parking. But a call in for pick-up is always provided here.
author: Ant S.

description:
ummmm a cockroach ran across my table as i was eating.  no joke.  now i'm not one to be naive about such things but when those little buggers are out and about during the daytime when a bunch of people are around you know you've got a major problem.

two stars because the food was fine.  the music made me want to kill myself though.  i didn't realize they had a muzac station that played such great hits as the aladdin them song.
author: amanda w.

description: I live in the Mission and I walked about 8 blocks to get to this place, based on yelp reviews. This was 2-3 weeks ago, I went in and specifically ordered a cheeseburger with nothing but cheese on it. The pretty cashier who took my order understood what i asked for, she repeated it back to me. And the cook seemed to understand when he said cheeseburger just cheese. So I walked back home 8 blocks and I was in my room ready to eat and the burger had everything on it. Mayo and lettuce and other fun stuff that I did not order. So I calmly called to explain the situation and the young lady who answered understood and said if I came back they would remake it and it would be 15 minutes. So I walked with the wrong order in hand and got back to this location. The cashier said I could keep the original order which I threw out in the restaurant's trash and at the time I did not think of a homeless person who might want the original burger, sorry i was mad and not thinking about it. But I walked home again and they made the order correctly for the most part, except they burned it. I thought to myself, just eat the damn burger and don't go back there, I didn't even bother to call them to say they messed up again. And I have not been back since, I think their only saving grace is the nice cashier order taking girl, since I don't know her official title, maybe manager. I wish I could give them a better review, maybe you will read this and just check your food before you leave if your carrying it out.
author: Sean G.

description:
So,

I do not partake in the eating of animal flesh during the weekdays so I do look forward to a Friday night bacon-cheeseburger.  Twice before Big Mouth burger was graced with my presence and both times I ate the New Orleans style hot-dog.  This spicy sausage comes with my recommendation but I would advise against their baked beans as they are closer to spiced re-fried beans betraying the apparently Latin origin of the chef.
This night however, was dedicated to the consumption of bacon-cheesy, fried and ground cow flesh goodness.   One down side of BMB's location is the Christian church across the street.  As I was looking for parking it occurred to me that Jesus-freaks have such little regard for everyone else that they have to fuck up everyone's Friday night parking so they can grovel.  COME ON, those fun ruining vampires already have Sunday because conveniently the rest of us are too hung-over to be disturbed.  Luckily, not even the Christians or the crowd(another lone gentlemen was good enough to share a table) ruined this meal.  Sorry to you non meat eaters, you have my sincere respect and sympathy.  This burger easily competes with Burgermeister and the french fries are much tastier.  They kinda stiffed me on the choco shake though.

CONCLUSION:

WINNIE THE POOH IS A FAT FREE-LOADING SON OF A BITCH!
author: ray M.

description: The cafe's too grody for 4 stars, but the blue cheese burger with pesto- yes, you heard that right, was giant and de-lish. Fresh cut fries. The DIY root beer float is a big plastic cup filled with 4 scoops of ice cream, a straw, a spoon and a can of soda.
author: Amy J.

description: Big Mouth Burger made me smile. Before heading to The Marsh, I stopped by for some grub. I ordered a turkey burger with fries. The fries were on the salty side, but not overwhelmingly, and the burger itself was delicious. It was quiet in the restaurant when I was there, (well it was before noontime), and the service was efficient. I recommend this place.
author: Rox M.

description: Small and neighborly, BMB (is it okay to give it an acronym nickname even though we just met?) rocks. I split a turkey burger (loaded with spicy BBQ sauce and jack cheese) and a salmon burger with my friend. The turkey burger was the bomb! Also the fries were super duper crispy and the salmon burger was good too (though just as an FYI, I think it was canned salmon mashed into a patty, not a big hunk o' salmon). Also the staff is nice... last week they let me use their bathroom when (gasp) I wasn't a paying customer. I like it.
author: Lisa F.

description: This spot has come along way since my first visit. The baked beans remain flavorless but if you add a little chipotle hot sauce, a little freshly chopped cilantro and garlic you've got something special. Cole slaw needs a little help as well but I would go with the fries. Hell, it took them 3 years to figure it out but damn it they didn't  finally get it right. I dig The Frontier and The 49er but a burger on Foccocia is the best thing going. Get them the slather on one of the many creative spreads and you can redirect the entire flavor experience. Vegetarian options available but I'm pretty sure they grill the veggies on the same grill as the animal flesh.
author: Mingus R.

description: This place is a 4 stars for the DYRS (Dario Yelp Rating System). Burgers are good, not damn good, you can choose the friends of the meat patty (dried tomatoes aioli, provolone and rosemary focaccia were my burger dates that day) and prices are very reasonable. Fries are big, crunchy and not oily. I seriously recommend sitting at the window, first because it's fun and second because I poked my finger with a nail coming out of the table where we were sitting.
author: Dario B.

description:
Overall, this place is all right. I've been here twice and the first time I managed to score a pretty decent burger and onion rings. The fries are thick and well-cooked. No complaints there.

BUT...then I revisited Big Mouth. My family was in town, so I figured, why not show them a good SF burger? They ordered the standard burger & fries. I decided to get a little creative and try the Texan--a pulled pork sandwich with BBQ sauce.

Sounds good, right? Well we picked up the food for takeout, and upon arriving home the first sign of trouble appeared in the form of a watery meat-juice dripping from the wrapped sandwich as I lifted it from the paper bag. I unwrapped the sandwich only to find it SWIMMING in a half-inch of liquid. Like, I wondered for a second if I had ordered pulled pork SOUP. The bottom bun was soaked through, soggy and completely inedible. Couldn't even pick up the sandwich without it disintegrating in my hand. Luckily the top bun had survived the flood, and the meat filling was okay. Kind of plain with not enough spice/barbeque sauce, but enough so I didn't have to go hungry.

Still, you can see how this sandwich was a major disappointment. I'd been hoping for a juicy, spicy pork sandwich, and got a majorly juicy bland pile of slop. 

Big Mouth's burgers may be decent, but I can think of other places to get a sandwich where I won't be risking this kind of pork-puddle trauma.
author: J P.

description: Yeah, I liked this burger.  Would probably go 3 1/2 stars if I could, but I'm feeling generous today.  Char-grilled flavor, choice of bread, and the option of spicy BBQ sauce - I'm in!  This was the perfect fix for a girl with a hangover.  Loved the fries - from big russet potatoes with the skin on - crispy outside - yum.  This is a big meal, I couldn't finish it - but better that way than the opposite!
author: Julie L.

description: I friggen love this place.  This place is on my way to/from work so it's a good choice for lunch.  I usually order the turkey burger with spicy chipotle mayo, grilled onions, and add avocado.  Sometimes, when my pants feel tight, I opt for the baked beans instead of the fries.  You can decide which you'd like.  The turkey burger is very moist and juicy.  After work, I've also stopped by for a burger and beer.  You can't beat a nice pint of cold beer to start your after-work time.  The staff are cool, always friendly.  They take credit card.  You will wait a bit for your order, but that's because it's all very fresh.   Try calling your order in.
author: Emilio O.

description: The food is not spectacular, by any stretch. The burgers are way, way overcooked. I also had the salmon Caesar salad, which was very standard and super salty. However! there is beer on tap here, and ice cream scooped from tubs. So we ordered some beer floats. Two scoops of vanilla with a pint of Amber Boont. You will not be disappointed.
author: Merci V.

description: Great burger and fries, with a nice drink selection.  A little slow, but being able to sit on the sidewalk makes up for that.
author: Kevin Y.

description:
they make your burger how you want it.  they have boont on tap.  it's an order-at-the-counter kinda place, so don't expect too much atmosphere.  but it's cute, bright colors are still inviting.  and the burgers, mmmmmmmmmm.  it was done to medium-rare perfection, and so big it was falling out of the bun, though i appreciate that it wasn't so thick that it was hard to eat.  the tomatoes were tasty and the wheat bun (my one stab at health?) was soft and delish.

my husband keeps kosher so i don't get a great cheeseburger too often, but i would definitely come here again.
author: cari r.

description: i LOVE their fries!!!! veggie burger is good and the staff are really nice too!
author: jean e.

description: Sometimes you just want a big, juicy burger with all kinds of artery-destroying toppings and, when you're in the Mission, this is the spot. Big Mouth has all kinds of spreads you can get on your burger, including chipotle mayo, pesto, roasted garlic and aoli, but you have to pay $0.95 extra for cheese and any other special toppings. There's also a few kinds of beer on tap and a fair amount of seating.
author: Kristina A.

description: Decent burger, but not great. Like many other places, it failed the "I want it medium rare" test. The bun was decent, if not a little bready and the fries were mediocre.
author: Yogi B.

description: This is my absolute favorite burger place in San Francisco right now.  The room is unpretentious, the burgers are good with interesting toppings, and they serve beer.
author: Joe H.

description: Decent burgers.  Fresh cut fries (though without that twice-fried crispness).  Place could use a good scrubbing though.
author: Brian J.

description: I've eaten here many a time, the sweaty grill guys and soap operas really add flavor to this joint. Not a big fan of their signature big mouth burgers, I usually end up with a pint size little mouth from the kids menu. It does the trick just right.
author: Jesse S.

description:
pretty darned good burger.  i love places that let me get the child's sized burger, because damn, i can't handle an adult one and hate wasting food.

great homemade fries.

the chipotle mayo is spicy and scrumptious!
author: Aimee B.

description: Tonight was my first time.  I was a little scared and a little shy but I did it and now I love it.  Yum.
author: Cat M.

description:
was expecting bigger.

although the burger DID fill me up and was definitely quality meat, i found myself going into the experience picturing a thick juicy burger that i couldn't get my mouth around (mine, being, maybe an average to small sized mouth).    .. what i got, was definitely not that.  thin but large patty that fit very easily in my not-so-big mouth.

fries and burger were definitely good... but nothing i couldn't get at another burger joint.  the sandwich menu had a lot of variety .. so points for that.

service i found a tad rushed a bit on the rude side.
author: Lily B.

description: Our family has loved this place for years.  Our teenagers just came home after being away for a year, and these cheeseburgers were the first thing they ate after landing at SFO .  Honest cole slaw, good beer on tap (Boont Amber Ale and Tecate), fat fries.  Nice surprise when you order it for the first time-- really good grilled chicken on the chicken caesar salad.  It comes right off the grill -- not pre-chilled like so many places.  Great salmon sandwiches too.
author: Kathryn S.

description: bleu cheese burger was great! I would go back again if I am ever in the neighbor hood and I want the essential burger experience!!!
author: TIM M.

description: I wish Yelp would have half stars.  I would have to say three-and-a-half stars but am rounding up to four, b/c I say three stars is average and this place is above average, but not one of my very favorite.  I had read and heard a lot of positive things about this place so perhaps my expectations were running ahead of me but anyhow, you get the point. I agree with most of what everyone else wrote - Benjamin H. has a good ranking and it'd be around the same on my top six, if i actually had one...
author: Gene X.

description: I am a girl who loves a cheeseburger and this is the best place to get one in the neighborhood. Thick cut french fries and huge, creamy Mitchell's milkshakes to top it off and you can rest assured that your ass will continue to be coveted by chubby chasers everywhere.
author: Maria D.

description: This place is great!  My husband & I found it while in search for a great burger.  It's not too expensive & I like the choice of sauces w/ your burger.  They also give a lot of fries.  Ironically, the owner is also the father of two students I taught in 1st grade.
author: Aura J.

description:
it's not just because i live in walking distance from this place. 
or because i haven't had my share of burgers. 
it's because i don't need to. 
big mouth fulfills my meatty-juicy-carnivorous needs.
love the variety of choices in toppings and such. 
can't get enough of their thick bacon (omg)
thick fries? i think so. 
only thing that drives me away is the unsavory cole slaw, but who cares when u get a big juicy burger like this one you'll have trouble leaving right away. 
don't worry, you can always take a stroll down valencia to "walk it off"
author: Brenda S.

description: This place is awesome. Whenever I am in the neighborhood, I come here for lunch. Their burgers are great and the woman that works there remembers that I like Dad's root beer even though they don't carry it anymore. Im pretty sure they got voted best burger place in SF a few years ago.
author: Darius A.

description: ~First let me say that I really like this place. i have minused a star only because the counter is always a little tacky and needs a good degreaser wipe down not just with a damp towel. But the food is great I like the Chicken Cesar salad, the fries are good and the burgers are great I get the bacon, Avocado cheeseburger. The staff is friendly and once when their credit machine was down and so was the ATM, they told me they'd catch me next time, that was the first time i had ever been there. The Root Beer floats are awesome and so good I order it knowing I'm lactose intolerent......hahaha TMI?
author: William M.

description: The burgers here are BIG as you can infer from the name of the place.  They'r also really  juicy, perfectly cooked, and you get a choice of spreads and breads.  Included with your meal is a side of steak fries.  The fries were good, but about 1/5 of them were over cooked.  (like double / tripple fried to the point where they're hard).  We tried the steak burger, but it wasn't as good.  I'd stick with the original big mouth burger.
author: Sam C.

description: I work nearby and I would say around three or four years ago the burgers and fries were better.  I remember the owner was there often back then.  Quality has definitely gone down. The place is dirty. The fries are either soggy or oily. Burgers are over cooked. Doesn't seem like the cook knows how to cook. I've stopped going all together because I know I can find better burgers (at home).
author: lola s.

description: I love big mouth burger what more can I say. I've tried probably everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. As if the burgers weren't reason enough to go here, the added bonus of the garagantuan owner screaming at new hires until they quit is wonderful dinner time entertainment. The eggplant burger for you veggies out there is really fucking tasty. And a big mouth burger with added avocado and cheddar cannot be missed. Also try their chipotle or garlic mayo mmmmmmmmmmm!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Sushi K.

description: i wandered in here for the ol'e cure for a long day, burger and beer, only to find they serve on of my favorite culinary delights; cevapcici!!! for the uninitiated, cevapi is the fast food numero uno in bosnia and other parts of former jugoslavia. it has roughly the same culinary and cultural significance as tacos do in mexico or falafel does in israel. they are grilled beef sausages on bread and onions. it doesn't sound like much, but it's f-ing awesome. i became addicted to them when i was in the army doing a tour in Bosnia. they were almost as good as the genuine article. i even got some ajvar to dip my fries in. speaking of the devil, the fries i got along with it were ok. i went back a second time for a burger and it was all right. so, the other food was OK but it's worth a try for the cevapi.
author: cyrus t.

description:
darn fine burger, although what i truly enjoy are their fries. 

i recommend ordering the small mouth because it is still a good sized meal, and a bit cheaper, too. 

oooo, and their chicken nuggets are in the shape of dinosaurs! always a selling point as far as i am concerned...
author: Kayla K.

description: Boring burger place. Didn't do a bathroom check, but I can only imagine. Nothing special about this place other than the name 'Big Mouth Burgers'. They do have beer which is a bonus. It's located near the scenic 24th mission bart so you might spot a few crackheads while you're eating... Oh, if you need dessert head down to the 'Chinese N Donuts' on the corner of 24th and mission for a special somethin somethin =).
author: Michael S.

description: its one of the good burger places in town but my favorite at big mouth is there 49rs u should try
author: Nate K.

description: Best Burger in the City. Great fries, great milkshakes and a friendly staff.
author: loach X.

description:
omg

i love being able to put my own toppings on my burger. although i kept it simple and just had spicy chipolte mayo, grilled onions, and american cheese with pickles on a wheat bun...i had the best burger EVER!
my luv liked it too!

i cant wait to actually come back and have another one! im so serious!
its a good thing i have some self-control! ;)
author: Bee B.

description: Update: Went back again and ordered another pulled pork sandwich. This time the big, kinda gross, guy working behind the counter pulled the pork apart... with his big, kinda gross, fingers. I know he knows that was nasty because of the way he had his back turned to try and hide what he was doing. Guuuuu-ROSS! I realize a lot of kitchens have some "questionable" cooking going on which is why I only took of ONE star, but it'll be awhile before I'm back at BMB, and I doubt I'll ever get the pulled pork sandwich again.
author: Jeff S.

description: Yeah good burger, veggie burger, salmon cake, and that weird sausage thing with the onions! Okay, I eat here a lot and think others should too. The hipsters have semi positive attitudes, they have milkshakes (although I have yet to try one), and the majority of pretentiousness is checked at the door. Much cheaper and better than Burger Joint, although I do admit I go there b/c of its proximity to the Casadoro.
author: Roxane S.

description: Consistently great burgers and fries, a block from my house, who could ask for more?  I've been going here for years and have never been disappointed---way too full, but never disappointed.
author: Jen S.

description:
really delicious burger there is no reason to go  to the macdonalds! i love mine with bacon and avocado plus jalapenos!!!!

also they are really fast in case ur in a hurry!!!
author: J Angel G.

description: This was the first burger I ate when I first moved to SF and by far the Best hands down!!!! The Big Mouth Burger with chipotle mayo , avocado and swiss cheese decimates all. If it were a woman I'd give her the keys to the castle of our first date good...... The shakes are AMAZING! The Beer on tap and goes with everything on the Menu ! I've literally tried every burger on the menu and they all are Hittin.  Service is great. .. Everyone needs to check this place out !
author: Steven H.

description: Awesome burgers made of super juicy meat and overall, a great experience.  Loved the fries and would definitely eat there again.  If I lived closer to here, I would be a fatty right now.  One with a lot of rolls.
author: Laura G.

description: Want the "home off the grill burger? Try this spot! So when I first moved to SF about 3 years ago a buddy took me here & I had totally forgotten about it until the other day drove by it. So went in today for lunch & HOTNESS them is some GOOD burgers! And the fries are the best! I thought it was funny that they were playing KFOG though.....
author: Rob L.

description:
I eat here about once a week, figured I owe em a review. The burgers are great, the choc shakes are excellent, the fries are thick.
