I usually order over the phone and pick up 10 minutes later - consistently fast. If I dine in, they always have an onion to read, which also takes exactly 10 minutes. The lady that usually works the counter is very friendly and the prices are fair. This must by why I live on this stuff.

@Stacey h - the food has never made me sick
author: Firstname L.

description: I went to Big Mouth for my first time last week. since used to work at Barneys Burgers, i have been looking for a new burger place. iv tried burgermeister, but wasnt really a fan. i really enjoyed my burger at big mouth... it was so big and filling and they have dad's rootbeer!!! also they have mitchells ice cream!! yumm ,.. ill def. be back
author: Shauna P.

description: This place is now called Mega Mouth which I guess is even bigger than your run of the mill big mouth. The burgers are very good but I'm here to talk about the frys. I did a survey of local spots to find the best frys (Whiz, Sliders, Burger Joint, Burger Meister) and Mega came out on top. I like my frys thick and mushy and they were done to perfection. I like to dip my frys in mayo, bbq sauce, and ketchup - give it a try - yummers.
author: Colin S.

description:
juicy burgers... they're good with cheese and mushrooms... fries are decent too.  once i tasted their salmon burger and that was a mighty tasty item as well!
mmm...
they also have some beer on tap for those who like that...
:)
author: charlotte s.

description: Juicy turkey burger.  Great chicken salad and chicken sandwich.  I dig the place, it's definitely a neighborhood joint.   Can always count on their beer being COLD.  Love it.
author: Adrian N.

description: I think I've found my favorite burger-and-fry place in the City.  I had an unadulterated burger...no cheese, no funny spreads, just lettuce, onions, and tomatoes all on a plain bun.  And the burger was good!  The fries were the thick kind with the potato skin on the ends, and oh so good.  All for around $8.00.
author: Mark D.

description:
I figure if you live around the corner, you gotta try it. Excuses always come up, but it was a mighty fine burger ofr lunch today. Under 9$ for a nice size cheese burger and fries. 

Overall: 7/10
Burger: Nice size, although cooked medium rather than medium rare (no pink here). Burger was juicy, but not drippy. With the grilled onions on top, the burger itself tasted a little more greasy than is my preference. 
Toppings: The cheddar was plentiful, but didn't have the bite that I look for it to add to the burger. The grilled onions were good, but oily. 
The bun: White bread. Held up fine. Nothing special.
Sides: The pickles were quite fresh and good. Liked the pickle slices. The fries were super crispy (without asking) which I love. These are thick cut fries, which are not my favorite. But I ate most of them all the same... which says something.
Final Thoughts: I think at a higher price point, there are other burger options in SF (refer to my burger list) that would get you a better burger. In this category of high end burger joints though,  I would only put Pearls and their 7$ burger above this one. Certainly a good and decent burger, however.
author: Matt C.

description: Decent food. I had the salmon burger with onion rings, my boyfriend had the bleu cheese burger. Good, friendly service.
author: Latte Queen W.

description: Went here for the 3rd time the other night and it trumped my first 2 visits..... Bravo - awesome burgers (fresh and tasty)   Great fries.....and cold/fresh beer.... Great service too (all 3 times)
author: Mike S.

description:
sometimes you just need a burger.. or maybe a burger with blue cheese, bacon and a mitchells ice cream shake. big mouth is the spot to get all of the above and read the onion while you wait for your order to come up.
 the burgers are the perfect combo of just enough grease and char grilled tastiness to make your bad food choices good. portions are huge so i opt to order the big mouth baby burger from the kids menu.
steer clear of the salads-- this place specializes in things from the fryer or the grill. i opt to eat at home because the ambiance lacks and you end up smelling like a fry daddy if you stay to eat there.
author: CTP p.

description: Excellent made-to-order burgers and sandwiches at great prices (6-8$).  The garden burger and salmon burger are really good, and everything is customizable with a variety of tasty breads, spreads, and extras. All natural beef, good beer on tap too, and delicious fries. Haven't tried the shakes but they're made with Mitchell's so they gotta be good. Way better value than Joe's Cable Car.
author: Brian H.

description: I've always loved this place for their delicious hamburgers but lately I've discovered the 49er. Normally I'm not a fan of chicken breast on a burger bun instead of a hamburger patty, but Big Mouth's version is DELICIOUS! This recent discovery has made me decide to try everything on the menu. Next is the steak sandwich...stay tuned!
author: Reza E.

description: This is a very solid, classic, casual and relatively cheap burger place.  The burgers are reasonable, very good AND come with fries.  That's right.  You do not need to pay another $3-4 for what should come with the burger for crying out loud.  Low key place, kid friendly.  Even the turkey burger is good.  May not be worth traveling for, but if you are in the neighborhood, definitely worth it.  Good shakes too.  Has beer on tap, fyi.
author: Valerie W.

description: This place lived up to the Yelp hype, which is hard to do.  The burger was juicy and cooked just right, the french role was just the right amounts of chewy and crusty, and the fries were the best part.  Fresh cut and LONG, like farm-was-exposed-to-radiation long and crispy, not soggy or greasy as some have reported.  I think that depends on how fresh yours are (just like at Mickey D's).  The kid who rang me up was cool so I didn't experience the service problems others did.  Finally, I had their house beer, a lager I think, which went nicely with the burger.  I will definitely be back once my arteries unclog.  If you are up for a good burger, definitely try this place out.  Only better burger I've had is at Front Porch.
author: Al K.

description: I thought I'd give this place another chance, seeing as it's so close to my house and all.  Unfortunately it was the same deal: their burgers didn't have much flavor at all, even with the spreads they give you, and this is the SECOND time I've gotten sick from this place!  Last time I thought it was just some indigestion, but this time it was all-out food poisoning.  I would advise to avoid Big Mouth unless you like to regurgitate last night's dinner.
author: Stacey H.

description: Big Mouth Burger is probably my favorite burger place in the bay area. They get a lot of foot traffic at all hours of the day. Their menu is perfect in covering all tastes for burgers...from the classic beef burger to one vegetarian eggplant burger (which was surprisingly very good...tasted almost like a slice of vegetarian pizza). Good thing St. Luke's emergency room is just a couple blocks away!
author: Ray C.

description: I love their chicken and turkey burgers, however, they always want to give you a side and after finishing either sandwich I have no appetite leftover for the fries, which are HUGE and they always give you a lot. So then I feel wasteful. The other sides are coleslaw and beans (and these are sweet...gross!). But I love their burgers, they have a lot of options in terms of cheeses and condiments for your burgers. They also have Mitchell's ice cream for milkshakes and blackouts or root beer floats, and they have beer as well (maybe 2-3 options). Overall, a great place to come when you're hungry. There's not a whole lot of space inside, so it's not ideal for crowds of more than 5.
author: Gina R.

description: every bit as amazing as I would have imagined it. the Californian tasted amazzzing with the eggplant and mushrooms.  will definitely come back here again and try their onion rings!
author: Paran Y.

description: Maybe I caught them on a bad day. The burger and shake I got were plain ole nasty. The shake had a nasty taste too it. The burger seemed like it came from a ghetto mcdonalds...
author: Billy B.

description: A stellar veggie burger indeed...my favorite? The 80's music playing in the background. Oh..and the fries...they were great also. There's nothin' quite like a good burger and some beers.
author: Natalie C.

description: Good veggie burger with blue cheese for me. Nice neighborhood atmosphere, plus they serve beer with your burger. Thought the fries were mediocre.  Plus why, oh why, no onion rings?
author: Amy E.

description: I can only speak for one item on Big Mouth's menu . . . the Small Mouth burger, cause that's all I've had here.  It's around 5 bucks, comes with fries, and I'd say is about 1/3 pounder when it comes to the burger size.  I'd say the fries are my favorite here, tons of flavor, not even needing ketchup!  Plus, with the Small Mouth burger, I don't waddle out of the place feeling like I'm gonna explode.  That feeling usually kicks in 20 minutes later after I get Mitchell's ice cream for dessert!
author: Jeffrey H.

description:
My favorite burger joint in the city. Beer is good, fries are good, burgers are good, milkshakes are good, bathrooms are good, and the free water is good ole San Francisco tap. I cannot find a bad thing about this place.
I went in there about 9pm after work. I was really hungry and in the mission and I've been here many times so I knew what I was going to get. Once again I was not dissapointed. The burger was huge, not only was it filling but it tasted great. I got the blue cheese burger and it was loaded with melted blue cheese, since I got it to go I got to satisfy my craving for cheese paper (for those that don't know, its when the paper the burger is wrapped in has melted cheese on it and you get to pull the cheese off the paper and eat it). 
The service was also great. The place was packed, not an empty seat inside so I ordered my food to go and sat outside at the tables they have there. When my order was ready, the cashier/server came outside and brought me my food, I thought that was something she didn't have to do but did anyway.
author: D J.

description: This place is really good.  The turkey burger was well cooked and very tasty.  It wasn't so big or greasy that it was unmanageable and had lots of flavor.  They included some fresh steak-cut fries that made for a nice complement.  Although a little on the pricey side, I will definitely come back.
author: Ankur P.

description: Its aiight. The burgers didn't seem ginormous to me. The fries are steak fries...but they sell hotdogs, too! Which for some reason really impresses me. Hotdogs are sort of what is holding me back from vegetarianism...well among a couple other things...but, I digress. I guess this is a pretty good place to go if you don't want a cheaply made burger.
author: Yvonne Q.

description: Good, juicy burgers with as much fixings as you want.  Just be sure you save room for the crispy steak fries.  It's small and cramped inside, and on hot days you're beading up like sweaty balls.  But that's what cold beers are for.
author: Kimmie N.

description:
right on! i get to write review #100 for Big Mouth.  so, i'll keep it short.

this is a neighborhood gem: huge burgers, creative toppings, fantastic fries, and root beer floats made with Mitchell's ice cream. it's my favorite burger spot in the Mission, for sure.
author: Brady W.

description: This burger place is really good.  I had the blue cheese burger and it was great, they didn't over do it on the blue cheese either.  The burger was cooked perfectly and moist.  All the ingredients are fresh and the burger comes with most everything standard, unless you want bacon or something.  The "Frontier" steak sandwich can be chewy, but I've never had a steak sandwich that wasn't chewy.  The beer to get is Big Mouth's own "Mega Mouth" beer (on tap), it is a good pale ale that isn't too dark and heavy but has a light grainy taste that doesn't weigh down your stomach and complements a good burger.  My friend got the "49er" which is a chicken sandwich and he really liked it too.  They also have an eggplant sandwich and a veggie burger, but I haven't tried any of those.
author: Dustin S.

description:
insanely delicious fries...
steak fries that are extra extra crispy
which is the best way every for fries to be served
good veggie choices- 
read the menu over well before ordering because
there are more choices than you notice at first glance
and there is some fun stuff to work with
hubby LOVES the burgers there
he goes on and on about them
he likes all of the sandwiches and will name them off one by one
with a crazy look in his eyes...
yes the walls are covered in grease
and maybe it is a little dirty-
but they use super high quality ingredients and all of the workers are really nice
author: Maxine M.

description: Fantastic burgers and fries.  The service is tight, and they are really friendly.  I will always choose this place if I have the chance over Barney's and other places in the area that sell "gourmet" burgers that are overpriced.  Most of the time I go w/ the Blue Cheese Burger, which is always perfect.  The cooks do it right and don't overburden the burgers with the cheese.  The meat is quality and they serve up some herculean-sized burgers.  This is one of many joints in the Mission area, but it proves its worth over and over again.  Check it out!  My friend swears by the Salmon Burgers.
author: TJ D.

description:
every time i eat there i always end up in a food induced coma. the portions fill me up well, there are not many places that do that for my 6'4" 250 lbs self. before a long night being a bouncer at large night clubs i like getting my belly filled with the wholesome goodness that is burgers and by far my favorite fries in the city. 

sit back, relax, and grub on a juicy burger while drinking a nice root beer you will feel like a teenager again while people watching on this busy corner.
author: Mr. Rivet ..

description:
Veggie burger with avocado and cheddar on french roll with coleslaw. The burger was very large and substantial. The roll was big and filling but didn't overpower the rest of the burger. The patty was a little thin and didn't taste like a garden burger, there were a lot of avocado slices and you could see the cheddar falling out the sides. The coleslaw was very good - light and refreshing and a large portion. 

This is the best veggie burger I've had in SF.
author: Sarah J.

description: I moved to the mission about 6 months ago and my only complaint has been that it is hard to find a good ol' greasy burger. There's a few other options that are PRETTY good. But not quite the kind of burger joint I was looking for. My friend and I spotted big mouth burger a while ago and thought that we should try it out. We finally got around to it tonight and holy crap, it's good. Coming from the midwest where every thing is about beef and potatoes, this is probably the best burger / fry joint I have ever been to. I don't even understand how the mcdonald's down the street can even stay open with so much of a better option just down the street. I totally recommend this place to any one.
author: Eric W.

description: This place is great. The food is really good, and the people are nice. While I do enjoy the occasional "fancy" meal for a date night, nothing beats Big Mouth on a Friday night for yummy, homey food. I love that you can mix and match your toppings/sauces. No "When Harry Met Sally" moments for me! I can just order a la carte without asking them to hold this, and add that.  Why can't more places be this simple?
author: Ann F.

description: Pretty good size burgers. Love the fries BUT avoid the coleslaw at all cost, it's weak and tasteless.
author: Shawna C.

description:
Decent burger, dirty interior.

The standard Big Mouth burger was tasty, the fries decent, and Dreamboat enjoyed his veggie burger. They weren't stingy with the extra avocado I ordered. But the floor, tables, and every visible surface seemed sticky and greasy, and that creeped me out overall. 

With a little help from Mr. Clean, this could be a great place!
author: kelly r.

description: One of the best burger's I've ever had. Try the bleu cheese burger!
author: D D.

description:
very pedestrian hamburger

sorry, i'd write more, but i'm still recovering from one hellish of a weekend and i have a migraine the size of texas right now.  

more to come...
author: boola h.

description: I bought the Blue Cheese burger with fries and I have to say it was excellent. Cooked to perfection with really fresh vegetables. Everything was great about this place except for the parking.
author: Danny K.

description: Two friends and I went to this burger joint last week. Well nothing special here folks. The burgers are average tasting but the onion rings were pretty good. Be warned this place packs on the grease. If your in the area and need a quick bite to eat this place is an option, not a must go though.
author: THE REAL K.

description: I don't even eat red meat and I love this place.  I get cravings for their salmon burger on toasted whole wheat bun.  Juicy, fresh, never "fishy" tasting.  Ask for the mango salsa on top - heavenly.  I was less excited about their eggplant and grilled red pepper on focaccia, however - a bit too oily.  Caesar salad is pretty tame, as is the cole slaw, but I have to agree with the others about the fries.  Mmm.  Super friendly staff as well.  However, the best thing by far about this place is that huge yawning toothy mouth of a logo.  Brilliant.
author: Esther K.

description: I've walked past here many times after getting off bart and wondered if it was any good. So today I told myself to go in. When I walked in I had an odd sensation that I was bothering the cashier. Oh well, maybe the food will be good. Now I don't know about you, but I'm pretty picky about my burgers and I would put this in the same category as the six dollar burger from carls jr. The meat is overcooked, the buns are cheap and flavorless, and the whole atmosphere of the place isn't too inviting. Go somewhere else, like Chez Maman, for a good burger.
author: Robbie L.

description: Is it try that your burger business is going to expand and come to the bayhill shopping center in san bruno, ca
author: b b.

description: The burger taste not too bad. I wish they made the patties plumper, not flat and wide (probably for easier cooking) I had ordered the hamburger with chortle mayo with Monterrey jack. It was pretty good. I would avoid the cheese so I could enjoyed the full meat taste. It came with cut fries with skin on!
author: S.K. Y.

description:
short and sweet....this place has the most tasty burgers in the mission. and they are big....i get a kids meal its so big. great burger, toasty buns, great toppings, my fave fries around...and you can get great dips for fries. i get the chipotle mayo. not quite fritz on the dips, but still good none the less. i really love this place. its a little dirty and they could totally use a remodel. i sooooo want to paint this place and make look as good as the food is. 

root beer floats are worth it too...
author: kelly M.

description: Surprisingly gourmet burgers for a semi-sketchy hole-in-the-wall joint. I think mine was smothered in blue cheese and mushrooms or something. It was tastey, as were the fries. And the name is accurate, because the burgers are quite large. We did take-out and the restaurant isn't high on atmosphere, but there is some seating. The lady at the counter was very nice and the service is pretty quick. Definitely a good place to satisfy a burger craving.
author: Caitlin H.

description: I freakin love love love big mouth burger. I live blocks away and eat their veggie burger with grilled onions and bbq sauce at least 3 times a week. fries are great, coleslaw great, baked beans great, root beer float great. Go there, eat there, often.
author: malia S.

description: Great burgers. They have a good selection of toppings and breads for the burgers, too. The fries are awesome!
author: Velma G.

description: if you get a burger get the spicy chipotle mayo, if you dont. thats your bad and your lose. the fries are really thick as well too. good burgers good prices. get the damn spicy mayo already
author: Matthew R.

description: Tasty......but they really don't bring the heat for the money they charge.  I ordered a double cheese burger (not on the menu) and they didn't know what to do.  They charged me 14.00$  for it and put both slices on one patty.  The food is good fries good but whatever.
author: TriplePork J.

description: staff very nice, clean bathroom just looked seedy due to taggin n tons of paper towels in trash  (but it was busy),food hella good, not greasy, tons of food for ur money. couldnt finish it all and i was off an empty stomach, a blunt + im a big gurl still had to take food home. i had the big mouth burger on a wheat bun, reg mayo, bacon, pepper jack, avocado and grilled onions + fries, no room for a drink  --very tastey the next day as well
author: Miss L.

description: Totally fair burger prices. Not the best burger ever eaten, but good, fair, delicious and lots of it (mmmm fries).
author: Portly P.

description: Burger are pretty big...but I guess that's why they're called Big Mouth. They give you you also some big fries to go with that. The burger tasted OK. It wasn't like fast food, but I did not have any foodgasms either. It's also somewhat pricey for just 1 burger, but it should fill you up.
author: Mina G.

description: this place is really great to get a burger from. i can't remember which burger i order but it was great!! i had my burger with a side order of fries while my boyfriend was able to enjoy his burger with a salad. so it was a win-win for both of us.
author: Lisbeth C.

description: I live a block away from Big Mouth, it's on my walk home from BART and I STILL won't go in there for a burger. It's retardedly over priced and the burgers just aren't that great. If I go there (and it's always someone else's idea) I'll get a burger with nothing, take it home and put my own god damn fixings on it. It's like 3 dollars cheaper and what I have it home is probably more fresh anyway. I'll also say that their onion rings and fries BLOW. There is a tini tiny sliver and I am pretty sure that they are frozen. Did I mention that the girl who was working the cash register last time I went there was a boring, sort of bitchy character? If I'm going to pay 10 bucks for a god damn burger, I want my meal served with a god damn smile and a 'have a nice day'. In short, this place blows, walk to Burger Joint right down Valencia, they are pricey but have better burgers or just go to McDonalds down 24th, you can get 2 burgers and a sundae and a soft drink for the price of one f-ing burger at Big Mouth.
author: Alexandra F.

description: Another great find.  Standard burgers cost less than $6, but add 95 cents each for cheese, bacon, avocado, etc.  You can choose your bread, such as foccacia, regular bun, french roll ... and your spread ... like pesto!!!!, spicy mayo, BBQ and others.  They also serve a few other sandwiches, like chicken, steak, sausage, and a blue cheese burger that sounds great (and seems to sell pretty well) served with pesto aioil.  Fries are included, and are really great.  Instead of fries, you can have beans or cole slaw,  for you carb watchers  The slaw is pretty good, but needs more pepper and horseradish.  I like a good, nasal clearing slaw.  They also have a passalbe caeser salad.  It's a great deal, at about  $6, for a plain, no frills burger.  The place could use a good scrubbing though ... the counter and tables were a bit sticky.  There is something for everybody, even a garden burger.  But the TV selection has to go.  For some reason, I found myself watching the Comcast info channel.  Not the first time it's been on either!
author: Michael M.

description:
it was good, not great.  i think i would've given it four stars if it hadn't been so expensive.  each topping is like a 1.50 so you can imagine how that adds up if you just want a few things on your burger.  

i hate to bring it up, but it really makes me wish five guys were here.  the burgers at big mouth are fresh and tasty, but again the price kinda ruined it.  plus the beers on tap are as expensive as being at a bar.  if i'm at a burger joint, i prefer my beer to be a bit cheaper, even if it is on tap.  

anyway, i'm sure some people think that an 11 dollar burger is normal, not me though.
author: shar d.

description: nice juicy burger and a pint of microbrew accompanied me as i perused a newly gifted Zagat guide on the afternoon of my birthday. there were a few people around, big mouth was humming along like a well oiled burger joint and provided me with just the right amount of greasy goodness on a lazy weekday afternoon. not too shabby. not too shabby at all!
author: ray e.

description: This is the first tasty burger that I have had in a long time.  I suggest adding bacon and make sure you get the grilled onions.  You can get a nice pint of draft beer.  The fries are great.  They even have Mitchell's ice cream which is a first for me.  Fantastic burger joint!
author: Matt J.

description: drool drool gurgle gurgle best mmmm burger (BURP!) fries crunch crunch americancheesemeltingintobigburgerpickleslettucebun COME TO MAMA!!!!!
author: Emmabelle S.

description:
i cant say this is as good as it get because i have only lived in SF for a month..


but my experience compared to anything back in arizona was great. 

not too pricy, and big portions

very tasty, and  some beer on tap as well.. 

friendly staff.

music playing was amazing!!!!!....if you own the "NOW" volume 1-14 16-22...
apparently they lost it with 15..

...ignore the music. and just eat your burger.
author: R M.

description: big mouth burger, good butger, cheap, huge servings
author: Leigh McInnis Lee G.

description: i love it! it becomes an instant favorite. i love it's root beer float. they fill mitchell's ice cream all the way to the top and give you the root beer separtely (of course i finished the ice cream first, hee hee). the burger was big and yummy and comes with a side. you have the choice of cole slaw, baked beans or salad. i won't recommend the cole slaw. it is not very good at all. but i was happy with everything else. service was friendly and burger was huge. (i almost couldn't finished it). and mitchell's ice cream is always fabulous.
author: Cindy L.

description: By far the best burger I have ever had, I go to Big mouth at least once a week and never been disapointed.
author: ibrahim d.

description: Decent burger joint but I'm not crazy about it.  Had their Big Mouth burger on focaccia bread with spicy mayo dressing.  Good taste but the meat was overcooked.  Doesn't make sense to overcook good quality meat if that's what they claim they serve.  Comes with fries in a generous portion.  Next time you stop by make sure to mention how you'd want the meat cooked and what bread and dressing you'd like to have because they simply don't ask.
author: Evan S.

description: Very ordinary.  Quality of meat not very high.  Doesn't compare to the taste of a quality burger like BurgerMeister or Barney's or even a few bars like The Phoenix or Liberties.
author: Tom Z.

description: its definetly better than the 15 dollar burger at cable joes car
author: NAEL K.

description: What a burger! I just tried Pearls Deluxe burger 2 days ago and it doesn't have anything on Big Mouth! Good Beef, good fries, and great Beer!! I been about 5 time and I've always been happy!!!
author: Mike B.

description: the milkshakes could have been thicker and the coleslaw was gross. but then again coleslaw is always gross so i shouldn't have ordered it. the salmon burger was goodish but left me feeling ill.
author: Renee L.

description: I have to work hard at resisting this place at lunchtime.  I have only had their gardenburgers and love their variety of breads and toppings--not to mention their french fries...YUM!  The service is also quick and friendly and the price is reasonable.
author: christine t.

description: Beef burger was overcooked and the bitch behind the counter had an attitude - unprofessional service. If it wasn't for their gimmicky sauces the hipster crowd would have clotted up Burger Joint a few streets down. Oh, I like their fries.
author: Wanky F.

description: Incredibly good veggie burger.  I didn't even need to ask for anything else on it.  Most places in town cook veggie burgers as long as they cook regular burgers which means that they end up way-overcooked.  These were delicious and the wheat bun was divine.
author: d l.
